We were also very impressed with the upgrades that were done in our room- the Casa Surf Room, especially the bedroom/bathroom area. The art was not something we would have in our home, but we enjoyed the whole theme. The bed was very comfortable and we could even see the ocean from our small window to the West. The old-fashioned crank out windows on the PCH side of our room did a decent job of cutting down on the noise from traffic, but next time we will try and get a room on the ocean side. The rooftop bar/restaurant was a real treat also. What a view! Plus we want to give a
Manager Response: We are so grateful for your compliments about our staff, your room and the restaurants.  We look forward to helping you book that ocean side room, falling asleep to the sound of the ocean seems like the only thing you missed on your trip.  See you soon!

Summary: Friendly staff, comfortable bed, great location. I appreciated the mini fridge. Breakfast was hot, and could be enjoyed in a courtyard with a lovely fountain. I would have liked an option for real cream in my coffee or a cappuccino. I guess I‚Äôll opt for the mimosa next time.
Manager Response: Thank you Marykay_scheid!  We agree, a mimosa is always a good idea and we appreciate your review!

Summary: My husband and I stayed at La Casa El Camino for a birthday weekend away. Just as the reviews said, the staff was amazing and very accommodating. Knowing it was a birthday celebration, they provided a bottle of champagne that was waiting for us in our room. We stayed in a surf themed room and it was spacious and newly redecorated. The Rooftop bar was just as pictured, beautiful views. I recommend getting a reservation a couple days in advance so you get a table with a view. The front desk was very helpful in getting us a table right before sunset on a night that was shoulder to shoulder up there.  The hotel is on the block of the beach, so a very short walk to a nice place to relax on the sand. Towels and chairs are provided by the hotel. We walked a couple blocks toward town
Manager Response: We sincerely appreciate your review and loved reading it, darsweet. Thank you so much for sharing about your stay with us with your fellow travelers.  Thank you, thank you, thank you!

Summary: We stayed at this hotel for two nights.  The location is perfect for ocean lovers.  We sat on the rooftop watching the surfers.  The ocean view is perfect!  The front desk staff was very friendly!  Our room was quaint...  The only uncomfortable part of the room was the noisy, portable AC.  Breakfast was delicious with interesting choices.  They hold a cheese and wine tasting Monday - Thursday for hotel guests (which we missed)...
Manager Response: We are so happy that you enjoyed your stay!  Thank you for taking a moment to share your experience.  We're sorry about the A/C! The portable options tend to be on the noisy side, but we want to make sure our guests are comfortable since our old building was not built with central A/C back in 1929.   We hope to see you back soon.

Summary: This was a last minute getaway to celebrate a birthday.  The hotel was lovely and the staff was outstanding.  The staff really went out of their way to make this a special trip.  As soon as you step out of the hotel, you can hear the surf.  The view from the roof top bar overlooking the ocean is wonderful.    It was a perfect stay.  We look forward to returning.
Manager Response: TJobari, thank you so much for your review!  We love celebrations and appreciate you letting us be a part of yours. We look forward to you coming back as well for more Rooftop Lounge views and a little R&R!

Summary: We went to the roof bar just before sunset at the happy hour and enjoyed the beautiful view with drinks. The appetizer choices can be improved though. The service was good. The view is just fantastic. The atmosphere is relaxing.
Manager Response: Thanks for joining us at The Rooftop Lounge!  You'll have to check out the Al Fresco Dinner Menu we have during the winter Sunday through Thursday nights or come for Brunch to get a larger variety of food offerings.  We appreciate the review.

Summary: Fantastic location overlooking the coast, staff is friendly, and rooms are fun! Be prepared to take lots of stairs to get around hotel. Breakfast buffet was lovely! You can eat in the cute courtyard, I enjoyed taking my coffee overlooking the coast just steps away.
Manager Response: Workingatxmom, thank you for staying with us and sharing!  We appreciate your tips about the stairs and enjoying the coffee overlooking the Pacific Ocean.  Thank you so much!

Summary: What a beautiful little hotel! I felt like I was in Europe. The employees were all extremely nice and professional and made me feel great! The food was WONDERFUL and well priced. The rooftop deck is great. The included breakfast was fabulous and the attendant there was very accommodating. So glad I found this place and look forward to returning soon.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your wonderful review of our hotel, restaurants and employees.  We look forward to your next "European vacation", manningtownwc!

Summary: The hotel is a Spanish style hacienda which makes it unique in this beach community.  Disappointing was the walk-to beach, which is very small and rocky, plus it virtually disappears at high tide.  The rooms are small, which is ok, given the ambience, but relatively expensive.  A plus is the lobby bar with piano entertainment.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us Ultimo11!  Laguna Beach itself is quite a quirky town from the local business to the local beaches, just full of character.  While the beaches are breathtaking, you are right, knowing the tides is a bonus since there is little sand during the high tide. We are so happy you enjoyed our lobby entertainment during your stay as well.

Summary: My hunny and I mixed a little work with pleasure and stayed at La Cass. We‚Äôve stayed before and love the cozy little bar and boutique charm, and this time we were wowed by a bottle of bubbles, $100 restaurant credit and delicious and simple breakfast.  Plus, one can never beat a really pretty beachside stay in Laguna.
Manager Response: We love romantic getaways!  I'm so glad you enjoyed all the extras so your could enjoy the special time with each other, we'll be here for your next spontaneous rendezvous, bonston03_10.

Summary: Staff and charm is what makes this place work!  Room 314 is a premium room at an upgraded price and the shower head leaks like crazy, the shower doesn't drain and the TV turns pink after a few minutes.  I reported the TV with no remedy in 3 days of the stay. Bathroom window won't close as the turn knob is stripped out as well.   I'll stay again and again, but I feel at $180 per night the maintenance needs to be stepped up a bit.
Manager Response: Disler2018, thank you for staying with us and most importantly letting us know how we can improve.  I have shared this with my Maintenance and Team so we can address those concerns.  We are so sorry that Rip Curl wasn't at it's best during your visit, please let us know when you plan to return and we'd love to make it up to you!

Summary: The most fantastic location next to the ocean, and in the heart of the beautiful artsy Laguna Beach. Great Rooftop bar with stunning views day or night!!! Delicious cocktails. A very nice complimentary breakfast.
Manager Response: Natashah11211, we are thrilled that you loved your time with us.  Thank you for staying with us and sharing your experience!

Summary Heading: La Casita at La Casa Was Terrible!
Summary: This is my first time ever writing a negative review, but it is necessary.  Please do not waste your money at La Casita at La Casa Del Camino. I booked through Air BnB for my birthday and had the worst experience ever.  The beach cottage is close to the beach, but not on the beach. There is a slight view of the ocean from the upstairs loft, but beware they are building a house directly in front of the cottage, so it not only blocks the view, but you will hear drilling and hammering the entire time.  My group of friends and I checked in in the middle of December, for a quick peaceful getaway. Only to find out that the Heat was broken.  We called the front desk around 6pm, when the temperature outside dropped to 50 degrees and they said they were sending someone to fix it.  Long
Manager Response: Hello Creesy, we are so sorry about your recent experience at La Casita and appreciate your feedback. I apologize about our lack of communication and that the furnace broke during your stay, this was unexpected and should have been handled differently.  We found that the furnace was not repairable and has since been completely replaced. Rather than issue a refund, all of your restaurant purchases which equaled more than 50% of your stay was waived upon check out, never showing on your card so you would not see a refund.  Airbnb felt this was fair as well.  I can understand your frustration but sincerely appreciate you sharing this with us . We are truly saddened that this was not the experience that we pride ourselves on.

Summary: I went to this restaurant with my family  on the way back from Newport Beach to San Diego for Happy Hours and I loved it. It is also a nice hotel. We had drinks and appetizers on the rooftop lounge overlooking the ocean. Drinks and food were both very good, and the stafff was very friendly
Manager Response: So glad you enjoyed Happy Hour with us Veronique C!  We hope we will be on your list of stops during your next journey.

Summary: I really enjoyed this hotel. The location was great, as was the rooftop lounge!  Matthew at the front desk couldn't have been nicer: he was very friendly, made me feel very welcome, was very accommodating in every way, and explained everything about the hotel to me perfectly. He's the perfect person to have at a front desk!
Manager Response: Thank you for kicking off 2018 with us!  We are glad you enjoyed your stay and we can't wait to share this with Matt.  We hope to see you for another getaway before the year is over.

Summary: This historic hotel built in 1929 has the quirks of any old building but the service ambiance and views more than make up for any small inconvenience. We stayed over Christmas in a surf room. You have a view of the ocean over the buildings. Out the other side you over look the Coast highway. The rooms have been redecorated and have awesome art work. Bed was very firm, to much for me but my wife loved it. The staff were very friendly and helpful even though they were working Christmas Eve and day. We enjoyed the view from the rooftop getting a table is hit or miss a lot of people know about this place. We ate twice at Avila‚Äôs Mexican restaurants cross the street excellent food. The walk to the beach is easier if you go down a block, beautiful sandy beach. If you are looking for
Manager Response: Mopar05, we are so happy that you enjoyed your Christmas with us this year. Thank you for sharing your experience at our hote, the surf room and Rooftop Lounge with fellow travelers. When you head back, let us know!  Hotel guests get a secret perk of Rooftop reservations so you can really enjoy that view.  Cheers!

Summary: I stayed at this gorgeous hotel with my boyfriend. We stayed on the 1st floor and still had a wonderful view of the ocean. The hotel has a great fun vibe throughout and still has a historical feel. The gal and guy at the front desk who checked us in couldn‚Äôt have been better. They were caring, genuine, energetic, and provided excellent customer service. I was very impressed. The room is charming and I was impressed with the bathroom! Excellent water pressure in shower too. The only difficulty was noise from the restaurant bussers in the service elevator however the team was apologetic and understanding. K‚Äôya and the rooftop bar cannot be missed! Absolutely amazing food and views! Same with breakfast. Seriously the best breakfast I‚Äôve ever had at a hotel. I would recommend la
Manager Response: Thank you so much Coco G! We were ecstatic to read and share your review with the team. We love our guests and I am beyond thrilled to know you think of our team and hotel as number one.  Come see us again soon!

Summary: We loved our stay at Casa del Camino!  We left Santa Barbara to escape the CA fires.  Uncertain that we could get to Laguna, we called their front desk and had the very good fortune to speak to Matthew.  After checking online he assured us that the 101 Southbound was open.  Service over and beyond!  Once we arrived, we got an upgrade. Matthew also recommended their rooftop restaurant where we ate both lunch and dinner - great!  Manager's reception in the courtyard where the ‚Äúwine woman‚Äù was so nice, even showing up later with a bottle of Cava -  complements of Matthew!   A real breakfast next morning (included) sent us off relaxed and calm.  Definitely don't recommend being in CA when there's a fire -  or driving through one -  but do recommend Casa del Camino.
Manager Response: Wow, thank you so  much for all the kind words about our staff and hotel, Roeypicks. We appreciate you staying with us during such a difficult time as well as taking a moment to share about your time spent with us.  We love that you got to take advantage of Rooftop, Breakfast and Wine and Cheese.  You'll have to return for K'ya and some more beach time soon!

Summary Heading: Great place for you and your best friend
Summary: Loved the ocean view room . Super welcoming to dog. The hotel could do with some renovations. Definitely walk down to the beach only steps away. The late 4 pm check in was a bit inconvenient but the staff tried to get the room ready faster. Get the pet package and enjoy the roof top bar.
Manager Response: We absolutely love visits from the furry babies, best four legged friends.  Thank you for bringing them along for the getaway, Hilarym2018! Thank you for your review and hope you both will be back again for another treat.

Summary Heading: Excellent except for a couple of issues with handicap access.
Summary: No one on the staff could operate the chair lift for wheelchairs that is between the 2nd floor and the Lobby/Bar/Resturant.  This means that a person in a wheelchair must travel on the elevator to the 1st floor, exit the hotel on the side exit and then negotiate the hill from there to the front door of the hotel.  The side entrance has a lip that must be negotiated which could cause a wheelchair bound person to tip over backwards.  The ADA room on the 3rd floor with a roll-in shower was adequate for individuals in a wheelchair.  The hotel and the Roof Top bar and observation area are just superb.  All of the staff throughout the hotel are very accommodating and eager to help.
Manager Response: Bill_Namauscout, thank you so much for bringing this to my attention.  I appreciate you sharing this with us and I will make it a priority.  Thank you also for the kind words about the staff, we hope you will visit again soon.

Summary: This was our favorite place to go for the most amazing drinks AND food!  I know everyone talks about the rooftop lounge, which has amazing views, but if you want the best drinks in town. with a warm, inviting, cozy atmosphere......you need to venture to this small quaint bar! We enjoyed listening to music both evenings we visited. We loved our yummy plates of food while sipping on our drinks made with so much love by friendly smiling bartenders! See you next time!
Manager Response: Thank you SallylovesScott!  We are so glad that you loved your visit to K'ya, it is our little gem and is such a great little spot for amazing food and good ambiance.  Can't wait til next time.

Summary Heading: This is a fantastic hotel.  Charming, cozy and most importantly, not a corporate cookie cutter place
Summary: Charming hotel with a superb location on Laguna Beach.  The best thing about this place is the staff - they are exceptionally friendly and helpful.  For example, when I asked where the vending machines were on morning, the lady at the front desk explained that the hallways are too narrow for them, so there are none.  When I subsequently asked if there was a nearby place I could buy a diet pepsi, she walked around to the closed bar and provided two to me, gratis.  You won't see that type of service at a Hilton or Marriott.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your awesome review!  We really try to bring a unique experience to our guests because we are definitely not a cookie cutter establishment, we're just filled with character.  The amazing team we have help us bring to life all the magic inside of this historic box.  Thanks Sean657483, we appreciate you.

Summary: To begin with - your staff was absolutely wonderful - so polite, respectful, friendly and willing to help us in any way possible. For an older hotel, we were pleasantly surprised by all that you offer.  My husband was especially happy because we have stayed at newer hotels that have televisions much smaller than the one in our room.  I really liked the bathroom - it was just so pretty.  Maybe one suggestion for the room would be to add some artwork, and a second suggestion would be to have lights installed in the parking lot which is a short distance from the hotel.
Manager Response: We are so thankful to have been a part of your Christmas Getaway! I look forward to sharing your kind words with the team.

Summary: Rooftop bar atop the casa del Camino in Laguna offers great views, tasty cocktails, nice appetizers and very friendly staff. Reasonable prices. There is a convenient elevator to the rooftop. The make a great mojito.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I highly recommend La Casa del Camino. The location is perfect, the staff far exceeded my expectations and the rooftop bar gives you the best view in Laguna. We will definitely stay here again on our next trip to Laguna Beach.
Manager Response: Sarawasson88, thank you for the recommendation and 5 star review.  We are thrilled that we were able to make you a return guest, that is the biggest compliment of all. Until next time!

Summary Heading: Because of all the warmth this place makes me feel
Summary: I always prefer this hotel when I am at Laguna, even if surf &sand has rooms with much more space and a spa, mainly because of the warm, cosy, welcome feeling I get when I m at this hotel. I love the lobby at night time, you never feel you are on the other side of the world from your home. The breakfast is small but tasty and cosy. The staffs helpfullness feels always natural, and relaxed.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Beautiful location. My room was on the smaller side, quaint place. Comfortable. All staff was very friendly and welcoming. Breakfast was perfect. Cute little place to eat. I would definitely stay again. Hope this was helpful.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us Wynn_11-2017, we're happy to know you had a great experience!

Summary: The hotel is a gorgeous boutique hotel with a very Spanish influence in its decor taste. Classic and trendy. The views are not as great as we expected, we got an oceanfront room in a lower floor, and it had no view whatsoever. We actually had to look from above the roof in front of us or from between the building to see any of the ocean, which we barely did anyway!  The service is decent.   The restaurant was gorgeous and the food was fantastic!
Manager Response: Tarek E, thank you for sharing with us!  We are sorry about the view, we definitely try to emphasize that we have partial views - as there are residences between us and the ocean, but it sounds like we can do a better job.  We agree that the decor is pretty awesome and the food in the restaurants is top notch.  We hope to see you again soon.

Summary: I have stayed at this hotel many times over the years.  This time was for Thanksgiving.  The standard rooms are very small and basic so one really needs to pay an upgrade fee of $40 to be comfortable.  There is also a $16 resort fee added daily.  My stay was ok - not great.  Breakfast is served down in a small courtyard and depending on what time you arrive - the food could be way over cooked as it‚Äôs served buffet style.  That said, there is a decent choice.  The hotel has a good location and a nice roof top bar for sunset.  The carpets are a little worn and it could do with an overhaul.  The staff were nice and accommodating.
Manager Response: none

Summary: ... or you'll end up in the basement.   I originally booked this through Hotel Tonight as it was listed as a "charming" hotel. But that couldn't be farther from my experience. We checked in in the late evening and were given the last room available on the ground floor. As soon as we walked in, the place smelled like mildew. The room was tiny, the bathroom was even smaller, and the bed was nearly impossible to sleep on. It honestly felt like something out of a horror movie.  Even college dorms aren't this uncomfortable or menacing...
Manager Response: Adambarbersf, we are sorry to hear about your experience at our hotel.  Our lobby is on the second floor, which adds to our unique character, but it sounds like you were placed on our first floor.  Many of our guests prefer these rooms because of the beautiful hard wood floors, but I could imagine the hotel set up being a bit awkward having not seen it in the day.  We hope you'll give us another opportunity in the future so that you can see how charming our hotel is.

Summary: The location of the property was excellent....within one block of the ocean.....well within walking distance to many of the restaurants, art galleries, and boutiques...as well as the beaches, in Laguna Beach....Chris was an excellent host and more than accommodated us....the bottles of wine and water were a really nice touch
Manager Response: none

Summary: Loved the room and the food in the restaurant downstairs and also the continental breakfast was delicous. Service at the rooftop bar was the only thing lacking, our server was a bit short and looked upset the entire time. Overall, great stay
Manager Response: Thank you tfry0255 for letting us take care of you on your trip to Laguna Beach, more importantly, that we were able to win you over with 5 stars!  We appreciate you letting us know about your experience at the Rooftop Lounge, hopefully, you'll let us take another shot at that on your next visit.

Summary: The hotel was incredibly charming but the room left something to be desired. It was clean but a bit run-down. There were holes in the curtains. the bathroom window didn't close, and the air conditioner was portable, not forced air. We visited the rooftop bar and enjoyed a glass of wine and overall we had a nice time.
Manager Response: JessicaB90717, thank you for sharing with us and will let our team know about the areas where we can improve in the room.  The Rooftop Lounge is the perfect place to enjoy a nice glass of wine!

Summary Heading: Pretty good at La Casa del Camino
Summary: La Casa del Camino is a very nice property in Laguna Beach. It sits on the beach and if you are lucky enough to get a beach front room I'm sure it's lovely. Our room didn't have a  beach view, however, it overlooked a patio. I was surprised how quiet our room was considering there was an active night scene in the downstairs lobby which was only one flight of stairs away. The room we stayed in was the Spanish room with a king size bed. The room is quite small, however, the bed was comfortable and the sheets were fabulous. The room was very clean and well taken care of each day. The room had an air conditioner that sat on the floor and kept the room a cool 68 degrees all night long with just the right white noise that somehow drowned out any other noise from the street and lobby.
Manager Response: Thank you Mary Ellen, we are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your visit with us and appreciate your feedback.

Summary: This hotel is quaint and lovely.  The rooftop bar is amazing!  It seemed to be the happy hour spot for everyone in town.  We were here for a wedding reception on the rooftop.  The food, service and sunset were amazing!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We are B&B owners, The Topanga Canyon Inn in Topanga, California, adjacent to Malibu, so we know the business end of hosting.  The owners have done a great job here at a very affordable price.  The room was very nice, great mattress and bedding, very good bath, terrific, complimentary breakfast and friendly, professional staff. We will return, and that says it all.
Manager Response: Thank you for the wonderful compliment!  Knowing that we've earned a return guest does say it all, we look forward to being a part of your next travel plans to Laguna Beach.

Summary Heading: Awesome small hotel in awesome location
Summary: My husband and I spent two nights here in Oct. 2017. The hotel is small, clean, and close in to all of the restaurants, art galleries, and literally just steps from the ocean. The staff was wonderfully friendly, the updated room was terrific with incredible art work adorning the walls.
Manager Response: Thank you Cynthia L.  Thank you for staying with us, we hope you'll get another opportunity to explore Laguna Beach with us another time soon!

Summary: Beautiful hotel, very close to the beach. Rooftop bar overlooking the sea is lovely and has a good happy hour. The hotel provides towels and parasols that you can use on the beach. We stayed in the roxy room and loved the decor.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: A little bit of Spain without the pain(of a long flight)
Summary: The Casa provides old world charm, a very hospitable staff, great food and a wonderful location.  Located next to one of the best surfing spots in Laguna Beach, it is a must stay for anyone who loves water sports.
Manager Response: Cycleman42, thanks for the surfing tip along with a wonderful review.  Glad to know we were able to come through and make your Laguna Beach/Spain visit a memorable one.

Summary: Two nights at La Casa and we found it just about perfect. I had booked the petite room and even my tall, lanky frame was fine. We were ready to upgrade if we felt uncomfortable but this was not the case. A portable AC unit kept the room chill.  The brick bath shower was huge and one of the best on our holidays. The rooftop patio was packed and no draft beer available but we found the little 8 seater bar at the entrance was fantastic, particularly at happy hour where appetizers from the restaurant were half price.  And this is where the  characters were. Three different locals agreed the menu is second to none in all Laguna Beach so we enjoyed their company and food suggestions, Our server behind the bar was superb ( Alexandria ?)   It was a tapas type night just ordering
Manager Response: Danny M, thank you for staying with us!  We loved reading your review of the hotel, K'ya Bar and breakfast, I know your fellow trip advisor travelers will appreciate as well.  Let us know if you return, we extend reservations at the Rooftop to our hotel guests when available.  Happy Travels!

Summary: Been wanting to stay here based on the pics posted. So I booked a night for my husbands birthday. But now I can say "check in the box."  Let me get to the point...  The Cons: hotel parking was located across the street behind another business. Check in is at 4p. I arrived at 3:50p and no rooms were available yet. Since I wasn't in a rush, I didn't mind to wait. The employee at the desk was very sweet & apologized. She said she had one of the bigger rooms available. So I got excited! Well when we got to our room, I was sadly disappointed! The rooms were very small. We stayed in a corner room (108) it was very oddly shaped. My husband and I both stubbed our toe on the corner of the bed a few separate times.   The Pros: cute Spanish style decor in the entrance. Rooftop bar with a
Manager Response: We appreciate letting us take care of you and sharing about your experience with us.  We are sorry to hear that we disappointed you, we do try to explain about our historic hotels by providing our guest with square footage and descriptions so that our guests understand that our rooms are on the smaller side.  Thank you again for checking that box, we hope you'll give us another opportunity in the future.

Summary: We stayed here for our anniversary back in May. This place was beautiful. I thought our room was great and comfortable. Walking distance to the ocean which I thought was wonderful. Lots of restaurants walking distance as well. they even have there own restaurant. The only thing I did not like was the breakfast. The are where they serve breakfast was too small and not much of a variety in food either. For 16 dollars I was expecting much more. Other than that I would stay here again!
Manager Response: Thank you Veronicadebillar30!  We are thrilled to know that you enjoyed your Anniversary stay and had an opportunity to explore the area.  The $16 dollar Resort fee also covers the wi-fi, parking, access to the Art of Fitness Gym as well as available beach chairs, umbrellas and towels in addition to the breakfast offering.  We hope you will get a chance to come back and take advantage of everything we have to offer!

Summary: Enjoyed the room, easy access as we were traveling with our small dog.  The view is awesome, the breakfast amazing and the staff were very friendly.  Loved the bathroom and the open concept shower area, great idea!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Booked through Hotels Tonight. Great room. Very friendly staff. Recommend the Roof Top for drinks and awesome sunset then restaurant for dinner. Overall really enjoyed our stay and will definitely be back.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great staff (young woman) at the desk!!  That really made this stay better than usual - very courteous, friendly and explained all our amenities that came with Travelzoo reservation, parking instructions (just a block away), voucher for the rooftop bar which was great, and ensured we knew free breakfast hours.  She even called to see if we might join the free wine tasting that was due to close in 10 min, and it still held open even after we re-parked the car and brought our luggage into the room. The room was funky but nice decor, including nice bathroom tile, even if the carpet was a bit worn.  The only complaint was that the breakfast buffet did not seem to be refreshed regularly - at 9:00 when we arrived the bacon was nothing but bits, the eggs pretty dry, a piece of french
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great place to stay in Laguna Beach
Summary: Hotel is located a 1/2 block from a secluded bench, they supplies you free beach towels, beach chairs and umbrellas for the day, free wine and cheese in the afternoon, and the most beautiful view of the coast from their rooftop deck bar/restaurant.  I almost forgot the delicious Tapas restaurant in the lobby. All the staff is wonderful! I enjoyed my stay, I hope you do as well.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is an older property and some of the common area are a bit tired. The room we had was renovated and nice, the portable AC unit worked great. It's only steps to the beach, i.e. maybe 50 if you leave from the side hotel entrance. The included morning breakfast wasn't elaborate, but actually prefect. The afternoon wine and cheese was great. The rooftop bar is worth seeing. Note - it's hard to get a reservation there. If you really want a table there's a $150 charge which seemed a bit much. However given the view am guessing it keeps people from squatting. Just get there early for sunset and be patient. Every hotel employee we encountered was very friendly and helpful. Have read comments about poor customer service but we had non w of that. Parking was a block away, quite easy.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us Jay1375 and we love knowing you had an overall 5 star experience.  Next time you return, let us know if you would like a reservation for the Rooftop in advance.  This is something special we extend for our hotel guests.

Summary: Travel Zoo offered a bargain rate at La Casa del Camino; we checked out the reviews, and it seemed a good opportunity for a two night midweek beach stay for my birthday.  We arrived late, 10:30,  after an Angels game. The lobby at night just seemed to be a large cavernous room of empty space with no appreciable decor.  There is actually a bar near the entrance and a small sofa seating area in front of a fireplace but the majority of the room is empty of anything inviting except for employee Elizabeth who could not have been sweeter or more helpful.  We got our keys, moved the car to the free parking area (very very tight spaces but free is good) and headed to room 209.      First impression: room is very small, carpet appears dirty overall, has a few dark black spots,
Manager Response: Gardengal16, I sincerely appreciate you sharing this with us.  We understand that while there may be items that can not be fixed with a historical hotel, there are certainly some very important details that you let us know about and need to be addressed with the team.  I'm sorry to hear you wouldn't want to return, but I hope that in the future you would consider giving us another opportunity.

Summary: Booked 1 night here and wished we could have stayed a few more. Older and quaint hotel with lots of charm. Rooms are European sized so don't expect a large room or stay here and write a review about how small the rooms are. Just expect and enjoy the hotel. Our check in clerk gave us all the information and pointed us to the roof top bar for a fantastic sunset view. It can get crowded there so be warned. We tried the on site restaurant which serves tapas and shared plates and the food was wonderful. The beach is just a short walk down the steps and free hotel parking is close by. Great place would stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great stay feet from the beach
Summary: We went there this week, and had a great time. What a deal, and the beach and town are slow now. The weather will be nice for another month, we went body surfing and the water was 70. We used our daily $25 voucher to buy lunch. Breakfast was free, and very good
Manager Response: none

Summary: My husband and I drove from San Diego for a night stat at La Casa del Camino. It was the perfect place for dining and drinks by the beach. We enjoyed the Rooftop Lounge for happy hour and sunset, Kya Bistro and the bonus wine and cheese hour for hotel guests. The location is ideal for being close to downtown Laguna and the beach. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful with directing us to find places in town. We will be staying here again!
Manager Response: Thank you CaliWanderer777, love that we were a part of your romantic getaway and look forward to the next visit. We appreciate your review!

Summary: My husband and I had a nice stay at La Casa del Camino.  It's well located, only a half block to the beach and an easy ~20 min walk from "downtown".  The staff were friendly and accommodating.  We were celebrating our anniversary and arrived to a complimentary bottle of champagne.  We were thankful that the hotel provides beach chairs, towels, and umbrella which we used each day of our stay.  The only thing missing from the property is a pool, but given the easy beach access you're likely not to miss it too much.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Very nice room,clean with good service. Room cleaned promptly. Complementary breakfasts were most appreciated. Free parking an added bonus. Weather was pleasant and use of beach chairs, umbrella, etc. was convenient. Liked the bar with great good served in the restaurant and the deck was delightful if a bit chilly for a couple of desert wimps used to 100+ temps. All in all a delightful weekend experience and we will sure to be back. Dick and Frances  Palm Springs CA.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Beautiful sight od the city of Laguna Beach
Summary: A nice place to relax and enjoy the sight of Laguna beach. The spacious terrace, well located above the beach. It could catch up a little bit crowded AND crowed tables, but ... If you ever come to Laguna Beach this is one of the best places in it.
Manager Response: Thank you Cokaloka, we are glad you had a chance to enjoy the Rooftop Lounge during your visit. It is definitely a great way to view and enjoy Laguna.  Cheers!

Summary Heading: Gorgeous Spanish Style Hotel in Laguna Beach
Summary: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights while visiting our daughter in Southern California.  This is a beautiful Spanish Style hotel in Laguna Beach, located on South Coast Highway and only a few steps to a private beach area.  We had a Spanish Queen room on the 2nd floor - very clean and cozy.  Perhaps a bit small for someone else, but it was perfect for us.  The resort fee was extra, but included a very nice buffet breakfast in the morning and use of Tommy Bahama beach chairs, as well as free Wi-Fi and other amenities.  There was also a complementary afternoon wine and cheese hour, which we enjoyed.  Two things stood out for us about this hotel: the wonderful staff and the Rooftop Lounge.  Everyone at the hotel was so friendly and helpful - especially the front lobby staff.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Wished I could have stayed longer!  My one night stay at La Casa del Camino was wonderful! I will definitely return!  -Front Desk Service - Matthew & Elizabeth were the best! - K'ya Restaurant - Food and cocktails were delicious! My fav was the truffle French fries.  Good Happy Hour deals.  Our server (sorry didn't catch her name) was delightful! Rooftop Lounge - Can't beat the view!  Drink prices on the high side (paying for the view). -Complimentary Breakfast - The food and service was more than I expected - not a huge spread, but quality food and fresh fruits. The server was very helpful. Room - Etnies Room had different but nice d√©cor.  Enough space, clean room and bathroom, comfortable bed and pillows.  I love pillows and really appreciated not having to ask for extra ones.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had a unique situation in which we need extra attention from the front desk and Bethany came through in the clutch by taking our check in process from complicated to easy. She went above and beyond and we will remember this trip for quite some...if we are back in Laguna, we will def check in with this hotel. I want to stress that Bethany was the reason why our stay was amazing...
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great location, rooftop bar has an amazing view.. The Bistro restaurant is very good. Complementary Breakfast was also really surprisingly good. Nice beaches for close by. Lots of coffee shops, boutiques, bars, grocery stores very close by.
Manager Response: We are so glad to hear that you not only had the chance to explore the hotel, you were able to get to know Laguna!  Thank you for staying with us Janejbarr.

Summary: We had such a great time we ended up extending our stay another night! Thanks to the amazing front desk host Bethany for great recommendations, kind/helpful personality and going above & beyond to assist us in every way possible during our stay.  The hotel was in the best location for us--just a short jaunt to the beach (stair access just at the end of the street), 10 minute walk into town + plenty of stores & restaurants within a few blocks. Also loved the rooftop bar with delicious tapas & great drinks. New favorite spot!
Manager Response: We are beyond excited to hear we are your new favorite spot Kiersten!  Thank you for your review and recognizing Bethany, we look forward to sharing this with the team.  See you soon!

Summary: We were a bit hesitant to stay here based on reviews, like other people have posted before us. We felt great relief when we checked in with Brittany or Bethany (sorry). She went above and beyond with her service. She made us feel as if this hotel was her home! She was caring and made sure we understood everything the hotel had to offer.  First of all, you need to stay in a Surf room. The Spanish rooms are nice but small. They offer breakfast, beach towels/chairs, wifi-the whole works. Breakfast is worth the resort fee of $16 a day. The breakfast woman was very friendly. Brittany/Bethany had suggestions for everything that we wanted to do. When you call to book or go to check in, ask for her! The rest of the front desk is friendly but not genuine. The rooftop bar at the hotel has
Manager Response: Doug H, thank you so much for staying with us and recognizing Bethany and Alina. We are so proud to have her on our team; all of us take pride in our guest service.  You must come back to experience K'ya, it is delicious as well - and you also have 9 other Surf Rooms to explore! We sincerely appreciate your wonderful review.

Summary: Great location and restaurant... sub standard rooms for the money. Airconditioning would not run blew the fuse if you turned it on.  Room was the skater room window would not stay open for ocean breeze to come in.  Front desk people where great, service was very attentive
Manager Response: JimbX810FT, we are so sorry for your experience.  We have definitely looked into this and did not expect to have these issues during your stay.  With our historic building and the ongoing need for more power, we learned a good lesson.  We hope you will give us another chance in the future.

Summary: Great service and very acomatating. The spanish queen was a great size room and nice ocean view. But what was even better was the view from the rooftop bar very cool bartenders and service was awesome. We also really enjoyed the complimentary glass of wine and cheeze platter. The complimentary breakfast was awesome french toast a veggie scramble bacon and sausage. We will be back!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Excellent hotel for our wedding anniversary
Summary: From the time we checked in with Monica,  our clean room with a very comfortable bed and  a bottle of Champagne when they found out we where visiting for our anniversary, the wine and cheese reception, the Rooftop Bar, and the complimentary breakfast.  All where incredible and worth every penny.  We will be back.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We received a warm welcome when we arrived.  The staff was friendly and accommodating.  Our room was on the 1st floor close  to kitchen service area and asked to be moved the next day because we were concerned it would not be a quiet area.  We decided to keep the room. Quiet, comfortable beds. Rooms small but just needed a place to sleep. They provided beach equipment.  Rooftop Happy Hour the best with views.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Beautiful Room with friendly hotel staff. Perfect Location!
Summary: We stayed in the ripcurl room! We loved the styled of the room...felt like I was staying in guestroom of someone's home. It was complete with a beautiful ocean view. The bed was super comfy with lots of pillows.  During the day we kept the Air on but at night we would open the windows to hear the sound of the ocean.  The staff here was incredibly friendly and helpful. They have a delicious complimentary breakfast (eggs, french toast, bacon, oatmeal pastries and fresh fruit. They also have a wine and cheese hour in the late afternoon that's a nice little perk.  I loved being able to check out chairs, umbrellas and towels at the front desk and walk down the steps to the beach. it was so convenient and a beautiful little beach that wasn't too crowded, although it might be on the
Manager Response: Jenniejoy411, thank you for taking the time to share with us and your fellow Trip Advisor readers about your experience at La Casa del Camino!  We are so happy that you got to take advantage of most of our offerings during your stay.  We appreciate you and your review!

Summary: Let's start with what was ok : Location close to the beach and the roof top bar for a sunset drink Having that said, our room was noisy, no proper A/C,  breakfast is symbolic,  the bed small and very bad.      Disappointing
Manager Response: We are saddened to know that we disappointed you, T S.  I appreciate you letting us know what we can work on and I hope we had an opportunity to make it right with you during your stay.

Summary Heading: Great locations & food/drink options- bad guest room experience
Summary: Positives: Cool building that is over 80 years old with great upgrades. Great location with nice staff. Yummy breakfast for hotel guests from 7:30am - 10am. Convenient beach access. Good roof-top bar. Standard room w/ bathroom is very small, but nicely updated.   Negatives: Nights are tough - There was no air conditioning and instead, a mobile swamp cooler on wheels that barely worked and leaks water all over the floor after running it for more than a couple hours. It was warm in our room most nights. We were forced to leave the windows open just to hear people drinking on the roof bar and the live music down stairs until 10pm. Then, as our room was open to the courtyard, we were woken up by people talking/ laughing eating breakfast at 7am down below. As the hotel is small and
Manager Response: none

Summary: I fully expected to write a scathing review of this "place", the last day of our stay we met Matthew. He is beyond exceptional! A few minutes with this young man completely changed our opinion. I have stayed at the Montage, the Ritz, Casa Laguna, etc and each one of them is a thousand times nicer than the dilapidated Casa del Camino but NONE of them has customer service on point that this young man does.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for recognizing Matthew for his exceptional service.  We apologize that we had fallen short, but are so thankful to have him on our team to turn it around.

Summary Heading: Old Spanish hotel near the sea
Summary: We come here for staycations. Love the funkiness of this old hotel and nearby attractions. We live in Newport Beach and this is our go to hotel for Laguna events. Did the Pagent of Masters for the first time, walked all the way to downtown, pubs and shopping there. So our Camino hotel room is quaint like a euro room. Euro buffett breakfast in a little patio was a great surprise. Staff are wonderful. Smiling and helpful. Ice running for us, charging my phone at the front desk. Rooftop cocktails with sunset is always amazing.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My wife and I stayed here for our anniversary and the moment we walked to the front desk we felt so welcomed by the friendly staff. Monica is a great employee she helped us out and got us all set up with our stay. She even set us up with a reservation on the Rooftop Lounge, it's a really cool hangout spot and the views are breathtaking. And to top it off she set us up with gourmet dessert delivered to our room as an anniversary gift! The room itself was very beautiful, we had the king bed and the design with all the real carved wood was amazing. Our favorite part was the breakfast buffet, the food was very delicious and healthy. Everything from eggs mixed with veggies, potatoes, bacon, sausage, fruit, oatmeal, french toast, pastries, coffee, tea, milk, and orange juice. Another
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great location, nice comfortable "surf" room. The staff is probably the best we have ever experienced.  There is obviously a good culture here. The morning breakfast was way beyond our expectations. The rooftop deck provides great views and plenty of seating to enjoy the sunset over the ocean. We will be staying again!
Manager Response: Robert F, we are thrilled that you enjoyed your stay with us and our staff was able to make a difference.  Knowing you will return is the biggest compliment we could receive, thank you!

Summary: We had a great time.  Staff was excellent. Super accommodating. Very nice breakfast. My second time.  It's even nicer 15 years later. Short 2 minute walk down to the beach. Great place to take your dog.  Beach hours for dogs are before 9:30 and after 6.  Close free trolly stop.
Manager Response: We are so grateful for your return and the wonderful review and dog friendly tips!  We look forward to another visit from you, CaliProfMom.

Summary Heading: For the price, it was just okay
Summary: We spent three nights here to attend a wedding in the area. It is in a very good location. Lots of restaurants in walking distance, and beach access is a just down the block.   As mentioned in all the reviews, the rooms are small. Ours wasn't too bad and was better than the room our friends stayed in. We were in 105 (our floors were wood, theirs was some old (old) damp carpet (205). Our room was also bigger. It was really okay and suited us just fine. If you want to sleep past 7:30 a.m., you might request a room on the other side of the hotel? The trash truck showed up each morning about that time. Even the noisy air conditioner didn't drown it out. No problem here, we were up earlier than that....  We ate in both the lobby restaurant (pretty noisy!) and the rooftop. They were
Manager Response: Jperkin1, thank you for staying with us.  We are so sorry to hear about the noisy wake up  call, but are happy to hear that you were still able to enjoy the hotel, amenities and our location  We appreciate you sharing.

Summary: Fun one night in Laguna for dinner and to see Pageant of the Arts.  We stayed in one of the surf rooms.  You cannot open the windows (I'm assuming for safety reasons), I would have liked to hear the waves as I slept.  They did provide a nice air conditioner.  We ate dinner in the downstairs restaurant, which was very tasty and reasonable (aa bit noisy ).  In the morning we had their nice hot breakfast and walked the ocean.  It was very pleasant and hope to return one day soon.
Manager Response: none

Summary: As I arrived to this hotel I couldn't help but smile and think about how much I love the Trip Advisor family as everything that I had read about this place was true !  I had cautioned my bf regarding some reviews but he decided to book it.   First things first, if you want to stay on Laguna Beach, you are going to feel that wherever you choose (ESP in summer) is overpriced. We decided to stay here because our normal caliber of hotel is min $700/night and we were actually headed to Disney Land for most of the time and wouldn't be enjoying a hotel. For this reason, we took a hotels.com deal for the Spanish petite room. We should have considered the reviews more carefully as they warned us. We just kept thinking "we won't be there."  Let me tell you , it is so tiny that my tiny
Manager Response: none

Summary: Very cute hotel.  I originally came here about 9-10 yrs ago, and had fond memories.  I will say the hotel is a bit dated.  I upgraded to one of the surf room because I wanted an ocean view.  The view is beautiful.  The room was very ok.  The carpet had a dampish feel on your barefeet, and the bathroom is just small and again dated.  The shower is ok, but if someone flushes a toilet or uses hot water elsewhere, you'll feel it in the shower.  Also in the morning the bathroom sink hot water would not get hot.  My room did not have central air, it had one of those portable swamp coolers that's noisy and takes up space.  The staff there is super sweet and nice.  The rooftop bar is fun and lovely.  The free breakfast in the morning is ok at best, but I was looking for a more protein
Manager Response: none

Summary: I knew before we got to the hotel that the room would be small.  This is beyond small, I think it's called the Spanish room, avoid this room.  We had room 309, it had a ocean view, not a beach view, but that's ok we were never told Beach view.  Now for the closet aka room.  They don't have central air, there is the BIG heater and ac box blocking the refrigerator and almost blocking the sink that is outside of the bathroom.  We never plugged in the refrigerator because there was no plug near.  The AC unit work good, thank goodness we had it running because at night it can be used when on to drown out the noise the rooftop party.  This beyond a party people screaming and yelling, then they come down the hall past people's rooms doing the same as in the rooftop.  Then there is the
Manager Response: Fredshubby, we are so sorry to hear about your overall experience with us and that it was not a relaxing peaceful getaway.  We will work with our restaurant team to help send the Rooftop guests off in a more quiet manner.

Summary: If I could leave a minus triple zero, I would  We went on line and made reservations here for 3 nights. Since the rooms are all different, we picked a larger room,  one with a King Size bed.  Then the nightmare began. We arrived and were told the room we had booked,  wasn't available, what?  In fact,  there were no rooms with a King size bed.  However, we were talked into a smaller room with a Queen, but according to the front desk individual, it was the same price,  because it had a great Ocean view, ok so we took it.  Big mistake!!  We got to the room and that great Ocean view was out of the bathroom window!  and out of a side window if you stuck your head out.  The room was very hot, with no fan and a little portable room air conditioner. We opened the windows to get a little
Manager Response: We are very sorry to hear about your experience with us. I would love to have an opportunity to address this personally, as this is not our typical guest experience. We pride ourselves on our service and ability to resolve our guest's concerns, I hope we will have another chance to get it right with you as well.

Summary Heading: Great place for a getaway weekend/!
Summary: Classic old hotel but up to date where it counts. Loved the ready access to the beach. The bar on the roof is fantastic. Perfect location. The breakfast was very high quality and in a cute courtyard. Definitely will come back.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing La Casa for your weekend getaway.  We appreciate the wonderful review and look forward to your next visit, richtrubey!

Summary: We ventured into Laguna Beach solely as a stopover on our way to Catalina ...we stayed 3 days and cant wait to go back one day !!!  The wonderful staff at this charming boutique hotel certainly played a huge role in our falling in love with this area. We stayed in the Roxy room , gorgeous !  From the moment you walk in you are greeted to a terrificly fun lobby with local music , a fireplace and great bar area. We had a fantastic dinner at the K'ya restaurant (on property) would highly recommend ! Take time to read about the unusual and quirky history of the hotel , youll love it even more ‚ù§
Manager Response: We love love love your review!  Thank you so much for making us a part of your visit to Laguna, learning about the hotel and enjoying our history.  I will definitely thank our staff for helping to make your experience special!  We also agree that K'ya is a must!

Summary: The hotel staff was extremely kind and helpful. Because we had a dog, our room was on the first floor which was great for easy entry and exit. The room was absolutely lovely and charming. Just a few steps away from the beach access and you can borrow chairs and umbrellas.   As a bonus, the rooftop bar has stunning views and the downstairs restaurant is delish! We'll definitely be coming back!
Manager Response: Thank you PierreAndGinger!  We absolutely love hosting our guests and furry, four-legged children in the hotel as well as Rooftop and K'ya, we are very pet-friendly.  So happy to give you a 5 star experience and look forward to doing it again soon.

Summary: Great boutique spot, with fabulous team.  The  restaurant and roof top bar are wonderful.  The menu at the restaurants has small plates with great tastes to full dinner.   The breakfast included is full eggs to fruit and array is nice.  The attitude of the team is to make us have a great stay.   Plus a half block walk to beach.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is wonderful! It's quaint but enjoyable. The rooms are a bit on the small side, yet who is in the room when they have amazing restaurants like Rooftop Lounge and Kya Bistro?? We were there during an event, so the front desk was a bit confusing to find for check in. The service was excellent- Bethany at the front desk truly stood out to us. I checked Trip Advisor before booking my room, and from the other reviews it said to look for her when you arrive, and sure enough, she was there to greet us. She made us feel like she was welcoming us into her home.  Matthew and Samantha were helpful, but there was one rude girl at the front desk. We had a small problem with our room during the stay. The man I'm guessing was the manager was not helpful at all.   They provided beach
Manager Response: none

Summary: Excellent hotel and most importantly excellent staff.  The hotel is a beautiful Spanish style hotel located close to the beach. We also enjoyed lunch at the Rooftop Restaurant. The food was great and so was the service.  Of course the views we're breathtaking . We enjoyed our stay and we are most definetely coming back.
Manager Response: Thank you so much clarisak75!  We are thrilled that you enjoyed your time with us and will be looking forward to your next stay!

Summary: Quaint, comfortable lodging at an awesome price.  I stayed int he Billabong themed surf room which has an incredible view, a surfboard on the wall, action images and a stone bathroom with a heated floor. Very cool. The staff was incredibly nice and helpful and made a point to ask how I was doing and get this, they totally listened!   Rooftop bar is a can't miss experience. We went up to watch the sun set and ended up meeting some friendly locals that hang out there all the time.  Breakfast was delicious! Definitely not your run of the mill continental offering that we get at a lot of the other hotels we stay at.
Manager Response: GTML93546, thank you so much for taking the time to share your experience.  It is lovely to hear how you loved your Casa Surf Room, breakfast, The Rooftop Lounge and especially our service.  We look forward to your next visit!

Summary: I wanted to give this hotel 3 stars, but Bethany and Samantha made it 5 stars. They were so friendly, inviting, and helpful during my stay. Thumbs up them. If they were working at a different hotel in Laguna Beach, I would be a regular. I can't justify the high prices for this place.
Manager Response: Thank you for the wonderful words about Bethany and Samantha, I am so glad they were able to make the difference for you - we are so happy to have them!

Summary: Love this hotel - Rooms are cool, staff is great, Roof top bar and bartenders especially Ryan were fantastic.  We had a couple hiccups but Katie the GM took care of without hesitation.  We will be back for sure!!
Manager Response: Thank you so much.  It was a pleasure taking care of you recently, kac65.  I appreciate you taking the time to give us feedback and make it right with you.  We will be ready for your next beach getaway!

Summary: Ok the rooms were a little on the small size but hey ... you are in Laguna Beach what are you doing on the room anyway!  Awesome drinks and good food on rooftop bar and fabulous views and sunset.   Plus gorgeous girls and guys giving great service.  Nice breakfast and parking included plus free beach towels and chairs thrown in for free.  Did I mention beach was a one minute walk?  Will definitely be back and highly recommend this cute little hotel!
Manager Response: Thank you so much Michelle R, we couldn't agree more about exploring Laguna!  Love that you enjoyed your stay and got to take advantage of our amenities.  We hope to see you again this Summer!

Summary: One can touch up photos to make anything appear better than it really is. I think that is the case at La Casa del Camino. Despite the promo pictures on their website, our room was small in virtually every respect, including the bed, closet space, refrigerator and dresser. The bathroom was proportionally larger than the rest of the room. I guess that's a good thing. They advertise "free parking" but that may only apply to valet parking, which we found out begins around 4:30 or 5:00 pm. For most of the day, our entire group wound up at the "strictly enforced" metered parking on the streets around the hotel. The location is the only thing that justifies the $250+ a night rate. I think the best feature of the hotel is the rooftop bar, which is where the wedding and reception was
Manager Response: Robert L, thank you for joining us recently for the wedding. Our Parking is included in our resort fee of $16, which is much lower than the area hotels that charge $25 and up.  I am so sorry about the confusion, but appreciate you letting us know about your experience so we can better explain this to our guests.

Summary: Mathew at the front desk was very welcoming. The loby was small, cozy and inviting. There was live music playing as we checked in which made for a special night. As other reviews mentioned, there was some street noise but we didn't mind it. The charm of the hotel & the rooftop bar, along with the great breakfast and location made for a great stay!
Manager Response: Hjda68, we are so happy you enjoyed your last minute stay with us.  Thank you for choosing La Casa del Camino for your quick visit and hope you'll visit us again soon.

Summary: Absolutely loved staying at La Casa del Camino in Laguna Beach. We were in town with a large group of friends for a wedding and our hotel (La Casa del Camino) became the meeting spot for all. The rooftop bar was fantastic - and happy hour prices were very reasonable, especially for the area. The view was breathtaking especially in the afternoon, the mornings were chilly with fog along the coastline in early June.  Be prepared that the rooms are quite small, but very clean and cozy. We had a nice view from the window as well. Opened up the windows for a great beach feel throughout the night.   Just a short walk down the stairs for easy beach access.   Service was great, each staff member was overly friendly and accommodating.   We're already scheming with friends to plan a future
Manager Response: I appreciate your wonderful recap of your stay with us, Abigail W.  Thank you so much for sharing this with us as well as our Tripadvisor audience! We are so happy to be a part of your future scheme!

Summary: We reviewed this accommodation via. booking.com before choosing this property from Australia. Our two rooms were not at all like what was presented online, very disappointing as was breakfast. Perhaps management need to look at refurbishing the very old and musky carpet floor covering.  Thank goodness for Matthew Haim on reception . You were outstanding at your job and  helped us immensely, an asset to this business.  Would not recommend it for accommodation, overpriced, but location was good.
Manager Response: Lynette M, thank you so much for letting us know about your stay as well as acknowledging Matt's service.  Thank you.

Summary Heading: Romantic hotel for couples looking for a beach weekend
Summary: Nice hotel and good location. Staff was friendly and the breakfast in the morning was excellent. May visit this property again in the future, but will ask for a newly remodeled room. The wood carvings and other decor was nice both in the lobby and in the rooms. Rooftop bar is a nice place to relax and has a great view of the ocean.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here last minute on our road trip down the PCH. If you're looking for luxury you might not want to waste your time. The front desk staff were very friendly and very attentive running us up a bucket of ice in record time. Thank you! We had a standard one queen bed room so maybe the more expensive rooms are nicer. The room and bathroom is very small. The mini refrigerator sat on the floor which made it hard to access. Might be nice to have it on a counter. If you're on a budget it's okay but I wouldn't stay more than a night or two.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great location. Rooftop Bar fun for happy hour. Rooms are very small and need to be updated. Breakfast is not very good. Nice Mexican restaurant across the street and walking distance to downtown is only 10 minutes.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Service was amazing. The room had a lot of character it felt we went back in time we love it. We check in late and they were quick. Amazing friendly staff. They went above and beyond trying to accommodate a massage. Is really centric  We love the service,
Manager Response: This review is "Awesome!"  We are so grateful for your stay and appreciate you taking the time to share your experience, Melinabecerra.

Summary: We wish we could have stayed longer! We only spent one full day and night here but the service was very attentive and friendly, even the rooftop bar staff upstairs and breakfast woman. Which by the way, this was the one of the best contential breakfasts I've had, egg scrambles, bacon, etc.   This hotel is a 5 min iber ride away from downtown laguna and 5 second walk to the beach! Parking is included! Definitely would stay here again!
Manager Response: What a fantastic review, thank you Chelscc!!!

Summary: Small hotel with a fantastic rooftop bar. The rooms are small but clean. They describe it as "spanish" but idk... .......... should be a few bucks cheaper for what it is............. Fine if you dont plan on spending much time there...... Great location in Laguna.
Manager Response: Our rooms are definitely on the smaller side and we do encourage exploring Laguna, I'm glad you found our rooms to be clean, liked the location and had the chance to experience the Rooftop Lounge.  Hopefully next time we can show you our other room options so your stay is even better.  Thank you for the feedback, King C.

Summary: Once a very cool hotel in a great location with staff that really understood the boutique business and caring for their clients. Not a place to  spend a week.  Stayed here a few dozen times over the years, prior to the hotel evolving into a night club from lobby to roof. Not a clean place. A non stop stream of people wandering on the hotel floors afternoon through late evening... smoking drinking arguing out in front of the hotel.  Room condition and capet taddy and way below average for this great Laguna location. Lighting is dim to the point that you can't read.  Front desk folks were nice but untrained.  Thank goodness for the house keeping crew.
Manager Response: We are so sorry to hear that you were disappointed with your experience, we would love the opportunity to make it right with you.  I hope that you will reach out to me so that we can discuss your visit.

Summary: Love the receptionist at the front desk..They were very nice and professional. ...Omg the food was awesome. ...Our room was large, I recommend you get the King size bed. Our room was the largest out if the group.  The view was great, we was right there on the beach.  I can't forget the rooftop very cozy for the happy hour.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the lovely review, Tonya1001!  Glad you liked your room, loved the staff and enjoyed our wonderful restaurants.  We hope you'll return soon for another great stay!

Summary: We loved listening to the ocean as we fell asleep, the surf room was amazing and bed was very comfy.  Breakfast was much better than we expected and the views at this place are the best!!! We will be back again:)
Manager Response: Thank you KellyCabo!  Happy to know that you enjoyed one of our awesome surf rooms and liked our breakfast. We can't wait to host another visit!

Summary: Front desk (Bethany and her twin ?) were incredible. 10/10,  They made us repeats.   Some opportunities on details.  Crappy coffee at brunch.  Really crappy.  Runny oatmeal, inedible.  Awesome lobster egg dish tho. GREAT stay, would recommend and stay again.  Need to fix windows on oceanside, loud and cold.
Manager Response: Thank you jkshop, appreciate the feedback and so happy to know our staff made you repeats! I will definitely relay your brunch experience as well, we always appreciate the opportunity to improve.

Summary: Loved the professionalism of your staff and how attentive they were. The room was clean and inviting, we loved the bathroom .  We enjoyed how close to the beach it was and how we could borrow items like chairs and towela.
Manager Response: Thank you for the wonderful review Tiodoritaf, we can't wait to welcome you back!

Summary Heading: Our stay at La Casa Del Camino
Summary: Great experience overall. Beautiful location. The room was clean and staff was very friendly. Bethany and Samantha were great at the front desk and Lauren set everything up beforehand so so that our stay would truly be special. The Rooftop had great service and delicious food. Breakfast the next day was better than a tropical continental breakfast and the attendant was friendly and made sure to refill the coffee as soon as he realized it was empty. Had a great time!
Manager Response: So grateful for your kind words about our staff and experience at breakfast and the restaurants.  We look forward to hosting your next great time!

Summary: Laguna Beach has so much to offer and such a hip and relaxed vibe (SoCal at its best) and this hotel complements it perfectly. Sitting squarely in the "HIP District," this funky, restored Spanish landmark is conveniently located within easy walking distance of amazing Vegan friendly restaurants, just steps from a gorgeous ocean inlet, and within a mile of downtown Laguna. There's free parking, free breakfast and free live music in the lobby most nights. The rooms are small, a bit loud (until the drinking crowd dies down by midnight) but comfortable. The restaurant is delicious and the rooftop bar with an expansive view of the Pacific is the place to be at sunset. Good price, good amenities, terrific location and friendly, helpful staff. I'd definitely stay again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is fantastic, my husband and I enjoyed the old rustic feel and the surf hotel room. If your looking for new age this hotel isn't for you. There is a lot of history to this hotel and its beautiful. It was very clean. The only recommendation is better customer service on the roof top bar, waiting 20 minutes for a drink is disappointing. But other than that we were very satisfied.
Manager Response: Thank you, Caitlin B.  Great quick summary about our hotel! We are so sorry about your experience at the Rooftop and will share this with the team.

Summary: I took my Bostonian mom for Mother's Day as they were having a travelzoo deal while she was in town. The front desk staff was amazing! Bethany from the check in to check out really did a fabulous job. Thanks girl for showing my mom such care and wonderful time. The food upstairs is a must for lunch, dinner is a little windy and hard to get a table on the weekend. The Lobster avocado toast is best thing I ever ate worthy and our server was great with all our allergies. We got the Ripcurl Surf room with a great view of the ocean. The rooms were super clean and the bed very comfortable. The beach is a min walk and the front desk has the Tommy Bahamas's lounge chairs my fav that are a back pack and easy to carry. Complimentary breakfast in the morning is in a cute little court yard
Manager Response: Lilmegsta, we are so thankful to have been a part of your Mother's Day celebration!  We also sincerely appreciate you taking the time to share with your fellow Trip Advisor travelers about your stay with us.  See you again soon!

Summary: Great location for the roof top bar. We stayed there for our anniversary. The staff went extra mile to make us feel special for the day by offering complementary champagne and reserving and excellent spot for the sunset hour. The room was little less than desired. I was expecting ocean view room with the upgrade but received a room looking at the next wing of the hotel. The hotel carpets needs replacement. The walls could have been little more cleaner. However, the entire experiance was great.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great hotel steps to the beach and convienent parking and free breakfast. The staff were very nice and helpful. The rooftop bar is awesome-- it was very busy during the sunset though.! The rooms are a little small but they were clean and nice. This hotel was very cute and felt cozy.
Manager Response: none

Summary: La Casas del Camino is a hidden gem..Tucked into a quitet corner of Laguna Beach just steps from Cress Beach. The inviting lobby has comfortable seating around an inviting fireplace - there was live music on Thursday night. We were upgraded upon check in due to a malfunction in our original room. New room was fantastic with ocean views - and the sound of waves at night. Rooftop Bar overlooks the  ocean and has yummy appetizers during Happy Hour. The restaurant downstairs, K'ya, was another dining delight - my husband and I were both very happy with our dinner choices. Breakfast in the morning is served in a charming courtyard with an abundance of hot dishes, fresh fruit and assorted pastries and croissants.. The real clincher for us, however, was the amazing staff. EVERYONE we
Manager Response: We love your review, GOESgirl.  Thank you for sharing!

Summary: Great staff, friendly and helpful. Convenient restaurant/bar on site with great food and fast service.  Complimentary Buffet breakfast was delicious.Great location on Coast hwy. Minor traffic noise. Very homey environment...old fashioned d√©cor. Clean. Wonderful view from rooftop bar.
Manager Response: Thank you nwfun, happy to be a part of a successful short getaway.  Now you know exactly where to go on your next visit to Laguna!

Summary Heading: Great service, comfy beds, but REALLY loud!
Summary: All the employees here were very friendly and helpful, but I would probably never go back to this hotel because it was so loud. I know it's a historic building, so there's only so much sound proofing one can do, but there must be a way to improve it further. We could easily hear the live lobby music playing late into the evening in our room on the floor below. Whenever other guests walked down the halls we could hear their conversations like they were inside our room. Worst of all, the many noises from breakfast service started around 6:30am--dishes clanking loudly, guests talking in the dining area, etc. Perhaps a room on the top floor would be better. Still, for the price we paid, I would expect even the lower tier rooms to be more soundproofed.  The saving graces,
Manager Response: EmBentley, we appreciate you letting us know about your noise concerns.  We loved hearing that you enjoyed your interactions with our staff as well as the restaurants.  We will certainly look in to what we can do to minimize the noise.  Thank you!

Summary: Convenient location and charming hotel.  Roof top deck upstairs with de-lish mojitos, tapas downstairs,  beach steps away.... Great staff,  awesome free breakfast.  Really enjoyed are short stay.  We'll be back!!
Manager Response: Thank you for your awesome review, you managed to sum us up quickly!  Let us know when you are ready to book that next, even better getaway!

Summary Heading: Beautiful beach front gem for a great price!
Summary: The rooftop was great for watching the sunset with a glass of wine in hand. The room was small but beautiful. You can hear the waves crashing outside your window. Great hot breakfast. Highly recommended!
Manager Response: Snejanadaily, we loved reading your review.  Thank you for taking a moment to let us know what you enjoyed about your stay.  We appreciate your recommendation!

Summary: Took an overnight getaway to this cute hotel/bistro. Loved the location and friendly staff. Great food and happy hours. Rooftop bar is spectacular! Has access to the nicest, secluded beach and they provide beach chairs and beach towels.
Manager Response: Laurie L, we love being described as fun!  We are so happy that you had a chance to take advantage of of our amenities during your visit.  Thank you and we hope to see you again soon!

Summary Heading: The Classic at the corner of Cress & Coast
Summary: For a tiny hotel you will find that La Casa del Camino you find that there is no shortage of gifts to offer.  From the welcome by Bethany in Reception and  every guest associate you encounter, everyone is friendly and eager to help.  My husband and I stayed for 3 days and left our car parked in the lot across Coast Highway for most of our stay as every place we wanted to visit was a short walk or trolley ride away. Great ocean views from Rooftop and the beach is a short walk away as there are homes between the hotel and coastline.  Lobby is always filled with locals and music which can get loud if your room is near the stairs but after a few cocktails, in the lobby bar, you won't really care.
Manager Response: OMGYoga, what a wonderful review!  Thank you for sharing your experience about your stay, our staff and overall experience at our tiny hotel.  It was wonderful to hear about the ease of getting around Laguna.  Thank you!

Summary Heading: In the Center of It All!!!
Summary: Wonderful location near the very center of town. This property is a prize worth experiencing, with no need to look elsewhere for food, drinks, shopping, or simply, the beach! You must eat and drink on the patio, with a view "to die for."
Manager Response: Thank you JosephC, sounds like you enjoyed our Rooftop Lounge during your visit!  We love hearing about your time and the fabulous review.

Summary: From helping book our reservation to checking in, our needs along the way and check out Bethany was on it. She made our stay very welcoming and enjoyable every time we saw her. Can't wait to come back. Keep up the great work Bethany!
Manager Response: Thank you Claudine!  We are so happy to know Bethany was able to help make your stay more enjoyable, we will make sure to celebrate her great customer service.

Summary: Lovely and historic Laguna hotel just steps from the Pacific.  Always a hub of activity - the rooftop bar with its magical views, the bustling lobby Bar which sits next to a roaring fire, the energetic Kya resturaunt serving up excellent tapas dinners. La  Casa is not a cookie cutter hotel brand. It has personality, some quirks ,  A few shortcomings but always captures the spirit of Laguna - art, great food, incredible views, and  unique individuality.
Manager Response: L6507OTtoms, we loved reading your review! You summed up our hotel quite well and we are so happy that you had such a lovely stay. Cheers!

Summary Heading: Great spot at a good value.
Summary: Great location 1 block from beach with ocean views.  Included beach towels are super helpful for packing for the trip.  Parking was a bonus right across the street.  Rooms are nice and quaint with upgraded amenities.  A bit noisy due to bar and rooftop lounge but a nice bonus too!
Manager Response: Thank you zoltar55, glad you were ale to take advantage of our beach amenities that we have available for the guests.  Parking in Laguna can be a bit pricey and a struggle, so we consider ourselves lucky to have a lot for our guests, although it is just across the street. So happy to know you enjoyed our offerings, we truly appreciate your review.

Summary Heading: Beautiful Boutique Hotel with Incredible Ocean Views
Summary: The entire staff at La Casa are wonderfully attentive your every need.  I've had several special requests during my stays and they have always been met with a smile and "we'll take care of that for you".
