Summary: The hotel is quaint and older. It's in a great location steps away from the beach and restaurants. It has a rooftop bar with a great view and happy hour.  The trolley is about a 2 minute walk and about a 15 minute walk to the main town. Rooms are small and older. I slept great all 3 nights. Beautiful shower and super soft towels. Friendly staff.
Manager Response: Melpd, we sincerely appreciate your review and happy to know you enjoyed your stay with us.  This is a great description for our future guests to understand about their anticipated experience.  Thank you!

Summary: Booked online with no expectations.  Ask for the largest room; it will be average size.  We had the smallest room and it was like a hotel in Japan.  Bathroom was unbelievably small.  Bar in the lobby gave the lobby a stale beer smell, but the staff was wonderful and gave us beach chairs and towels to use for the day.  Rooftop bar and restaurant was a great place to look at the ocean and see the fireworks.
Manager Response: Thank you for spending your one day beach trip with us and sharing the fireworks with us, we appreciate your feedback, Taylor W.

Summary Heading: Perfect spot for our out-of-town wedding guests
Summary: My husband and I booked 10 rooms at Casa del Camino for out-of-town guests coming to our wedding. Our friends absolutely loved their stay! They could walk out the door and have the beach, trail runs through Laguna Canyon, and restaurants all right there. They also loved the rooftop deck - a perfect spot for drinks on a summertime afternoon. My husband and I stayed here on our wedding night as well. Lauren, the special events coordinator, left a kind note and a bottle of sparkling wine in the room for us. We will never forget falling asleep to the sound of crashing waves out our window or our lovely European-style breakfast the next morning with all our friends. Casa del Camino is a real gem, and I'd recommend it to anyone! Thank you, Lauren, for making our stay such a memorable
Manager Response: Thank you so much for allowing us to be a part of your special day and taking care of your friends and family and the 5 star recommendation.  A big thank you will go out to Lauren and the team on your behalf.  We love that we were able to share this with you and look forward to future anniversary trips!

Summary: It was my husband's birthday and we wanted to get away if only for a night. The hotel staff we interacted with were friendly and helpful. The hotel just seemed a bit 'tired' and, for what we paid, I was a tad bit disappointed. One of the windows didn't work and we had to hold it open with a book. The mix of old Spanish style with new surfer d√©cor seemed a bit odd and out of place. My opinion is that this hotel was 'okay' but I'd most likely look for different accommodations the next time I'm in town.
Manager Response: We feel so special to be a part of your husbands birthday, thank you!  It sounds like you may have stayed in one of our Casa Surf Rooms, each one is quite different.  I hope that you will give us another opportunity the next time you are in town.

Summary: Loved the Rooftop Bar. Poke was delicious. Mojitos were strong and great. Vibe was awesome as were the bartenders.   Parking was a total pain. I had to park our Lexus RX on the street. I don't know how anyone with a vehicle bigger then a compact car would get in or out of a space and even at that it would seem difficult. Please adjust the number of parking spots and maybe limit those spaces to surf rooms only. Just MY opinion.   The staff were respectful and helpful.   The Billabong room was cool. Spacious enough for a rollaway and a pack and play.  I was worried it would be loud but it was quiet and not rowdy at all. Thank you for the great stay.
Manager Response: Jackf5131978, thanks for the review.  So glad you enjoyed the Billabong Casa Surf and the Rooftop Lounge! Those are some of our favorites.  We will definitely look into how we can accommodate your feedback on parking, that is certainly a challenge in Laguna and we hope we can improve this experience for your return and future guests.

Summary: We had a great stay, spacious quarters, amenities include a wonderful hotel breakfast, beach chairs and towels. The best views are from the upstairs loft where we sipped our coffee in the morning. We'll be back soon!
Manager Response: So glad you enjoyed your experience at the La Casa del Camino! It sounds like you may have rented our wonderful La Casita; I agree the loft area is the perfect spot to enjoy the view.  Thank you for the amazing review as well; see you again soon!

Summary: I rented a room for a few days for my son and his bride because their real honeymoon had to be delayed. The hotel reminded me that I did not approve a credit card for them to charge to the room. I was so happy. With all the wedding plans, I had forgotten. They personally emailed me and allowed me to fax over a verification the night before the stay. I cannot say enough about the service and attention to detail.
Manager Response: Thank you Brenagain, all of us are thrilled to know we helped make each of your experience with us a fantastic one.  It is awesome knowing we were chosen to be a part of your son and his bride's pre-honeymoon stay in Laguna. Thank you!

Summary: Loved the location and our room....only gave it 4 stars since the rooftop bar hours are so limited.  Can't eat breakfast up there and to have last call at 9:45 is very limiting.  If you want a late night 10:00 bite to eat you cannot get it here at the hotel...everything closes up way too early!
Manager Response: Sassylass, we're so happy you enjoyed your stay.  Being a good neighbor means that we need to close the Rooftop a bit earlier than other bars, however, there are some great nearby options.  We hope that you will bring your breakfast up to the top and enjoy the view, our guests are more than welcome to do so.  I apologize for any misunderstanding.  Thank you again for your review and we look forward to sharing other great late night spots with you on your next trip!

Summary Heading: Really wanted to give this hotel 5 stars!
Summary: Such a cute, quaint, quirky hotel.  We stayed for three nights.  It is a little tired, but compared to so many other hotels in Laguna area - we felt it was a great value.  Really wanted to give this hotel 5 stars because:  (1) Great staff -- everyone we spoke with/dealt with was so friendly and helpful;  (2) Loved the quaintness of this Spanish style hotel built in the 1920's; (3) Loved the rooftop restaurant -- food excellent & view was gorgeous;  (4) Great breakfast was included in the room price, served in a quaint wine cellar and courtyard area;  (5) Location is great, literally 2 minutes walking distance to stairs to the beach, and easy walking to shops and restaurants;  (6) Room was very clean and although small (we had a standard queen) it had everything we needed
Manager Response: CCookRanchoMirage_CA, we sincerely appreciate your review; especially the detail on what you enjoyed the most so that other travelers understand our hotel.  We are so sorry that we missed the mark with you comfort, we know that a good night's sleep is very important.  I have shared this with the team so that we can ensure the next visit we will be a 5!  Thank you again.

Summary: My wife and I really enjoyed our stay at La Casa. It reminded me of some of the pensiones we stayed in  while we were in Italy. The rooms are not large so be aware of that. The location is excellent and the breakfast is great. The views from the Rooftop Bar are amazing and the food at their restaurant was wonderful.
Manager Response: Thank you so much travelinmanOC!!!!  I can't wait to share this review with the entire team; we hope your visit us again soon.

Summary: Love this location. However we always stay on the lower floor. It's the only level that allows pets to stay. It is always so loud! With all the alley traffic, people coming in and out & with the complementary breakfast being served right across the way. Also, out of the three nights we stayed with you only one of the days was our room serviced. Parking is always tight & the bed in our room was super uncomfortable.
Manager Response: cldaynard, thank you for sharing your feedback with us and will look into ways we can make our first floor more enjoyable.  Please don't hesitate to let me know if we can make it up to you in the future. All the best to both of you.

Summary Heading: In the worlds greatest town but a very tired hotel
Summary: I was so excited by this property as it's in the main area of Laguna Beach. However, the property is very tired, rooms are very dark and dingy and the place needs some sort of uplift. The rooftop is great if you can get a seat.  The breakfast was not good at all, feel like your sitting in a wine cellar. Maybe worth putting the breakfast upstairs and adding to the selection of food on offer. Rooms were clean however and location is spot on.  Would I return, not so sure!!
Manager Response: AJUAE, we would really love another opportunity with you.  Perhaps you would enjoy one of or Casa Surf Rooms that are much more modern and unique than the Spanish style room.  Guests are also more than welcome to eat breakfast in the Courtyard or up to the Rooftop to enjoy the view.  You can always call in advance to see about Rooftop Reservations, this is a perk exclusive to hotel guests.  Please come back!

Summary: Great overall trip to Laguna!!! The hotel employees were all extremely nice and helpful!!! We loved the location and the rooftop bar, however the room was very small and the walls were pretty thin (it was hard to sleep being able to hear everyone walking down the halls).
Manager Response: Thank you for celebrating with us, spenceyb.  So happy to hear about our staff and that you enjoyed our location.  When you return, we will make sure to place you in a corner area with less traffic. We will also look into ways we can reduce the noise for our guests. Thank you again!

Summary: Had a wonderful 4 night stay..... Very friendly and great service. Our room (Spanish Queen) was very small but we still loved it as the decor and comfortable feel made this place special. Bathroom was amazing except it had no air conditioning, bed, pillows and linens were clean and very comfy. Would definitely stay here again..... Roof Top lounge has a beautiful view but was a little overpriced. We did not try the in site bistro but would next time as it smelled fabulous. Included breakfast each morning was amazing, friendly and much appreciated. Loved the complimentary use of the top quality Tommy Bahama beach umbrellas and chairs,these made our beach vacation even more wonderful.
Manager Response: Thank you, thank you, thank you!  We are happy to know that your vacation was a success.  You will absolutely need to try K'ya Bistro on your return, it is a local favorite as well.  Looking forward to your next Laguna getaway, Lisalivinlife13!

Summary: The hotel is like a boutique.. each room has its furniture style and architecture style.. we were there on our anniversary, staff is more than awesome, they welcomed us with complimentary upgrade to a bigger and more comfy room, a bottle of sparkling wine and cheese cake..  The view was so lovely, one side facing the beach and the other facing the beautiful part of Laguna beach city all the art galleries. It was just perfect. The bathroom had a window which showed palm trees in the street like you are bathing in the jungle. The room was very clean and comfy and spacious, yet original and chic. The beach in right there, 1 minute away.  The K'ya bistro is one of the best restaurants I've ever been to. We ordered 4 dishes all were extremely tasty. The chef there is quite an artist.
Manager Response: Marian, thank you so much for staying with us on your Anniversary!  It was a pleasure to make it a memorable trip, we hope to be a part of more celebrations in the future.

Summary: This is a good hotel, not a great hotel. The hotel has a nice European charm to it, however it is an old hotel, lacking many modern conveniences of newer properties. My recent stay here was for 3 nights with my sister in law in a King bed room. While the room was spacious enough for the two of us, it lacked proper storage. No drawers to put our clothes in. There was a bad smell creeping into our room from the lobby on check-in. We called twice to try and get someone to inspect the smell, but no luck. Thankfully the air conditioning unit masked the smell that night, and then the smell eventually dissipated the second night.   The resort fee includes parking and breakfast, which is a fair price. The breakfast was very tasty to be honest. A nice selection of eggs, bacon, sausage,
Manager Response: We appreciate your review and bringing this to our attention, I look forward to sharing with the team and finding ways to improve.  I am also glad to know that you enjoyed your stay overall.  I hope you will give us another opportunity in the future, perhaps you would prefer one of the Casa Surf rooms a bit more.  Happy travels!

Summary: We stayed here for my husband birthday surprise getaway. The staff was awesome, very pleasant and very accommodating. They even rushed to have our room ready early, which was really nice since we were early also. They also took our luggage up for us so we could got to the beach which is literally a 5 min walk.(photos attached to show, hotwl on left) They have complimentary breakfast and it was very good and so is the the guy that handles it. On the weekend they had live music, it was relaxing to go down and listen to the gentleman. They also have a restraunt on the first floor, go hungry because the food is awesome. The lobster dish we ordered 3 times, we just couldnt get enough. The only downfall is that the parking lot is across the street but isnt to far. You can park if
Manager Response: Wow, Emily l!  We can not thank you enough for staying with us and also sharing your experience with others.  We are all elated to know that we were able to help make your husbands birthday a memorable one. Now you will have to come back for more of K'yas lobster dish and to try lunch at the Rooftop!

Summary Heading: Great escape for couples and friends
Summary: Enjoyed the hotel unique style, staff was fantastic and views of Laguna Beach from the rooftop bar are simply nods. breathtaking.  This isn't a property for families with children, it has an adult party 30+ atmosphere and very cool vibe.   Well done!
Manager Response: Eagle518, we loved reading your review! Our style is definitely what sets us apart from the rest; it's our beachy laid back personality meets historic charm. We do find that couples ad friends do enjoy our property the most and appreciate your sharing that feedback.

Summary: We visiting on our honeymoon and the staff couldn't do enough for us. Breakfast was really great and just what we needed to set us up for a day of sightseeing. The room was comfortable with a big bed, there was aircon but we had to turn it off at night as it was too noisy.  The rooftop bar had amazing views and great cocktails, everyone was also raving about the food. The only thing of note was that it was noisy at night. The rooftop bar dos close at 9 but the music in the main bar (I think directly below our room) went on past 10pm every night.  Due to time differences we were trying to sleep by this point, if you were joining in the festivities I'm sure it wouldn't make a difference!
Manager Response: Congratulations again from all of us, thank you for letting us be a part of your memories.  We are so glad to hear you were well taken care by our staff of and appreciate your feedback.  Thank you again for sharing.  Wishing you all the best!

Summary: La Casa Del Camino is in the perfect location in Laguna Beach. It's not the most expensive hotel but it's also not the cheapest. It's right in the middle.  But as for location, it doesn't get any better! And the rooftop bar offers THE BEST view of the sunsets in Laguna Beach. Get there early to get a seat, though, because it gets packed! Parking is a bit difficult - they have a tiny, tight parking lot across the street but unloading your bags (if you have a bunch of them) can be a pain if you don't get one of the three parking spots right next to the hotel.  The rooms are quaint and nearly Victorian with creaky but comfy beds and creaky floor boards. But it all adds to the charm. It is quite beautiful, if a little small on space.   There's also a restaurant and bar on the main
Manager Response: Thank you Travelblogcouple for staying with us and for sharing your experience at our charming historic hotel.  We are happy to know your stay went well and you got an opportunity to experience The Rooftop Lounge as well.  We look forward to sharing another sunset with you on your next visit to Laguna.

Summary Heading: Loved it so much we stayed an extra day!
Summary: The location was amazing! Everyone was so accommodating and friendly! The rooms were lovely and we had two windows overlooking the ocean which we kept open all night! Breakfast was fresh, free and DELISH!!!! We will stay there again when visiting Laguna Beach!!
Manager Response: Houseofcards99, thank you again for staying at the La Casa!  Sounds like you had one of our great Casa Surf Rooms with that view.  Most importantly, we love knowing that our staff took good care of you and you were able to enjoy it so much that you stayed another night!  We can't wait to be a part of another future getaway.

Summary: The staff was so awesome... and I love the breakfast. We haven't tried out the rooftop bar yet because it's always busy but the staff said we can let them know next time and they will reserve a spot. So can't wait to try it!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Not as good as the hype
Summary: I was really looking forward to stayinh here and everything was great until we got to the room.  Small doesnt even describe where we are spending the next 5 days!  We asked if we could get a bigger room since we were here for so long and the charge was to be an additional  $150 per night.   We are literally bumping into each other just walking around, the bathroom has a horrible smell. It is lacking even simple things like a bed side light to read by, pillows that are not completely flat, etc.   I am very disappointed after reading the reviews for this hotel. I dread every time we have to come back to the room and certainly would not stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Everything was great!! Service, location, drinks, food & hospitality!! Keep up the great work!!
Summary: Location location location!! Everyone is so friendly and welcoming!! Employees were always smiling and ready assist you right away. K'ya bistro foods were amazing!! Rooftop servers and drinks were top noch!! All employees greeted us with big smiles. Managers were always at the front of their departments and were greeting all guests walked by!! Everything was great!! Service, location, room cleanliness, drinks, food & hospitality!! Keep up the great work!!
Manager Response: We are so grateful your amazing review, thank you.  It is truly our pleasure to hear that you enjoyed your experience with us from food to each member of our staff. Happy travels!

Summary Heading: Must go to rooftop but hit or miss on the rooms.
Summary: After multiple visits to the bar or restaurant, decided to stay for the night.  Checked out the smallest room and it is definitely small.  The room was fine but the bathroom is barely usuable.  No room what so ever for even a single person.  We upgraded to the next room with a view and it definitely was worth it.  Bathroom wasn't the cleanest either.  Definitely visit the rooftop or downstairs for HH.  Excellent bartender downstairs.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Quaint hotel right on the beach
Summary: It was a very small room, as advertised. The tv wasn't working properly so had to have service in room twice to fix and then show me how to fix myself.  Excellent location, roof top deck is delightful. Would opt for larger room next time.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us marykQ7295JE.  I'm so sorry to hear you experienced problems with the TV; I'm happy to hear we were able to get that fixed for you.  We have many different types of rooms from larger Spanish Style to the Casa Surf Rooms.  We look forward to helping you find the perfect room for your next reservation so you can explore more of Laguna and enjoy the Rooftop Lounge.

Summary: The two of us had an amazing time here at La Casa del Camino!   The location is spectacular, especially for the price. Though it is not directly on the beach, it is located right on the Coast Hwy with a two minute walk down. You don't get an ocean view out of your window, but the views from their Rooftop Lounge are spectacular, and the Happy Hour has great prices with good fare! We were especially impressed with the breakfast spread: eggs, french toast, pastries, fresh fruit, sausage and bacon, etc. And the breakfast attendant was so courteous (even when other guests were being incredibly rude)!! All of the front desk staff were so nice every time we had a question. My only qualm was with the bartender in the lobby - she could use a little lesson in hospitality, but her drinks
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to share your stay with our future guests.  So glad that you loved the food and our staff.  Our K'ya menu definitely offers a delicious variety for a value.  Thank you again!

Summary: This hotel is great if you want a casual beach stay for a great price.  The beach is literally a few steps away, there is an amazing rooftop deck with sweeping ocean views, and free breakfast (everything we ate at the hotel is amazing).  The only downsides are that the hotel is old and could use some upkeep, and none of the rooms have double-beds (although they are very spacious rooms). The hotel lobby and rooftop are definitely happening sports for the locals at night, and the staff is very nice.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review Britt Y. We are thrilled to know that you had a great experience and enjoyed our food and staff.  Our hotel was built in 1929, so while we want to keep the historic charm, we appreciate your feedback and always look forward to making improvements.   We can't wait for your return!

Summary: I was treated like a VIP by every staff member. I enjoyed the large modern room and the rooftop restaurant with a fantastic view. Front desk employee Bethany made me feel very welcome with her friendly, personal attention. The property is only a few steps from a beautiful beach.
Manager Response: What an awesome review. We sincerely appreciate your compliments of the hotel and staff and your acknowledgment of Bethany!  It is truly our goal to make sure all of our guests are treated like a VIP. We look forward to your return, RobH333.

Summary: It is a basic bed and breakfast, offers private bathroom, clean rooms and a great location in gran via for an affordable price. His location is in the middle between gran via and sol, nice and easygoing stuff. I do recommend because i felt very comfortable during my stay
Manager Response: Brusssss, we are so happy to hear that you were comfortable during your stay and that you were pleased with our great location.  Thank you so much for choosing La Casa del Camino for your trip to Laguna!

Summary: Remodeling and no heat in room put a damper on things....pictures make it look a lot nicer that it really is...prices were high and breakfast was subpar. Staff was friendly...I had requested no feather pillows or bedding prior to our visit...no attempt was made to fulfill my request
Manager Response: James F, we are saddened to hear about your stay and that we had disappointed you.  We pride ourselves on creating experiences for our guests .  I'd love the opportunity to speak with you further about your stay and make it right with you.

Summary: I stayed here with my boyfriend on a recent trip to California, we stayed here for 3 nights and on arrival it wasn't what we expected. We had a lot of bags in the car and couldn't find a car park or where to pull up so it was quite stressful. We called the hotel phone number only to be put through to an automated machine to then press numbers and find the front desk and all the while trying to find somewhere to pull up. They told us to go to the loading bay which was full with people parked.. So we had to pull up on the road side while I waited in the car and my boyfriend took the cases in and then checked in, then they told us where the car park was. So it was just a bit stressful.  The hotel decor is done to be rustic, with Mediterranean vibes which is quite cool but I think
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your review, we appreciate all of your feedback and will use it as a learning opportunity for our team.  I am happy to know that you enjoyed our cleanliness and service and also hope that you will give us another opportunity in the future.

Summary: My wife and I spent our 1 year anniversary here and were blown away by our experience. When we arrived, the staff noticed we were booked in a smaller than average room and moved us to a room more accommodating for a couple. What was even greater, she put us in the only room with its own balcony! (Since the hotel is very old, the rooms are smaller than what you would consider a "modern" hotel room being, but are by no means too small and honestly very quaint and charming.) As if that weren't enough, 30 mins after we checked in we heard a knock at the door... We opened it and they had brought us a bottle of champagne for our anniversary as a gift from the hotel!!! The staff here is truly top notch. There is a very good "tapas" style restaurant on the main floor with a bar, and
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: The workers were very good kind and gave me excellent service
Summary: the place was older needs carpet, but the service was out standing in a great location I would go back. I think its cozy and cute. love the themes. breakfast good too.. Thank you for taking care of all our needs/
Manager Response: Thank you for your 5 star review and feedback Diane!  We are so happy to hear you enjoyed your stay and we look forward to your return!

Summary: I love the location of La Casa del Camino.  It is just minutes away from Laguna's downtown and is located in Laguna's "H.I.P." district which offers boutiques, fabulous restaurants all within a minutes walk.  Not to mention that it is super close to the beach.  The views from the hotel's rooftop bar are spectacular including the Laguna coastline, hills, and village (look for dears and such on a roof across the street).  The rooms however leave a little to be desired...they are small and the walls are thin.  But for the price and location it is a place I will probably go back to.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My fiancee and I wanted to get away for a few days somewhere near the ocean water. We found this hotel online and booked a couple of nights for mid February.  At arrival the young lady at the front desk was having trouble finding our reservation, therefore the hotel manager Katie came to assist and was able to complete our check in. She was extremely warm and friendly along with the entire staff during our stay here. Aside from the great service we experienced there is a few bonuses to this hotel: A) Free breakfast is served every morning near patio area. B) There is rooftop lounge that overlooks the ocean. The food there is also delicious, drinks are good, music is great and you will definitely enjoy a beautiful sunset from here. C) A nice relaxing beach that is steps away from
Manager Response: none

Summary: Nice location, with sea views.  The rooms are small but interestingly decorated with individual themes.  Fun bar and restaurant with delicious salads on the rooftop.  Includes a gym pass, as well as a decent breakfast and wifi.  The staff were helpful and efficient.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I initially booked through Expedia and I stressed that we were traveling with a small dog. After booking the room, I called the hotel and I spoke with Lauren to confirm that I had a dog friendly room. The room that we booked was on the second floor, not applicable for people traveling with dogs. I cancelled with Expedia and I booked directly with Lauren and I got the room that I needed. The staff that I encountered (front desk, ice delivered and breakfast hostess) were all really friendly. The side door is 2 minutes to the steps leading down to the beach. Unload parking is next to the hotel and overnight parking is across the street. The roof top bar was packed, even on a Sunday night and we had to go elsewhere...so get there early. Please note that this hotel is about 80- years
Manager Response: none

Summary: Quaint and cute hotel near the ocean, rooms are kind of small but very clean and decorated very nicely, has a cool rooftop bar and excellent free breakfast, service was excellent and they let us check out late
Manager Response: none

Summary: The staff who welcomed us when we arrived late at night were friendly and tried to be helpful, but the king bed room we had booked had been downgraded to a queen and the television didn't work and couldn't be repaired until the following day. The bedroom was clean and the bed was comfortable, but the carpet in the hallway was fraying and looked tired. The sound insulation was not ideal as we could hear the plumbing in the room above early in the morning.The breakfast was adequate but the breakfast room was a bit tiny and grim.  It was better on the second morning when the little enclosed courtyard was open and we could sit outside.  Although we did not eat there, there is a restaurant attached to the hotel that is apparently very popular and it was hopping on Saturday night. And
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Quaint Hotel with AMAZING Roof Top Bar/Lounge
Summary: So this is my first review ever, and I am so glad that this place gets it. While it is an older hotel (no real AC, window ventilation, etc.) that doesn't mean that they should be overlooked. On PCH right by the beach, they have a small cove that is a two minute walk from the hotel, and they have rentals for chairs, towels, and umbrellas. While the cove isn't really meant for surfing or for swimming (rocky) it is still incredible nice to go and sit out by the water. The staff there are incredibly helpful and were extremely accomodating and looking to get you the best experience. For a $14 resort fee, we got a small breakfast (person there looking to only help you, which made the breakfast nice), parking (which is worth its weight in gold in Laguna) and all the rentals and
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: it's a fun choice on our laguna run!!!
Summary: pros...rooftop restaurant...with host/bartender pete...amazing happy "hour" downstairs bar...finally the suites designed by local companies founders...ie...quicksilver...roxy...etc...cons...90% staff lack of hospitality
Manager Response: none

Summary: I can't say enough good things about this hotel. For starters, the Experience Coordinator Lauren is the most valuable person at this hotel. She made me feel welcome by emailing me days before I arrived, and stayed in contact throughout and after my visit. She is amazing and I am grateful for having her as a connection for future visits.  Yes, it is an older hotel, filled with charm, quirks, elegance and fun. This is a low key party hotel. There's a party in the lobby, there's a party on the roof. The amazing, breathtaking expansive view from the rooftop lounge is unparalleled. The live music and charming friendly locals in the lobby bar next to the fireplace are wonderful. The all included buffet breakfast with scrambled eggs, French toast, bacon and sausage, oatmeal, muffins
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: GREAT location in Beautiful Laguna Beach!
Summary: We just spent two nights at this solid choice loaded with personality. Sunshine, the very professional and pleasant girl at the front desk started our visit off great by assigning us to a very nice King room on the first floor. The hotel is a bit old, and has wood floors, so you will hear noises above and around you. Bring earplugs! Other than a bit of noise, our stay was just awesome. We enjoyed the wonderful Rooftop bar 's Happy Hour, where you can get a good glass of wine for $5. The sunsets are spectacular. The breakfast each morning is awesome! The hotel will bring chairs and towels down to the tiny, very private beach just steps from the hotel. Parking is free and just a short, 3 minute walk away. We couldn't ask for more! We'll be back in the area soon and will stay again
Manager Response: none

Summary: I've been going to the roof top bar for years. Hence, I assumed that being such a fun place, why not stay here, right? WRONG! This hotel is very old. The rooms are smaller than my NYC (FIRST apartment) which means its super small. The sink is in the bedroom and its so small that the water gets everywhere. The staff is not accommodating at all. They are clearly not very busy, and yet they demand that everyone leaves on time. Hence I prefer the island hotel in newport beach. The decor is mediocre. The walls are so thin that you can literally hear people walking outside your room or talking. It takes away from any decent nights sleep. The parking is across the main PCH highway so that is also an inconvenience when you have baggage. There is no bell captain to grab your bags. They
Manager Response: Fatimah, I am very sorry about your experience at our hotel and would love an opportunity to make it right.  Yes, while we are a historic hotel, we also have a variety of room types available.  The way that some of the rooms have been designed date back to the time that  our charming hotel was a hostel and are compared to European style as they are quite cozy. I also appreciate the feedback regarding our staff.  I apologize for the  inconvenience with luggage, we do staff a Houseman to assist from 8am to 11pm and this should have been offered to you.  Breakfast also includes a chaffing dish full of eggs, french toast, bacon and sausage daily, this may have been missed when you joined us.  We hope you would give us another chance to make it right, but will definitely speak with the staff regarding your  feedback.

Summary: After researching hotels in Laguna online I booked a night at La Casa Del Camino accidently, I meant to book a night at Casa Laguna Inn... They are not similiar properties that's for sure!  Figured we would try them out for the night... However after a strange check in where the phone kept ringing in the background we were given a room which was 'apparently' an upgrade and it was horrible! The room was absolutely tiny and could not walk around the bed without tripping over. It was extremely old, smelly and noisy.. The bathroom was almost non existent with the sink being in the room... There was a portable air con unit on the ground and the tv was located above the window which was very strange...  We ended up walking out after 5 minutes as could not stay there and when we asked
Manager Response: Hello Brendan88, I am also very dispoointed to hear about your recent  experience at our hotel!  While we have many guests that absolutely love us, for others we just might not be the right fit.  We would defintely never want to penalize our guests if we were unable to meet thier expectations.  Thank you for giving us you feedback and hope that you would at least give us an opporunity at the Rooftop or K'ya!

Summary: i got here by recommendation.  the bar is great, it¬¥s has an excellent view on the sea, outstanding.  the staff serves different Kinds of  Drinks, live Music in the ground Floor.  im impressed, again nice Location !
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Funky art hotel in historic Spanish building near the beach
Summary: This hotel is in a beautiful historic Spanish building, relatively close to the center of Laguna Beach. Each room is unique -- the room I stayed in was a gallery of art. The featured artists vary over time. There were 11 large scale paintings -- it was quite striking! The room was also very cool in that it had a sitting area separated from the sleeping area, and even had a little office area and designer walnut clamshell chairs. I only had a partial ocean view; it could be worth asking for a room with a more direct view. The soap, shampoo and conditioner were lovely -- I didn't bother to use the ones I had packed. The bed was firm and the bedding was fresh and white.  The restaurant and bar of this hotel are also quite popular, and the food was delicious. There is no pool, and
Manager Response: TravelingmomNYC, thank you so much for sharing about your time with us.  We also appreciate you dining at K'ya, it is another hidden gem within our hotel.  Your description of  our Riviera Room was on point, now you have to come back and discover the remaining nine Casa Surf Project rooms. We'll have the wine waiting!

Summary Heading: Gorgeous hotel, perfect location, exquisite food!
Summary: I cannot wait to return. Although I'm a native OC gal, I currently live in Seattle so the sunshine and the perfect 72 degrees were a slice of heaven for me during my short stay. La Casa del Camino made my trip even better than I anticipated. I booked last minute, got lucky to get the last room with a partial ocean view (and got much better of a view than expected), ordered from their restaurant and had the yummiest tasty delights delivered to my room, including perfecg dirty martinis, exceptional customer service from the front desk to the waitress, and the room #208 just hit all the right buttons for me. I felt like I was stepping back in time, in the middle of Ernest Hemingway writing his latest novel or the set of Casablanca - loooooved it! Perfect for couples! Decor was a
Manager Response: Of all the gorgeous hotel joints, you stayed at ours. We love the comparison to Casa Blanca... and the experience you painted for your fellow Trip Advisor; from the customer service and room description to the favorite menu items. Here's lookin' at you, SheShootsPhotography, it was our truly our pleasure.

Summary Heading: Boutique hotel with a million dollar view
Summary: We enjoyed our stay in the 1929 vintage hotel .. If your are looking for quent and casual its your place. The rooms are cozy as the hotel was built in the 20's. We stayed in one of the surf rooms.  The view is really on the rooftop bar and restaurant which we really enjoyed ...
Manager Response: We loved reading your review Sue J!  Thank you and we can't wait to be a part of your next travel plans!

Summary Heading: One-stop shop for great bar and restaurant.
Summary: This was our second stay after 2 years.  Met up with friends on the rooftop bar, then went downstairs to a festive, packed restaurant and had a great crazy dinner combination (Quail, mushrooms, scallops, octopus).  It was fantastic.  The hotel, if you book online, tends to go up and down by the day on expedia, so pays to watch if you have time.  Having stayed there before, I mentioned so and asked for an upgrade if they had any.  When we checked in, we didn't get an ocean view upgrade, but captured Room 301, the only room with a big balcony overlooking the street.  Best room in the place if you ask me, so thanks to whomever arranged that.  Anyway, that's our take.  The room is ridiculously tiny, close to Italian specs.  To sit on the patio, we had one chair, and the fold-out
Manager Response: Thank you for your review Morobi, we are glad you enjoyed your overall experience with us.  We are glad you liked your room over looking the Coast Highway.  Next time you return, please reach out to me, we would be happy to see if we have any rooms with a view for you to try!  See ya on the next visit to Laguna!

Summary: Tiny room, my spouse had to climb across bed to get in,could not even walk on one side. There was an enormous portable A/C unit in the middle of the room,it was so tight I had to store my carry on sized suitcase in the shower!  There isn't a coffeemaker in the room and no ice easily available. Our partial Pacific view was a joke, only if the trees parted in the breeze for a moment.   Our TV didn't  operate even after 2 visits from the engineer,(who was nice and did make an effort, but they didn't offer to compensate us in anyway)   Maybe waiving the silly "Resort Fee"?  The breakfast was very yummy ,but that was the only saving grace.
Manager Response: Cuttingcows, we are so sorry that you were disappointed with your stay at our Hotel and I can certainly see where we have fallen short.  Although being built in 1929, our goal has been to  keep the charm of  our  history and add the comforts of modern day. We hope that you will give us an opportunity to make it right with you and show you why we have so many loyal guests.

Summary Heading: Fun Place to take in The Laguna Lifestyle!
Summary: We enjoyed our stay here, even though the noise level was a little loud. Unfortunately, we were just above the loading dock for the kitchen and could hear every delivery that came in. We requested a different room for our 2nd night, and the staff was very accommodating. Still a little loud! Rooftop was beautiful, Ky'a restaurant was very nice, as was the staff. Fun place to stay because you never have to leave as it's all right here!
Manager Response: Thank you for the review, Steve O. We are definitely a fun hotel with our location, staff and Rooftop Lounge!  I apologize for the noise level, our rooftop closes at 10pm on the weekends and 9 during the weekday.  I am glad my staff was quick to respond and move your room.  Please visit us again!

Summary: Quirky old fashioned facade with great rooftop bar. The rooms aren't just quite right. We had a surf room which was very very small due to having 2 cases. No a/c just a mobile unit which took up too much room. Wifi good downstairs not in the room. The reception staff were excellent.  Lots of steps, small lift which needs revamp as some of the rooms are undergoing now. Chairs and shade on the beach when required and breakfast was lovely.
Manager Response: Cathy and Crew- Thank you for taking the time to review your stay with us. The Hotel is a historic landmark built in 1928 with a European theme which does have some bearing on some of the room sizes. So glad to hear that you enjoyed our Roof top lounge with it's great views of the Pacific and the city. We hope to see you again on any future visits to Laguna Beach!

Summary: Best roof top view of a great sunset, happy hour with 1/2 price drinks, great bartenders and can make a killer mojito. Ate dinner at K'ya, the food was fantastic. The room had the most comfortable bed. The staff was very helpful and nice. We'll definitely stay again.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking in a little bit of everything during your stay with us, Tony L!  Hopefully you also got a chance to grab breakfast and use our beach service too.  Your photos are amazing, we can't wait to be a part of your next trip to Laguna Beach.

Summary: We had our wonderful wedding reception last September 20th at The Rooftop and decided there was no other place that we would rather celebrate our 1st anniversary. We reached out to Melissa DeAngelo since she was so great to work with during the wedding planning......she was once again happy to help and truly made our anniversary such a special special day for us. It was also a pleasure to meet the Rooftop manager Kevin, who checked on us many times throughout the evening, making us feel very special. We will always make the trip from Colorado to wonderful Laguna Beach and spend our anniversaries on The Rooftop. Thanks again for everything!
Manager Response: Jo S, we are so happy that we were able to be a part of your anniversary celebration. Thank you for allwoing us the privilege to be a part of another memory!  I will make sure to share this with Melissa, Kevin and the Team.  We will plan on seeing you soon.

Summary Heading: Vintage Laguna in the best part of the Village
Summary: If you are looking for a quaint, intimate boutique hotel in the prime part of the village, look no further.  This area has the best shopping- book store, home store, clothing, coffee houses- you can't get any better.    This part of Laguna also has some of the prettiest beaches.  From Oak St. to Pearl...these beaches are much more scenic and less hectic than those by Main Beach.   But....about the hotel.  Super quaint with old world Spanish architecture and decor.  Love the intimate lobby with bar and day bed.  Perfect for afternoon cocktail or meeting friends.  K'ya, the restaurant on the bottom floor has a quick, but fantastic happy hour loved by all the locals.    They often times have live music in the lobby, welcoming guests checking into the hotel.    The rooms, although
Manager Response: Victoria H., what a wonderful way to describe our hotel and your experience in Laguna. Your contribution will help our guests will have  great insight into the La Casa Del Camino and what a stay is like at pur hotel!  Thank you again for choosing to stay with us, we hope we are a part of an upcoming trip.

Summary: I had a great time in Lauguna, the hotel location was close to everything. The rooms were a little small, but we had fun. The staff is excellent and took good care of us as well.   One thing, the elevator was out of order and becuase of a wedding they moved the lobby from the lobby to a tiny courtyard (and breakfast Cafe).  A larger bathroom and bedroom would have made it 5 star. The carpets were worn and the staff took a day off from cleaning our room.
Manager Response: Richard W., we appreciate your review of La Casa Del Camino.  As a historic property, our Spanish rooms are cozy and a bit on the smaller side - the hotel was originally built  in 1929.  However, through the years we have been able to expand some of our rooms including our Spanish King rooms as well as our very special Casa Surf Rooms.  I am so sorry to hear that we missed a service on your room and appreciate your understanding through the event we held at the hotel.  We hope that you will return and we can showcase all of the La Casa charm!

Summary: We loved the free wifi, beach towels, secluded beach with provided beach chairs and umbrellas! Most of all the breakfast was AMAZING!! The rooms are just fine- not fancy- just enough for us. The man at the front desk- Murimur- something like that- was amazing. Helped me out big time with my payment and getting things worked out. We got a corner room on the 3rd floor and had a little balcony and just loved it. The rooftop was perfection as well. We really enjoyed the hotel!
Manager Response: Amanda E, thank you so much for the 5 Star Review!  Knowing that we were able to exceed your expecations on our service, The Rooftop Lounge experience and breakfast is exciting for all of us, I will especially share this with Mubashir. We hope your travels bring you back to La Casa del Camino in Laguna Beach!

Summary: A lovely quaint boutique hotel in Laguna beach. It is dated in some places and going through a lot of redevelopment work but it doesn't take away from the nice ambiance the hotel has.  Rooms are small and cosy with a traditional Spanish feel to it. The hotel has a great rooftop which gets busy in the evenings and can also be used in the morning to have breakfast. They provide free parking and access to a brilliant gym 2 mins walk from the hotel.
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to review us, Daniel M.  We arehappy to know that you enjoyed our cozy, historic feel and took advantage of our partnership with the Art of Fitness and taking in the view for breakfast at our Rooftop Lounge.  Come back to visit us soon.

Summary: This hotel has a beautiful rooftop ocean view where you can take your breakfast or have lunch or small plates and drinks in the evening.  The hotel needs some updating, but they are remodeling.  The work did not disturb us while we were there. Our room (Spanish Queen) was smaller that we typically like, so next time we'll reserve the Spanish King.  The location is great--we went to the Art festivals and Pageant of the Masters and used the Laguna Beach free shuttle which stops right outside the hotel door.  We never used the car while we were there.  We mentioned that it was our anniversary, and the hotel had a bottle of champagne iced and waiting after dinner.  Very nice touch.    They have a 10 pm quiet policy, so the rooftop crowd did not disturb us.  The staff was very
Manager Response: Kristin B. we were all excited to read and share your reviw with the team.  It sounds like you were able to enjoy much of Laguna during your visit, as well as our hotel.  Let us know when you are ready for us to book your Spanish King!

Summary Heading: Historic property, smaller rooms, great location
Summary: This is an older hotel where the bathrooms are updated, with Spanish style furnishings.  If you find old historic buildings with smaller rooms charming, they do this better than some other Laguna hotels.  The beach is steps away.  The main part of town is about a mile away by trolley.  There is a popular restaurant in the lobby and a packed rooftop bar with great views that attracts a young crowd.  It closes early so noise was not an issue.  It would be nice if hotel guests were allowed to reserve a table up there but I was told they didn't take reservations, although I did see a table being held for someone who was not a hotel guest.  There is a resort fee which covered the breakfast which was of very high quality, including eggs with vegetables in them, fresh berries, and real
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your review, Natsmavenus.  We appreciate you taking the time to describe your stay with us from the room to the beach and dining experience!  I am so sorry about any confusion regarding the reservation process for the Rooftop Lounge, this is actually a benefit that we offer to our hotel guests.  We just simply need to verify that the requested times are available.  On your next stay with us will make sure to take care of this request in advance or upon arrival so you can enjoy appetizers and view once again. Happy travels!

Summary Heading: A Nice Little Gem in Laguna Beach
Summary: We stayed at this hotel May 2014 and decided to stay again and bring our sister-in-law.  Be advised they are in the process of updating the rooms a bit.  However, it's still a little slice of heaven.  The hotel is literally located steps away from the ocean.  If you get an ocean view you can open your windows and hear the waves crashing on the beach, especially at night.  Everyone at the hotel is extremely friendly.  We love going to the rooftop and having a cocktail and watching the sunset.  Absolutely spectacular views!!!!  Would highly recommend.  The only thing I would not recommend is paying $70.00 each night for the upgrade.  It's really not worth it.  Would definitely stay at this hotel in the future.
Manager Response: Drinker53, thank you so much for staying with us this Summer.  I'm glad to hear that you enjoyed your experience at the hotel and Rooftop.  We are actually in the process of adding public restrooms for our guests and are in the final stages.  We have so many different upgrades available, I would love to show you our other unique options we have so that we can make sure your stay is 5-star worthy!  We look forward to welcoming you back.

Summary: This was a great hotel. The location of the hotel was excellent. We wanted something close to the Laguna Sawdust Festival and the Pageant of the Masters.  Hotel staff, breakfast items and restaurant at the hotel provided great service.  Only slightly negative comment would be that seal around the shower door was faulty and coming off and the fold up luggage rack in our room was broken, reported the same day, but not replaced.  Not that these were a big deal but just took a little away from the total feel of the room.
Manager Response: Dear Patricia H,  Thank you so much for sharing your experience with us. We are delighted that you enjoyed your stay with us and we appreciate your feedback in order to improve our service level. It would be our pleasure to welcome you back!  Best regards, Joe Rodriguez Director of Rooms

Summary: We visited for two nights in late June 2015. The location of the hotel was perfect, with good access to the beach and the hotel  were able to offer seats and towels. Our room was quite small but suited us well. The hotel was going through a make over but again it didnt worry us. The breakfast had plenty of options and it was really nice to sit on the balcony with the views of the Pacific Ocean. The only downside was we arrived after 10pm as we got delayed in traffic and there was no option for a meal. It was a Thursday night which may have been a factor and we eventually got something in the local supermarket.  The carpark was close by and staffed to enusre only hotel residents were able to use it.
Manager Response: Dear Colin G,  We are so happy to read that you enjoyed the ambiance and the service at our property. Thank you for choosing to be our guest and we hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back during future getaways!  Best regards, Joe Rodriguez Director of Rooms

Summary: My husband and I attended a family wedding in Laguna Beach and this was the hotel the bride and groom recommended. The location could not have been better as it was walking distance to all of the cute little shops and art galleries. Our room was very comfy, we had one of the surf suites. Huge walk in shower and comfortable bed. Our windows in our room looked out to the ocean. They were small, but this is an older building and we weren't here to sit in our hotel room. Clean and very safe feeling. We were very happy with the accommodations. The hotel had an awesome rooftop bar/restaurant and the sunsets were spectacular!! Good food, not great, but it was fresh and presented well. There is also another restaurant in the hotel with very good food. We had breakfast there and it had a
Manager Response: Dear Mary D,  We are truly grateful for your kind recommendation of La Casa del Camino and delighted to read that your stay allowed you to enjoy so many wonderful aspects of our Hotel. Thank you for sharing your kind compliments regarding your accommodations and the service you received. It would be our pleasure to welcome you back for another great stay in the future!  Best regards, Joe Rodriguez Director of Rooms

Summary: I will definely be back. Love everything about this place.  Close to everything.  Bar is open until midnight and I enjoyed their mojito.  Enjoyed the walk on the beach. Very affordable. Limited on parking as we where told but it didn't bother me since we flew in.
Manager Response: Dear phephot,  We are delighted to read that you enjoyed all aspects of your stay at La Casa del Camino. Thank you for your kind review and we will be looking forward to welcoming you back when your travels bring you to Laguna Beach!  Best regards, Joe Rodriguez Director of Rooms

Summary Heading: Excellent customer service in a beautiful setting
Summary: All my life, my family has walked past La Casa del Camino on our way down the hill from our house to Cress St beach, and my husband and I had a fun idea to spend three nights there this past week. I knew the history of the inn dated back to the 1920's and expected it to be a funky setting for our vacation. It was indeed! After being warmly welcomed by the staff, we were taken up to our room on the 3rd floor. Room 309 was much smaller, even, than my dorm room back in college, and we crawled over each other to get across the tiny room. We stayed one night and then asked about upgrades that might be available. The extremely helpful and friendly bellhop, Ivan, showed us a room on the second floor in one of the surf suites. For $75 more per night, it was well worth it! The surf
Manager Response: Dear ehsincolo,  Thank you for sharing your review of La Casa del Camino and your kind words about our staff and beautiful rooms. We are honored that you chose to stay with us and so happy to read that our team provided the most pleasant experience for you.  We hope to welcome you back again in the future!  With regards,  Joe Rodriguez Director of Rooms

Summary Heading: Great Locale, Great Rooftop Deck, 'Meh Hotel Rooms
Summary: Went here for a friend's birthday celebration. He made all the arrangements a couple months in advance and informed the place about the occasion. They reserved us a table on the roof top dining area which was very nice. We got to our rooms which were slightly bigger than your average walk in closet. My friend complained but of course there were no other rooms available. We gave them our room which was slightly bigger but overall not impressive. Rooms were also right by the service elevator that the entire staff uses and the staff were either not cognizant of the situation or didn't care that there were guest rooms there. My friend actually had to get up out of bed early in the morning and tell several employees to please keep it down. The roof top deck is amazing and the short
Manager Response: Dear Michael C,  Thank you for posting a review about your recent stay with us. We are happy that you and your friends chose to celebrate this special day with us at the Rooftop. At the same time though we are concerned to read about the inconvenience you experienced and would like to extend our apologies to you and your friend. Please be assured that we take serious note of all guest feedback and that we have reviewed your comments with the appropriate department heads so as to continually improve the quality of service we offer to our guests. We hope we will have the privilege of welcoming you back in the near future.   With regards,  Joe Rodriguez Director of Rooms

Summary: This is the 3rd visit to this property and it gets better every time.This was the best room we have had.It looked recently updated,but still retro cute.And we had a proper ocean view.( room 322).Got there early 12 noon and requested early check in..got lucky as room was ready.Rooftop bar for lunch ( great food and not expensive).Bartender Pete remembered us from previous visits.Quite impressive considering the amount of people he sees in a year.At night ate in restaurant ground floor at this hotel ,great food again and good friendly service. Next day walked 8 miles both directions on the beach which is only steps away. Breakfast is included and ample choices.We will return again later this year for all the area has to offer.You will not need your car once you are at hotel.
Manager Response: Dear PALMSPRINGSCOUPLE48,  We are very pleased that you have enjoyed your recent visit with us and the Rooftop Lounge. We appreciate your patronage and business and hope you will continue to stay loyal. We will be more than happy to welcome you back in the near future and provide you with an exceptional experience!  Joe Rodriguez Director of Rooms

Summary: Booked our stay based on photos from the website but arrived to a very different picture.  Hotel is quite dated, not kept up, very noisey & we were placed in a small, terribly smelly room with stains on the carpet.  Positives were: beautiful rooftop views of the ocean, free parking & complimentary breakfast. This is not a family friendly hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Tiffany W,  Thank you for taking the time to post a review about your recent stay with us. We consider your feedback truly invaluable and we would like to apologize for any inconvenience or discomfort you have experienced during your stay. Please feel free to contact us directly to discuss your experience. we would appreciate the opportunity to welcome you back so that we may rectify your experience and regain your trust.  Joe Rodriguez Director of Rooms

Summary: My husband and I scheduled a much needed get away and booked a room at La Casa del Camino. Excited for our stay when we arrived at the Hotel, there was no valet and we had to drop our luggage at 3 minute loading/unloading, park a block away and walk back to the Hotel. Not the worst part of the trip, but just the beginning.  We checked into the hotel and head up to our room.  Quite musty smelling and tons of noise as I believe we were next to the kitchen and right by the stairs to the Roof Top Lounge.  We decided to head up to the Roof top for pre dinner cocktails and appetizer.  We sat in open seating next to a young gentleman with two young woman.  It took our server quite some time to even get to us.   We ordered 2 drinks and guacamole. Once they finally came out and we
Manager Response: Dear Asa P,  We want to thank you for taking the time to share your concerns regarding the issues you encountered during your recent stay with us. Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience that has made your experience less than exemplary. We consider your feedback truly invaluable and can assure you that we have already reviewed your comments with the appropriate department heads to ensure future excellence for all our guests. We would appreciate the opportunity to welcome you back to the best possible service so that we may redefine your experience and show you our sense of hospitality in every aspect of your stay.  Joe Rodriguez Director of Rooms

Summary Heading: Best Roof Top Lounge with View
Summary: Very nice rooftop bar, great view of the beach and ocean. Perfect to watch the sunset.  You do have to go up narrow stair way to get there, but worth it!  This was our second time there.  The first time was October 2013, the atmosphere seemed a little more lively and the bartender was great. This time, the waitress was a little snotty. But will go again, next time we are in Laguna beach. Here's a couple of photos.
Manager Response: We are delighted to welcome you back for a third time and read you thoroughly enjoyed your stay at La Casa del Camino. Our team strives to make sure all of our guests are taken care of and create a memorable experience each and every time. We look forward to welcoming you both back soon!

Summary: Thank you to the staff and especially the lady in the kitchen by the courtyard suggesting we go to teh rooftop to eat, enjoy the view and watch the whales and dolphins. We did it all and saw both whales and dolphins. Our second visit their and first stay. We were pleased we came back. Room was more than adequate and
Manager Response: Dear Sebelcoolangatta,   What an exciting thing for you to be able to see both whales AND dolphins while enjoying your breakfast at the Rooftop Lounge! Your feedback on your stay is very much appreciated and your kind about our breakfast hostess will be shared with her! We are extremely happy that you chose to stay at our beautiful little historic casa on your second visit to Laguna Beach. We hope that was the first of many stays to come! Please feel welcome to contact us at the hotel directly when you plan your next visit to the area so that we can help make your next stay even more memorable! We look forward to your next visit!

Summary: The bed was excellent, the check-in staff was very friendly and helpful.  The room lacked much in the way of desk top or surface space in the sleeping room or in the bathroom, and that was a little tricky for two people.  We appreciated the breakfast availability each morning and thought it was a very good value.  The rooftop was a happening place for younger folks and they really enjoyed themselves up there.  The good news for those older and not interested in the noise felt better knowing the noise was hut down after 10:00pm.
Manager Response: Dear Betsy,   It‚Äôs an absolute pleasure to know that you enjoyed your stay at our little casa! We appreciate all your kind words in regards to our team and services. We‚Äôre glad you took comfort in knowing that we take our guests comfort seriously and strictly adhere to our no noise policy after 10 pm. Our hotel is a popular location that attracts a very diverse crowd because of the gorgeous views at Rooftop Lounge and fabulous food from K‚Äôya Bistro so we understand that it can get really busy and loud with the non-stop flow of people coming in and out of the hotel but still yet, we consider our guests comfort and are sure to remain vigilant in making sure our guests are not inconvenienced. We truly appreciate you noticing our efforts in this matter.

Summary: Very pleased with all aspects of the hotel. Friendly and helpful staff. As mentioned by others the views from the rooftop bar were amazing. There is only one downside which is no fault of the hotel. They do provide chairs and umbrellas for the beach but there is only a small area of sand directly below. To be able use the beach it is very much dependent on the tides so it may mean moving further down the coast and transporting the chairs could be a problem.
Manager Response: Dear Roibush3,   We‚Äôre extremely delighted to hear that you had a wonderful stay with us during your recent visit to beautiful Laguna Beach! It is unfortunate that access to the beach closest to us is subject to the whims of Mother Nature; on the other hand, we are very fortunate to have more than 20 beaches in Laguna Beach with many of them being in short walking distance to our own. We understand the chair and umbrella service can be troublesome in the instance that the tide covers up most of the sandy area to lounge in so that is definitely something for us to consider improving moving forward. Thank you so much for your feedback; we really appreciate your kind words which will be shared with the entire team! We look forward to your next visit!

Summary: I had a short weekend stay at this hotel and found it old fashioned and not in a quaint way. The rooms are compact and the en-suite bathroom is tiny. I visited the rooftop bar during happy hour and paid $8 for the worst mojito I had ever tasted. I have no idea how they would have possibly charged $16 for that at original prices.  The restaurant adjacent to the reception also has a happy hour with food and drink which is a much better proposition. The low point of the stay was the breakfast......... this is served buffet style in the basement, with the option of taking your plate onto the rooftop area which is a nice option as the view from the basement lacks any character.
Manager Response: Dear Pablo,   Thank you for your comments in regards to your recent stay at our hotel! We‚Äôre disappointed that you didn‚Äôt quite enjoy your stay. We expect our guests to enjoy high quality service as well as food and drinks so it saddens us to hear that you didn‚Äôt receive a great drink, especially since mojitos are ‚Äúsort of our thing!‚Äù  We truly hope that we get another opportunity to change your opinion of our hotel! Please feel welcome to contact us directly at the hotel to discuss more details of your stay or to potentially discuss another trip to our property. We sincerely hope to see you again for a future stay!

Summary Heading: If you want the Laguna scene
Summary: LA Casa is a great little hotel that's been popular with the locals for years.  The rooftop bar is great with amazing views at sunset. It tends to get a bit crowded in summer months.  Rooms are small but nice. This is a great little boutique that tends to be a little higher priced, but I still like it.
Manager Response: Dear Dexter,  Thank you for your review on our hotel! We appreciate your feedback and are delighted to hear that you love our little casa! The size of our rooms may be small but we like to believe that the service we provide is the main appeal to our hotel. Again, we thank you and hope to see you again on your next visit to our hotel whether it‚Äôs to stay the night, have a couple of cocktails on the Rooftop lounge and enjoy the sunset, or to dine at our lovely award winning K‚Äôya Bistro! Until next time‚Ä¶

Summary Heading: Good Location, Caters to Younger Crowd
Summary: Arrived early and the unfriendly female front desk clerk would not let us check in until precisely 3:00p. Room was very small, but we expected that based on reviews.  Our view was of the window at the front desk so we kept our drapes closed. Complimentary bottled water is for the FIRST night ONLY. So why include it in their list of perks? When I asked about it, they made a big deal - a tad embarrassing. First night (Friday) was super noisy. Parking was fairly convenient, especially for that part of town, but made for compact cars. Beach was convenient. Nice complimentary breakfast. Will not stay there again.
Manager Response: Dear Dawn,   Thank you for taking the time to write about your recent stay at our hotel! We‚Äôre disappointed and so sorry for the issues you faced while here at our property. Please know that our guests comfort is one of our utmost priorities, so to hear that it was super noisy on one of the nights you were here and that you were not greeted in a more welcoming manner is extremely disheartening. We will share your comments with our team and work to provide a better experience for all of our guests.   We truly appreciate your feedback and would love to hear more about your stay so please feel welcome to contact us directly at the hotel. We would love the opportunity to make things right and leave you with a more positive impression of our hotel and services.

Summary Heading: WARNING: Hotel caters to locals - Not worth it!
Summary: I stayed here for business and thought it'd be the perfect beach-front hotel to come back to after 8 hours of work. BIG mistake! There were a couple positives, the hotel is located within walking distance to the beach and they offer beach towels/chairs/umbrellas with the price of the hotel room which is nice! They also offer a delicious breakfast buffet with a variety of hot/cold breakfast options. However, they keep an attendant at the breakfast buffet who just stands there watching everything you do and has a hand out for a tip. It felt like the hotel wanted someone there to make people less likely to binge on free food ha - The female worker literally stood there with attitude and rudely stared at you the entire time. Her job description must say 'make guests feel
Manager Response: Dear Jesse,   Thank you so much for your review on your stay with us in January! We want you to know that we appreciate all of your feedback on your experiences during your stay with us. We seek to characterize our hotel as a fun and comforting place to be, whether you return from a long day of work or a casual day/night out on the town. Our hotel is very popular with visitors from all over and locals alike because of the historic significance of our building and the fabulous eats/drinks from both the Rooftop Lounge and K‚Äôya Bistro. In fact, the local community is a large part in the success of our hotel due in part to the character and personality that they bring to the environment. However, our hotel guests are very important to us. We aim to produce only positive memorable experiences that our guests can take with them to share with friends and family so again we sincerely apologize for falling short on delivering this during your stay. We constantly strive to improve our services and keep a high standard of cleanliness to make sure our guests are completely comfortable and satisfied with their time at Casa del Camino.   We would love to hear more about your stay! If you have an opportunity to contact us directly at the hotel, we would be delighted to discuss your stay in more detail in hopes that we can invite you back to our hotel for a more positive experience.

Summary Heading: Beautiful Hotel - Not great for business travellers
Summary: I stayed here for two nights for a business trip in the 1st week of May.  This was my 1st visit to the Laguna Beach area.  As someone who normally likes modern hotels, I couldn't help but appreciate how beautiful the rooms and decor were, but it may not be the ideal place to stay for business travellers.  Check-in seemed longer than necessary.  The front desk person was pleasant, but seemed to be in a bit of a daze.    I got a handicap accessible Spanish King room on the 1st floor.  The room looks like just the pictures on the hotel website - an incredibly beautiful room, equipped with a good sized LCD TV, mini-fridge and a safe that can hold a standard laptop.   The bed was quite comfortable.  Because I had a handicap accessible room, the bathroom seemed really large - and was
Manager Response: Dear Guest,   Thank you for your review on your recent stay! It's an absolute pleasure to hear that you enjoyed your stay despite being here on a business trip. Travelers that stay for business at our hotel usually enjoy it because of our unique qualities. We hope to see you again for a future stay, hopefully for a more intimate getaway!

Summary: I have written about the La Casa del Camino before with an unfavorable review. But yesterday I found that that is not entirely true. My husband and I visited the Roof Top Lounge, which most folks in the area will tell you is beautiful. Above the hotel is a lovely open air bar with great views. Get there early or you will not get a seat. Drinks are good. People are nice. While there I was very much in pain and desperately needed a bandaid for my foot. As a last resort I asked a manager standing by if he could help me. Much to my surprise he said yes asked me if I needed anything else and he returned with just what I needed. His name is Joe Rodriguez. One of the most kind and sincere person I've met there at the hotel. My hats off to Casa for this wonderful employee. Now if the
Manager Response: Dear Guest,   Thank you so much for your kind words about the service at our hotel! We truly appreciate you and hope that you come to visit us again. The next time you plan on being in Laguna Beach for the night please give us a call at the hotel directly so that we can help you with booking a reservation, we would love to have you as one of our hotel guests! Keep in mind that if you stayed at our hotel that you are allowed 24 hour access to the Rooftop lounge so it's possible to enjoy the Rooftop in a less crowded and more intimate setting. Again, thank you for your review! We look forward to your next visit.

Summary: All I have to say about this wonderful hotel is you must stay here!!!!   Hotel manager made sure we had a great stay.  The rooftop is the absolute best. You will not have a better view of the Pacific Sunset anywhere !!
Manager Response: Dear Guest,   Thank you for your review on your recent stay with us! I'm delighted that you felt very comfortable at our property and acknowledge our efforts to make your stay an experience to last a lifetime! We sincerely look forward to your next visit to La Casa del Camino.

Summary: I've been coming to the Rooftop bar for years....this time decided to stay the night. Cute place - room VERY clean.  We were on the 1st floor, near the exit - so not the best placement but not horrible.  Access to the rooftop for hotel guests after 10 is great - we went up with a couple friends with margaritas we ordered at the bar downstairs.  We were the only ones there until we left at 11. Front desk gave us blankets too!  The only complaint - the air conditioning in our room was a floor unit that was VERY loud.  Luckily I brought ear plugs :)
Manager Response: Dear Guest,   Thank you so much for your review on your recent stay with us! I'm absolutely delighted to hear that you enjoyed your first time staying over night in our hotel and that you frequent the Rooftop Lounge. 24 Hour Rooftop access is one of the biggest perks of being a hotel guest and I'm happy that you were able to take advantage of that with a couple of friends. We hope to see you again in the near future for another nights stay.

Summary: I stayed at La Casa del Camino for three nights with my husband and 7 month old. While the hotel is kind of a hub of all things hip-and-cool in Laguna Beach and maybe not perfect for small children, the surf suite worked out perfectly! The building is older, but the room is brand new, clean, spacious and has great views. The walls are thick which allowed our baby to go to sleep early and sleep quietly through the night - even with a party going on upstairs. The breakfast each morning is a great way to get started and the staff couldn't have been nicer. The hotel also has great performances in the lobby each night with singers and cocktails which draws quite a fun crowd. The rooftop is one of the best in Laguna!   I would definitely stay again and really had a nice visit to
Manager Response: Dear guest,   Thank you for your review on your most recent stay with us at La Casa del Camino! We truly appreciate all of your kind words about our rooms and service. We are absolutely delighted to hear that you enjoyed the fun atmosphere within the lobby during the weekends with our performers.  We sincerely look forward to your next visit to Laguna Beach but just hope that it's not too long until we see you again since you have to travel some ways to get to us. Again, thank you for your review and for choosing our hotel for your visit to Laguna Beach!

Summary: This is an older hotel on the beach side of the main highway but not on the beach itself: it looks over the roofs of vacation apartments below. Lots of character, plenty of room in the "Surf ocean view" room. The rooftop bar was lots of fun and very popular in the evening, and we could bring our breakfast up there in the morning - but of course there was some noise from people coming down past our room later at night. There also is a good restaurant and a mic for singers off the first floor lobby. All in all, not your cookie-cutter hotel but one with character and its pluses and small minuses.
Manager Response: Dear guest,   Thank you for your recent review on your stay with us at La Casa del Camino! We appreciate your comments in regards to the character of our little hotel. We are all happy to know that you enjoyed your stay overall despite the minor negatives you experienced at our hotel. We continually strive to improve our hotel and service in all areas so we hope that you notice some positive changes during your next stay with us. We look forward to serving you again in the near future.

Summary: My daughter, Mom, and I visited this beautiful hotel right on the beach in Laguna.  The front desk was very kind, rooms were clean, and it is almost as if they have their own private beach.  I loved the whole feel of this hotel.
Manager Response: Dear guest,   Thank you so much for your review on your recent stay at our hotel! I'm glad that you and your family enjoyed your visit. We definitely look forward to your next visit with us!

Summary: nice and cozy, room was very small and tv mounted on the wall was small too.  mid range.  there was a scuffle w/ the guests next door so it interrupted my sleep but aside from that, good experience.  wish the hotel could have tried to make reparations for the disturbance but they didn't even address it, even though the police came.
Manager Response: Dear guest,   Thank you for your recent review on your stay at our hotel! I'm glad that you seem to have overall enjoyed your stay at our hotel. I am sorry for the disturbance you experienced with the guests neighboring your room.
