The traffic going up and down the stairs to the very busy rooftop bar spills into the hallways outside the rooms. The bar downstairs has live music until 10 pm, and big crowds.
Manager Response: Thank you for your candid review. We are happy to know you enjoyed our boutique hotel and our great team of staff members. Your compliments to our team are so appreciated.  Your observations of our ambiance are very fair.. We are one of the most popular hot spots for both locals and visitors alike, given our great location, wonderful restaurant and world class Rooftop Lounge. The guests who enjoy our hotel most are those looking to stay in the midst of the energy and atmosphere that is Laguna Beach. We pride ourselves on maintaining a friendly, relaxed, fun and energetic environment for everyone that visits.  Thank you again for taking the time to post your feedback.

Summary Heading: Top of the world Ma, top of the World (James Cagney)
Summary: Imagine sitting in a fabulous bar, with great food , wonderful views, charming staff , good service , efficiency of provision, views over Laguna Bay and the Pacific to die for - yes it does exist and the prices are not bad either. Then at happy hour to have wonderful food  served at the bar by Sarah , a girl full of charm and energy. Then the bonus of the meal to be half price. Fantastic . No wonder this place was packed with the locals who know a great deal when they see it . We changed rooms to the Surf suites as the smaller rooms were quite dark and a bit dingy. Here in the upgrades the views were simply magnificent . You have to park over the road but is free, the hotel is near to all that Laguna has to offer with suberb sunsets. Do not miss the rooftop bar
Manager Response: Thank you for your lovely review! We are certainly happy to hear that you enjoyed your Casa Surf Suite with a view, our Rooftop Lounge, and our Lobby Bar. Your compliments to our team, and to our lovely Sarah, are very much appreciated. Thanks again for your comments and compliments.

Summary: Nice, older, remodeled property. On busy street. Great views, restaurant and rooftop lounge.  Very friendly staff, off site parking on surface lot with hotel guest pass. Walking distance to lots of shops, restaurants and a great little speciality food store.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: The best place to stay in Laguana Beach + stunning roof terrace
Summary: Finding a good hotel in Laguna Beach is a nightmare - most are on PCH and suffer from noise, they are very expensive and of questionable quality. I decided to try La Casa Del Camino on the off-chance because the Fairmont Newport Beach was fully booked. I was glad I tried it!  The good stuff: a) The staff were so friendly, helpful and diligent - the bell boy, front office and breakfast staff - it is so good seeing people doing a good job with a smile! b) The roof terrace was breathtaking - amazing views through 180 degrees north and south. I could have spent all day there with my laptop. c) My room was very clean and the whole hotel felt well cared for.  The ok stuff: a) Breakfast was simple and I liked what was on offer but if you are going to stay a week it would be boring b)
Manager Response: Thank you for your comprehensive review. Your compliments and endorsement as "the best place to stay in Laguna Beach" are appreciated so much! We can see that you travel quite often, and we welcome your candid comments. Many thanks, and we hope to host you again soon!

Summary: My mom and I both purchased gift certificates for my husband and I as a Christmas gift. We spent 2 nights here. It is a small inn located within a one minute walk to the beach and about a mile from downtown. The overall feeling of the hotel is Spanish . There are several rooms which are very European. Some of these rooms are tiny with the exception of the king Spanish room which is lovely and more spacious. We originally booked this room but were upgraded to one of the more modern surf suites for a minimal charge. We stayed in the Riviera suite which was great. It has a partial ocean view. The bed was comfortable, and I loved the separate sitting area with 2 very cool chairs. We toured several of the surf suites. They were all unique and fun. The lobby is gorgeous with a huge
Manager Response: Thank you for posting such a great review. We are so happy that you took the opportunity to tour our many room styles and write about your recommendations. I'm sure many Tripadvisor shoppers will appreciate reading about your experience as they search for a reputable hotel.  We are very grateful for your kind words, and hope to have the opportunity to host you and your husband again.

Summary Heading: Nice, but a couple big disappointments
Summary: Good feel and many lovely features about this hotel, but cannot get over a couple nagging issues that ruined the whole experience for me: 1) Rooms are TINY- the website pictures don't really demonstrate that- it's a bit of a joke really 2) My room was also incredibly dark and dingy- couldn't see much at all even with drapes open 3) The rooftop bar is AWESOME, but they close at 9pm and FORCE you to leave- even if you're a hotel guest- just so they can clean up. At 9pm. Weird. 4) Food in K'ya was very nice and reasonably priced- definitely recommend this- feels like very good value.
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to post a review of your experience. I can understand your point about some of our guest rooms being small, which is why they are aptly named "Petite Queen" rooms; these are the lowest priced rooms we offer. We also have many other room styles which are much larger, namely our "Spanish King" and our Casa Surf Suites, which comprise about half our hotel. We are happy to hear you were able to enjoy our Rooftop Lounge, which does indeed close at 9pm during the weekdays per city noise ordinance. We do allow our hotel guests access to the Rooftop any time, day or night, as long as we don't get neighborhood or city complaints. I am very sorry to hear that you felt "forced" to leave so the staff could clean up; we will be conducting a supplemental training to our Rooftop team that emphasizes our policy for hotel guests to have 24hr access to the Rooftop. Your candid comments and feedback are welcome and appreciated. We hope to have the opportunity to host you again in one of our larger, brighter guest rooms.

Summary: Needed some beach time and saw a deal for the La Casa del Camino.  I'm so happy I discovered it.  It's a beautiful old hotel with lots of character close to the beach.  My room was small, but cozy and comfortable.  The staff was very friendly and shared lots of local places to eat and things to do.  The free parking was a nice bonus and I enjoyed the complimentary breakfast in the quaint little courtyard.  I'd stay here over a modern, fancy, generic resort anytime!
Manager Response: We're so happy you discovered us too! Thank you for your kind review... we look forward to hosting you again!

Summary: Was able to book this room day of and totally lucked out once we saw what we were getting! This was a wonderful hotel right on the water. Full of charm. Small rooms, but a great classic decor, dark hardwood floors. Simple. Amazing rooftop bar, that, though crowded, we caught a beautiful sunset while drinking some awesome drinks.
Manager Response: none

Summary: La Casa Del Camino is a gem amongst rocks. If you are into classical Spanish design and architecture this place is for you! From the moment my girlfriend and I walked in the door we are immediately in love with the ambiance. The staff was amazing, starting with the person I would have to say is responsible for us having an amazing first impression. When you check in, ask for Norma if you can, everyone is so friendly but she has a certain spark and charisma that lights up the room and our attitudes. Kudos for Norma! There's a very nice bar at the lobby with a huge fireplace and lounge area, where the live music is being played. Pay attention to who's playing they will be famous one day! The food at he Bistro is amazing, but if you'd like venture outside, not only is La Casa Del
Manager Response: We are so thrilled to read your thoughts on your recent stay! Thank you for your comprehensive review of your 12 night stay. We're glad you got to experience many different guest rooms and all the amenities we are so proud to offer. Feel free to contact Norma directly before your next visit so she can set you up with your favorite room :) Thank you again for your loyalty... we look forward to providing you many years of wonderful memories in Laguna Beach!

Summary Heading: Nice, comfortable room, friendly service, shockingly bad breakfast!
Summary: My fianc√© and I spent a night at La Casa del Camino.  We choose it for its great location and value.  We were pleased with the room, cleanliness, friendly service and the complimentary shuttle service they provided to take us to dinner the night of our stay.    Our one, major complaint was the shockingly bad "hot" breakfast that came with our package.  For anyone that has eaten at the hotel's K'ya Bistro or The Rooftop, this was NOT the same level of culinary excellence.  Cold, egg and veggie scramble, all the french toast was gone from the buffet, the sausages were not browned properly so they looked unappetizing and tables took ages to get cleared.  Such a shame for a boutique property that excels in so many other ways.  Wish we would have spent our morning in Laguna
Manager Response: none

Summary: I travel to Laguna for business every month and have stayed in every hotel in this town. Casa Del Camino is my favorite by far. Like others have said in reviews here, Norma (who runs the front desk) is part of the hotel's secret. She is so incredibly helpful and welcoming ~ she always makes me feel like I am coming home, rather than going away! (The entire staff exudes warmth and seem genuinely happy to help as if they too feel a part of the "family" here.)  The location of this place is perfect-stairs to the beach and without exception the best rooftop bar/restaurant in town- I( watch sunrise and sunset from the deck every day). The rooms are super cozy and clean without any of the cheap feeling "hotel-y" decorations or fixtures and excellent homemade breakfast buffet in
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed in Laguna for the night following a Christmas party and this hotel was perfectly located.  Staff were very helpful and courteous in all respects.  The room was small but bed comfortable.  Breakfast was not huge in variety but was very tasty.  At the suggestion of the check-in guy we asked for trays and took our breakfast up to the roof bar to enjoy the stunning ocean view.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind review! We are happy to hear that you enjoyed your recent stay. Your compliments are very much appreciated, and we hope to have the opportunity to host you again. Warm Regards, La Casa del Camino staff & Management

Summary Heading: Outstanding boutique hotel with rooftop sunset bliss and so much more
Summary: I travel frequently for personal as well as business, and have high expectations for both. Casa exceeds my expectations each and every visit, and honestly just keeps getting better. The staff is warm and friendly, and always available. The rooms are spotless and uniquely designed. More importantly, they are incredibly comfortable and conducive to a great night sleep. The rooftop is the best spot in Laguna- 12 months a year. The food all around is superb, especially love the complimentary breakfast.  The location and proximity to downtown Laguna and the beach is ideal.   The only complaint I have is that at some point I have to check out of Casa. It is like a home away from home..... I absolutely love it.
Manager Response: We are excited to have you as a loyal guest of our hotel! Thank you so much for your kind words and compliments. We look forward to continuing to be your "home away from home!" Sincerely, La Casa del Camino staff & Management

Summary Heading: Boutique hotel with a lot of heart.
Summary: First of all Norma at the front desk was amazing.  Everyone at the hotel was so sweet and nice. They genuinely seemed caring. My fianc√© had just proposed that am and part of the surprise was the hotel for the night.  The room was small, but we weren't there to hang out in the room all day. It's just steps to the beach and the rooftop bar was magical. The restaurant downstairs is gluten friendly, which I loved. The prices were cheap, which my fianc√© loved. The free breakfast in the am was really good. There was no need for us to leave the hotel at all. We spent a magical 24 hours without ever having to leave the hotel. Thank you Hotel Del Camino
Manager Response: Dear Jasmine S, It was our pleasure to host you and your fianc√© on the night of your engagement. Your compliments to Norma are greatly appreciated and have been passed along :)  Thank you for kind words. We are so happy for the two of you, and wish you all the best!  Sincerely, La Casa del Camino staff & Management

Summary Heading: immaculate art gallery room, great location, friendly, a place for the art lover
Summary: My boyfriend and I loved this place and would return in a heartbeat! Located less than a block from the beach in cute downtown Laguna Beach, it looks like an old Spanish-style historic hotel from the outside. And it is! (built 1927), however our room couldn't have been more modern! We stayed in one of the rooms that has been decorated in collaboration with surf and skateboard companies, the Casa Surf Project. When we opened the door to our small suite, it was like walking into a colorful, beautiful mod art gallery. We loved it! It was exactly to our taste and style with about 12 paintings by a single artist covering all walls, even the bathroom.  Our window opened up to a partial view of the ocean and the bathroom was immaculate with the best glass shower and tall, square
Manager Response: Thank you for posting such a lovely description of your stay in our "Riviera" room, part of our Casa Surf Project. It was a pleasure to host you during the Thanksgiving holiday.  We are excited to hear about the things you enjoyed most about your get-away. Your compliments are appreciated, and we hope to have the opportunity to host you again soon. Warm Regards, La Casa del Camino staff & Management

Summary: It was my husband's 60th and we wanted to get a really good taste of southern CA. La Casa del Camino was our 1st stop and turned out to be our favorite overall. When we arrived they had a chilled bottle of champagne waiting to help us celebrate. From the entire staff (housekeeping, front desk and restaurant waitstaff), they went over the top in customer service. Always a smile and "no problem." The roof top deck was a nice option as the weather was beautiful and sunsets spectacular. The old Spanish d√©cor and beauty throughout was most comforting. Although  rooms are small, the bed and shower are what is most important and they lived up to expectations. Walking distance to everything and part of the service is to an adjacent gym.  Just what we wanted!. We highly recommend this
Manager Response: Dear Patti S, Thank you for choosing to celebrate your husband's birthday with us! It was such a pleasure to host you both. Your compliments to our friendly staff are appreciated, and have been passed along. We are thrilled to know how well you enjoyed your stay, and we look forward to welcoming you back soon. Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: I bought this night's stay at a silent auction and live nearby. It was so fun to have a staycation in a hotel. I had no idea they'd put in a new bar in the lobby, a very friendly atmosphere! Food at K'Ya was delish!! Also, had no idea that they are connected with the "Art of Fitness" gym just across the street and that they offer towels and umbrellas for the beach. Too bad we couldn't stay for the full breakfast served complimentary the next morning. And I also must add that our room with surf theme of surfwear company Gotcha was incredible with the most fantastic book about Jimi Hendrix I've ever seen. Ok so do you get the point? This is a great hotel in Laguna Beach!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: I took a chance and booked this cute little hotel for two nights last week. I was taking my daughter away for some much needed girl bonding time. I had read the reviews and with fingers crossed headed down to the beach. We were greeted by super friendly staff, an immaculate room and though it was small like other reviewers stated, we didn't mind because anyone crazy enough to stay in their room to much with the ocean just steps outside your door is crazy in the head. PCH can be a little noisy at night on weekends but really the location is worth it. We walked everywhere the entire time we were there. Lots of fun places to eat and great shopping too. So basically if you're on the fence with whether or not to book, I say go for it! Staff was ready and waiting to serve whether with
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to post a review of your stay. We are thrilled to hear about the things that made an impression on you and your daughter. Thank you for your kind words and recommendations. We look forward to hosting you again soon *for your romantic getaway! With Gratitude, La Casa del Camino staff & Management

Summary Heading: Relaxing night away in Laguna Beach
Summary: Awesome views of the ocean, great location in Laguna, beautiful rooms and excellent continental breakfast! Close to great restaurants and shops. The staff here is also really nice. Always my favorite place to stay in Laguna.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was my first time in Laguna beach! Best choice my husband and I made! Beautiful location!! We had read many wonderful reviews on the hotel, so we were looking forward to our stay here! Our room was amazing with a beautiful view! We stayed in one o the surf rooms! Super cute as can be! Our entire stay was amazing! The staff is amazing!! You guys all rock!! Our favorite part was the breakfast! Cute as can be set up that they have! Veronica was the highlight of our stay, it's great to see a smiling and happy face early in the morning! She is sweet as can be! Super helpful with anything we needed from the breakfast aspect to helping us book a reservation on a busy Saturday. I can't wait to return to see her and her loveliness! Amazing aspect to your entire hotel! I send her my
Manager Response: Dear Soccermomsd22, We are thrilled to hear how you enjoyed your recent stay at La Casa del Camino! Your kudos to Veronica are appreciated, and she is so happy to have contributed to your positive experience in Laguna Beach. We are truly lucky to have such a wonderful team :)  Thank you for taking the time to post your review. We look forward to welcoming you back again soon! Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: Picked this hotel out from a host of options and were so glad with our decision! Just steps from a great semi-private section of beach and close to many restaurant options. Had lunch on the rooftop restaurant and it was delish. Guest parking just across the street. One of the best complimentary breakfasts we've had and a great atmosphere to boot.   The room (#311) was perfect for our needs. Some may find it small, but the bed was comfortable, had a safe and small fridge nicely hidden in the decor of the room. The bathroom tub/shower were great, had a view of the ocean and we could hear the waves at night. Free WiFi too. There was some alley noise one morning from garbage collection, but that stuff happens and was over in a minute.  If we ever need a place to stay in Laguna
Manager Response: Dear wagostago, Thank you for taking the time to post a review of your recent stay. We are happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us - your guest room, the Rooftop Lounge, and our amenities. We look forward to the opportunity to host you again. Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: My husband and I stayed at the La Casa del Camino for 1 night.  If we had more time we would have stayed longer.  We were on a road trip of the US West Coast.  We really liked our room - the Casa Surf Suite.  It was large, the bed comfortable, view of the ocean from the bed relaxing.  Breakfast in the courtyard felt very European which we quite liked.  We enjoyed a light meal on the upper outside terrace (great Mohito).  All of the staff we had contact with were very friendly and helpful.  The waterfront is only a few steps away and we both enjoyed watching young people surfing.  And the sunset was beautiful.  We would stay at this hotel again in the future and recommend it.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We spent two lovely nights here. The service at the front desk and in the restaurant were outstanding as always. I love coming to this beautiful, romantic spot on the Pacific, and I couldn't wait to share the serenity and ambiance with my boyfriend and best friend.   Everything was perfect from check in to the delicious breakfast on the rooftop deck to the outstanding dinner in the restaurant. The small plates were delicious and interesting, and the rooftop happy hour was a wonderful way to watch the sunset.   The sound of the ocean waves from our bedroom was peaceful and soothing to our travel weary bodies. The room was spotlessly clean. This was my third trip to the hotel, and I can't wait to return.
Manager Response: Dear DCDreamer, Thank you for taking the time to post a review of your recent stay. We want you to know how much we appreciate your loyalty to our charming hotel! We're thrilled you have enjoyed your previous stays, and we look forward to having you back again soon. Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary Heading: Great location and great customer service!
Summary: We recently stayed at La Casa del Camino the 2nd week of October and had a great experience!  The location is the best - just a one minute walk down to the beach.  Beach towels and beach chairs are provided.  Our Women's Billabong Suite was decorated in a surfer them which my kids loved. This suite is the only one in the hotel with a sofa bed which was perfect for my 2 kids.  Hot breakfast is included (oatmeal, eggs, bacon, toast, fresh fruit) and every day we would carry our breakfast up to the rooftop to enjoy the spectacular view. To top it off the hotel staff were so helpful and friendly.  We would definitely stay at La Casa del Camino again!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Cute hotel with great room, rooftop and restaurant
Summary: My husband and I were looking for an overnight getaway while visiting Orange County. I called and made the reservation the night before with Jamie, who was extremely helpful. After reading reviews on the hotel I knew we wanted a room that was quiet - away from most of the PCH noise. We were placed in room 316 which had a queen bed and partial view of the ocean. We didn't notice the PCH noise at all. There was a little noise in the morning with delivery trucks on that side street, but that was it. It was a very cute room. Yes, our room was on the small size, but we both moved around just fine. The bed was super comfy and the bathroom area was very clean. The room had an air conditioner unit in the room, but it wasn't a big deal. It was cool enough out so we just opened the
Manager Response: Dear PadBrooke, We are happy to hear how you enjoyed your recent stay with us. Your comments and compliments to our friendly staff are very much appreciated and have been passed along to them. Thank you for your review... We look forward to your return!  Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary Heading: Cute Boutique Hotel w/ Ocean Views
Summary: My Fiance and I just recently stayed at La Casa del Camino for one night during a California trip this month.  We were traveling with friends of ours - another couple.  We we able to check into the hotel a few hours before check-in.  The hotel is on the main road that runs parallel to the ocean.  There is a ton to do within walking distance.  The lobby is cute - Spanish style.  We stayed in the basic Queen room with a partial Ocean view.  To be honest - it wasn't anything special, but we weren't expecting it to be since we were only traveling through Laguna for one night during our trip.  Our friends booked one of the Surf suites that had a full ocean view.  Their room was bigger and I thought it was nicer, however the ocean view was still slightly obstructed by the residential
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Lovely autumn stay in Laguna Beach
Summary: We stayed 9 nights at Casa Del Camino. Location is great to shopping. The hotel has parking and the guest breakfast bar every AM was filling and delicious. We stayed in one of the Skateboard Design rooms. Very cute! Bed was comfy and the room spacious with great storage. We like to hear the ocean so we kept the windows open - this means noise from the trash trucks in the AM and people partying near the beach access.The hotel is 50 ft from the Cress St Beach access. It is about 30 feet/ 3 flights of stairs down to the beach. Just remember that the beach disappears during high tides, which was in the AM during our Sept 2013 stay. The hotel staff are great in setting up chairs and umbrella so we could watch the surf in the late afternoon. Hotel roof bar is very active and the
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here for two nights at the start of our american road trip and absolutely loved this place. The hotel has a gorgeous Spanish feel and has a cosy lobby with a fire place which was very inviting as you first step in. The staff were lovely and friendly. We had breakfast on the rooftop which was beautiful as we were overlooking the sea and had the terrace to ourselves. Then in the evening the rooftop has a great atmosphere as it's packed and we had a beautiful view of the sunset. The only slight negative is the room we had was tiny, which didn't bother us as we were only there a couple of nights, however if you had a longer trip I think you should maybe ask for a large room. However it was very clean and cosy and we had no real complaint! I would definitely recommend,
Manager Response: Dear kellybroome, Thank you for your review! We are happy to hear you have enjoyed your stay with us, and we appreciate your recommendation. Thanks again! Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary Heading: Great service and location, but room was dark and unappealing.
Summary: Stayed there for three nights.  Service and location are very good.  The sleeping area of our room was large, but very dark and unappealing.  A rug on the floor of the bedroom would do a lot to give the room warmth.  The bathroom was recently upgraded with new tile and fixtures, but very small.  The complimentary morning breakfasts were great.  Would probably not stay there again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. Your compliments are appreciated; we are happy you were able to enjoy our great location, breakfast buffet buffet and our friendly service. We appreciate your feedback and suggestions for our guest rooms, and would like to note that each guest room is different in layout and decor. You may enjoy one of our Casa Surf rooms, as each one is uniquely designed by a different surf brand!  Thanks again, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: I was excited to stay at Casa del Camino because of all the great reviews but was disappointed with the room size, the mammoth A/C unit on the floor in the room, the fact that the bottom part of the window was not attached to the building and the loud event that the hotel was hosting in the lobby below my room.  It was also a little disconcerting that the drapes, which had some kind of a strange residue on them, were draped over the very hot plug for the mammoth A/C at he wall outlet.  The staff is fantastic and very helpful, but I have to wonder if the management is actually on-site/inspecting the rooms or if the idea is more of a "rack 'em and stack 'em" mentality without thought to return customers.  I visit Laguna frequently on business and have stayed at numerous hotels in
Manager Response: Dear KandHfromUS, We are sincerely disheartened to hear how you feel. It is true, some of our guest rooms are petite, as this is a historic boutique hotel built in 1929. As with most hotels in Laguna Beach, ours was not built with central A/C, and we consider the addition of portable A/C units to be a nice addition to the comfort of our rooms, especially on hot days. Your feedback regarding the size and placement of the portable A/C unit is being considered and discussed. Thank you for your compliments to our helpful staff. We hope you will consider staying with us again, perhaps in one of our larger Deluxe King or Casa Surf rooms. Thanks again for your candid comments. Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary Heading: Not for those with baggage and too $$$
Summary: I have stayed at the hotel many times over the years, and I must say this trip was very disappointing. The staff was great, as usual, so hats off to them. My sweetheart and I stayed in a newly redecorated room and I guess I had my hopes up too high. We each had one large suitcase and that pretty much made it so that we literally could not move around the room.  We have stayed in the loft several times before, and I will never stay there again if I cannot get that or the one next to it.  Breakfast on day 1 was quite the challenge for them. When we got there at 9:00am, all the food was gone and we had to wait, along with 15 of our newly made friends, about 20 minutes for more to arrive. Of course, once it did, it was quickly consumed, and the next group ran into the same issue. On
Manager Response: Dear Greg C, We are sorry to hear of your disappointment in your guest room. It's true, our rooms are a bit smaller than a large luxury chain hotel located in the middle of a concrete business district, however, we feel that La Casa del Camino offers a very different, more intimate experience, as we are a historic boutique hotel (36 total guest rooms) located on the beach in a small, eclectic beach town. Our rates are very competitive in the city of Laguna Beach, especially considering our location and amenities.  We do look forward to hosting you and your family again, when you return to stay at our Loft apartment. Your comments and feedback are appreciated. Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: La Casa is always the most hip place to stay in town but the staff at the Rooftop continues to wow and dazzle everyone.  Liliana, Pete, Ian, Phil, Amanda and the entire team are beyond accomodating, they are truly amazing.
Manager Response: Dear Mary D, Thank you so much for your kind compliments to our lovely team members on the Rooftop Lounge! I have forwarded your review to all of them, and they are sincerely appreciative :) We look forward to hosting you at the hotel and on the Rooftop again soon! Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary Heading: Good hotel, not too sure about the look of the room
Summary: We stayed there for 2 nights in August and liked the place, but there were several negative points worth mentioning. Fortunately the pros are so many that they easily counterbalance the cons! Breakfast for example is just amazing: selection of fresh fruit, croissant, egg/sausages and much more. We chose to take a tray and bring it upstairs on the terrace...what a view from there in the morning! We regretted not having booked a table for cocktails at sunset. The location is great too, as it's on the main street and you can walk everywhere. And there are also nice restaurants very close. Bed was super comfty too.  Then the cons: - The room we got was very small and we could not fit our suitcases in it (at one stage we had to chose if to open the door or open the suitcase). - It
Manager Response: Dear Erica M, Thank you for posting a review of your recent stay. We are happy to hear you enjoyed your stay overall. Your feedback and comments are very useful to us as we strive for continuous improvement. We hope to have the opportunity to host you both again soon. Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: I have stayed at this hotel numerous times while visiting CA and I am never disappointed.  The rooms are small but very clean and up to date. Great roof bar and Resturant, the view is the best in Laguna!  The staff are always more than willing to accomodate every need or want and are courteous and friendly. Location is vey covienient to all major locations and great Resturants.
Manager Response: Dear David d, We are so appreciative of your loyalty to our hotel! Thank you for taking the time to post your review. We look forward to welcoming you back soon! Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: This hotel is perhaps one of the seediest in Laguna, although you would not expect it from their website nor the exterior of the building/lobby.  Once you check in, you will wander through dark, musty hallways.  The room we got was the most awful in the building.  We bought this stay as an auction item at an event.  When we complained that the room was so tight, you could not even walk around both sides of the bed and that the window a/c unit sounded like a 747 getting ready to taxi, the curse woman at the counter said "well this was a gift certificate"--I explained to her that yes it was but we paid $300.00 for it and got a $149.00 room...they would not move us and didn't care--we checked out as fast as lighting and went elsewhere.  The bar on the roof was noisy until about
Manager Response: Dear meanton, We are quite surprised to hear our hotel referred to as "seedy"... this is certainly not an opinion we have heard before about our property. Regardless, we would like to let you know that since your stay last year we have repainted our lobby, hallways, staircases and restrooms. We have also remodeled our Rooftop Lounge and continue a rigorous maintenance schedule for all guest rooms and public spaces. I am sorry we could not remedy your complaints during your stay last October, We wish you happy future travels. Sincerely, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: We just spent three nights at this hotel to escape the heat of Rancho Mirage in August, and we couldn't be more pleased with our choice. The room was spacious, and beautifully appointed. The bathroom was "designer" quality with a walk-in shower and very stylish pebble and slate wall and floor finishes. The staff, from the front desk, to the housekeepers, to the restaurant folks, were all very accommodating and professional. The hot breakfast was much more varied and plentiful than we expected, and the setting reminded us of many hotel courtyards we have experienced in Europe. We stayed in the ocean view "Billabong Suite" this time, but plan to try out another of their ten surf suites on our next visit. The only downside to our room was that the Laguna trash collection trucks
Manager Response: none

Summary: Just back from a wonderful weekend stay.  Everyone from the front desk folks, breakfast staff, and rooftop servers were friendly and helpful.  The breakfast was delicious, plentiful, and the setting in the courtyard very charming.  The location was perfect for beach going and shopping.  We would definitely stay there again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: From the beautiful view of the rooftop lounge to the wonderful staff at La Casa del Camino, we felt spoiled and special for our girls' weekend.  Our needs were met with professional and friendly attentiveness.  The complimentary hot breakfast was quite delicious and plentiful, and sitting in the quaint courtyard to eat was very pleasant.  It felt like we'd been transported a world away.
Manager Response: Dear funfollower, Thank you for your kind review of your recent girls get away! We hope you think of us again next time you visit this beautiful city :) Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary Heading: Cozy delight in the middle of Laguna
Summary: Wonderful location and services provided at this adorable and romantic hotel. Great escape for those coming from afar or for those who live close by. My husband and I live in Orange County but we wanted a romantic escape for our 8 year wedding anniversary. We came here and couldn't have asked for a better weekend. Great food at the hotel and when we wanted to get out, because of the perfect location we were able to walk everywhere. I highly recommend this beautiful boutique hotel!
Manager Response: Dear Momimijake, We are thrilled to hear that you enjoyed celebrating your anniversary with us! Thank you for your review and recommendation. We look forward to hearing from you next time you want to get away! Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: La Casa del Camino...where do I start?  I was looking for a nice break from LA and saw the reviews on TripAdvisor.  What a gem.  If you're looking for any other place to stay, stop now.  This is the ultimate beach resort.  I feel like I am family here!  Everyone was so nice and the service is impeccable.  Beach chairs, towels, and water brought to you on a very private beach.  Steps away and you are among amazing shops and boutiques.  Just a quick jaunt to main beach, but why would you venture there with your own beach right here!?  Excellent dining in the area.  The rooftop lounge is amazing.  Take your breakfast upstairs and witness a panoramic view of Laguna Beach.  Oh, and best mojitos at the main bar.  I checked out the other resorts too.  And, have to say, this was the
Manager Response: Dear Ben, Thank you for taking the time to post a review of your recent stay -  We are so happy to hear about how much you enjoyed your time with us. Your compliments are greatly appreciated, and Ivan is thrilled to receive your public kudos :) We look forward to welcoming you back soon! Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary Heading: Charming "get away" steps from the beach!!
Summary: Older, charming, boutique hotel.  Staff very friendly and informative about Laguna Beach area. My husband and I stayed here 2 nights as a romantic getaway.  We loved the relaxed atmosphere.  Found the hotel convenient and steps from the beautiful, almost private beach area.  We loved to walk to area restaurants and shopping.  The hotel is quite old, but rooms (suite) modern, smaller, but clean and relaxed.  We stayed in the special designed surf suite, which was decorated in all white, great use of space.  A note to consider, trucks behind the hotel begin around 7 am, which is noisy, but if you are early riser, no worries and great ocean view! Would need additional rooms for kids, but perfect for us.  We walked a few blocks to the gym which is provided free of charge through
Manager Response: Dear family_2go702, Thank you for posting a review of your recent stay! We are so glad to hear that you appreciated our relaxed atmosphere, clean rooms and friendly team :) We hope to have the opportunity to host you and your husband again soon! Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: Wonderful place, magic, the view to the ocean makes you lose in time and space, highly recommend it to go to enjoy the company wirh friends or that special person. The attention of the staff is friendly, although you have to book to get a place in the lounge otherwise expect is a long process.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great location and even better people watching!
Summary: The staff, the views, the food all good. Very crowded on Saturday and Sunday nights when the bar scene picks up until 10:00 pm and then a hush settles in.  The rooms - some designed by local designers are fantastic but the hallway and lobby are really kind of shabby.  Maybe that is the charm? I would not go here as a single person.    Do go up the beach 3 miles to 9th street and take the trip down the 1000 steps to the 1000 steps beach.  Go early and watch the die hard fanatics who do it over and over.  A great work out.
Manager Response: Dear pick11, Thank you for your review! Your feedback is appreciated, and we're please to let you know we are always in the process of updating and restoring our historic hotel. Since our guest rooms have recently been renovated, our next focus is on our hallways and lobby :) Thanks again for your candid comments, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: We stayed one night at La Casa and attended the 80th anniversary Pageant of the Masters.  Charming hotel on the free shuttle line to the Pageant so very convenient.  A 1920's hotel so do not  expect expansive room, but beautifully appointed with updated bath and comfortable bed.  Walk to the beach where you are provided with towels and Adirondack chair.  Self-parking across the street - lot was a little tight for larger cars and SUVs and unfortunately it appeared that not everyone was displaying the hotel parking tag.  Had lunch on the Rooftop Lounge with a great view and then the light dinner at Ky'a Bistro in the hotel which was perfect for a "before show" bite.  Unfortunately the bar was closed when we returned at 11:00 but enjoyed our own cocktails on the couch in the lobby.
Manager Response: Dear sjpietch, Your review is very much appreciated. We are so happy to hear that you enjoyed your cozy guest room, our restaurants, and the breakfast buffet :) We'll definitely look forward to hosting you again, next time you return to Laguna Beach! Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: I also enjoy staying here.  They remembered by anniversary which is nice.  The remodel on the hotel looks great.  The staff is wonderful and very accommodating.  The room was great, the bed was very comfortable.  The full breakfast is truly a breakfast that everyone will find something they want to eat, eggs, bacon, rolls, muffins, oatmeal, yogurt, fresh fruit.  I am sure I missed something.  The rooftop deck, great views and good food.  Looking forward to heading back next year.
Manager Response: Dear Mary W, We are thrilled to have you as a loyal guest! Thank you for choosing to stay with us each time you visit this beautiful beach town :) Your kind words and recommendations are certainly appreciated. We hope you had a wonderful anniversary, and we look forward to seeing you again next year! Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: The hotel is located right a few steps from the beach, some rooms have ocean views.  We left our room at 7:55 and saw the sunset on the beach at 7:56. The room we stayed in (queen) was extremely small and dimly lit. On the ground floor (rooms in the one hundreds) there were two doors to the outside street that seemed to remain open all night. Walls are thin, you can hear everything. Don't plan on sleeping in as there is some sort of garbage pickup in the morning. Breakfast was good, eggs, pancakes, etc.
Manager Response: Dear NYGD, Thank you for your review. Your feedback is appreciated, and I wanted to let you know that we have already been able to address the lighting situation in the smaller guest rooms. We now have multiple light sources in each room for our guest's comfort and convenience. The first floor entrances are typically closed at dusk, but sometimes the guests of the hotel prop them open for more convenient exit/entrance. We have discussed this internally, and are working more diligently to keep these doors closed and locked during the evening and night times. Thanks again for your candid comments. Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: Wonderful location, right by the beach. Spectacular breakfast, a real feast. Friendly staff, kind and attentive. We would return! It was a bit noisy at night and a few repairs are in order, overall it was tremendous.
Manager Response: none

Summary: What's not to love about this place?  Just had our second stay at La Casa for our 7th wedding anniversary.  The rooftop patio bar/restaurant is gorgeous and has incredible views.  K'ya bistro, located in the hotel, has a generous happy hour with awesome food, drinks & service, and you cannot beat K'ya's prices.  The calamari app was the best I have ever had and the blue cheese stuffed bacon wrapped dates were 5 star.  Sunday nights they have half price bottles of wine, and the live music and atmosphere was top notch.  Hotel guests have 24 hour access to the open air rooftop lounge, and the hotel is steps from a quiet and clean beach - the hotel will even set up chairs and an umbrella for you at no charge.  A hot breakfast was included and served in the adorable courtyard/wine
Manager Response: Dear jtlee06, We are thrilled to hear how much you love our charming hotel! Your loyalty is greatly appreciated :) Norma is definitely a rockstar on our team, and we love that you called her out on her fantastic service! We look forward to hosting you both again soon. Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: Everything and everyone was awesome!  The room was beautiful with old style charm.  The personal touches were unexpected and happily received.  The environment was warm and exhilarating.  The breakfast buffet was scrumptious and the walks around the hotel and beaches were extremely romantic.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Yes the steps from the beach location is great and you'll have an amazing overlooking the beach complimentary breakfast...and the staff is so friendly you'll think you are at a 5 star property. BUT understand this is a very old property and some of the rooms are European small!...Check the room before you commit...AND for good or bad, this place is party central, especially during happy hour...heck, the lobby is a bar!
Manager Response: Dear BBBulldog, Thank you for your candid comments, and for your compliments to our friendly team! It is true, some of our guest rooms are quite cozy, as we are a historic boutique hotel, built in a uniquely Spanish style. Your recommendations are appreciated, and we hope to host you again, should you return to Laguna Beach. Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: My husband and I traveled to Laguna from Colorado to enjoy a 10th Wedding Anniversary get  away. Having read a number of rave reviews on trip advisor we were very excited for our stay at this hotel. We arrived on a Sunday. Fortunately we were dropped off and did not have to deal with parking. Upon checking in the staff was friendly. We even had a bottle of wine waiting for us in our room for our anniversary....very nice. Our room was located on the bottom level and was the last room at the end of the hall (next to the outdoor access to Cress Street). With that our room was extremely dark. We had a window overlooking Cress St, howevere it was covered up with tall bushes. This allowed for privacy but made the Room feel dungeon like. Being on a Budget we did request the cheapest
Manager Response: Dear Karen B, Thank you for posting a review of your stay. Your compliments to our friendly staff have been passed along and are very much appreciated :) We value your candid comments and recommendations. Thank you for choosing to stay with us as you celebrated your 10th Anniversary! Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: Everything at this hotel was amazing. From the first moment we stepped into the lobby the staff at Casa del Camino went above and beyond any expectations of hospitality. The front desk was so very helpful. They fulfilled every request and answered all our questions. They never made it feel like we were inconveniencing them. Saran the bartender was so nice and was happy to serve us even though it was near closing time. Lucian, one of the managers took us up to the rooftop to see the sights after we checked in. The rooms were rustic, quaint, and spotlessly clean. One of our favorites part of the stay was eating the complimentary breakfast in the courtyard. We will definitely be returning soon. Just be sure to make reservations in advance. They fill up fast!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We spent our 44th wedding anniversary at the Casa Del Camino Laguna Beach, Ca What a great and romantic place from check in to check out, e were treated very special. It almost seemed like everyone there was hired to make our stay special as it was for us.  From our reserved table at the corner of the roof top deck over looking the beautiful Pacific ocean and the magnificent sun set, to the fantastic and fun dinning experience at" Kaya" restaurant in the Hotel.Topped off with the Resturant manager toasting us with a very good glass of Champagne. Truly a special place with special people, thank you for making us feel so special on our that day. Can't wait for next year Best Ken And Lynda Fischbeck
Manager Response: Dear Ken & Lynda,  Thank you for choosing to celebrate such a special occasion with us! It was really a pleasure to host you, and we are thrilled you enjoyed your stay. We are looking forward to celebrating with you again next year!  Your review and feedback is very much appreciated... thanks again :)  Warm Regards, The Staff and Management at La Casa del Camino

Summary Heading: Tiny Room So Felt Forced to have a $50 Upgrade
Summary: We stayed only one night for the Pageant of the Masters.  The hotel does not allow you to check in before 3pm - which is OK since they offered free chairs, towels and an umbrella for use at the beach.  They held our luggage and allowed us to park in their parking lot which was a short walk away.  Once we got our room (no.309) it was TINY - so small in fact two pieces of luggage would not fit around the bed.  What a JOKE  after spending OVER $220 and asking for a room that would "impress" my husband...this was NOT it!    So I returned to the front desk and were told that ALL their rooms were "European" size...no they weren't because the rooms on LEVEL 1 were much bigger standard rooms....having seen in a room on that level.  So we were told that there were only SUITES left - so
Manager Response: Dear JRyan520,  Thank you for taking the time to post your experience. I am so sorry to hear that you felt forced to pay for an upgrade, as this was not our intention! In looking back on your reservation, I found you had booked a Deluxe Queen Non-View room, which is the same room size as any of our Deluxe Queen rooms, at about 175 sq ft. Unfortunately, we did not have a Deluxe King Non-View room available during your stay (which is the room you saw on the first floor) or we would have happily offered you the Deluxe King room first (we have only 2 of these rooms, both located on the first floor). Being peak season, and since we are a very small boutique hotel of only 36 guest rooms, we fill up quickly. We simply did not have a larger standard room available on the night you stayed, which is why we offered the upgrade to a Casa Surf Suite.  The Lost Surf Suite (#322) is one of our most requested Surf Suites, with a King bed and a full ocean view.  The cost of this room is typically $100 more than our Deluxe Queen rooms, as it offers so much more space, a beautiful ocean view, and a larger bed. We offered the upgrade to you at only half the cost, and we regret to hear it was not a worthwhile upgrade for you.  While we wish the circumstances could have been different, please be assured the front desk staff was as accommodating as they could have been, considering the hotel was nearly sold out, and there were no larger standard rooms to offer without a cost.  Thank you again for your feedback.  Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: Our recent stay at this hotel was average. Here is my feedback: Pros: location, location !!, decent customer service, easy beach access, free parking - $12 resort fee that covers this charge, decent cleanliness of the rooms, ok breakfast included in the room price. Cons: noisy & dark rooms - not a lot of natural light, very pungent smell in the room and along the hallway, the exit door was open at all times leaving questionable safety, probably to help with odor from the hallway, bad maid service, cramped room, portable AC very noisy, no central AC, poor quality on bedding and linens, etc.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. Your compliments to our staff, location, parking, cleanliness and breakfast are very much appreciated.   I would like to note that we are currently addressing the room lighting issue you noted, and are presently installing new lighting solutions in the guest rooms that lack good natural light. I would also like to note that we have recently ordered the same bed linens as used in the Four Seasons hotels!  We take great pride in our heritage as a historic hotel in Laguna Beach, but unfortunately, as with all other historic buildings in the city, our hotel was not built with air conditioning. So far, the portable air conditioner is the best solution we have come to in providing temperature controlled guest rooms.    We thank you again for your comments and feedback, and we'd love to invite you back to enjoy our new amenities, or perhaps one of our larger Surf Suites!  Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary Heading: Great place, Great food , Great views
Summary: We went the other night to meet friends who live in Laguna Beach . this place was wonderful, the views from the Roof top deck were some of the best I have seen and the appetizer's were amazing. went down stairs for dinner and the staff and food was also   amazing. can not wait to return here the next time we visit So Cal.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Casa del Camina is a rustic hotel with different decor in each room, strangely each "designed" (ie sponsored) but different surf brands. I would have preferred not to have been bombarded with tacky advertising in the room. The one we had was morrocan style, which was cute. We asked for the sea view, but the morning was very noisy with the garbage disposal clanking bottles around at 7:30am (not worth the upgrade). The service was good, nice strong hot showers. Unfortunately no light switches by the bed. The lobby / bar / restaurant are in the same vicinity so it was rather noisy and too buzzy for us as we preferred to be quiet, and people moved up and down the stairs to get to the rooftop bar, so it wasn't very private.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We checked in to find a very lively bar area just before the check-in desk.  We were giving our key and as we began to walk to the room the nightmare began.  The hallways were dark and it was just an overall creepy atmosphere.  Once in the room I was shocked to see it how insanely small it was.  The carpet was dingy and the wall color was terrible.  It was very dark even with all the lights on.  We sat on the bed and discovered it was soft, EXTREMELY SOFT...like as soft as a pillow!  We immediately went back to the check-in desk and asked if there was another room available.  We were taken to a different room which was even worse than the first and also had the super soft bed.  We were told they have just purchased these new beds and they were all the same...VERY BAD PURCHASE on
Manager Response: Dear Nancy1CO,  We are astounded to read your opinion regarding your recent stay with us (May, 2013). We have never received such a scathing review and we regret that you had such a bad experience with us.  Although we acknowledge and respect your opinion on the condition of our hotel, we can assure all of our guests that our carpets, towels, showers and beds are very clean; We typically get our highest remarks on the cleanliness of our guest rooms and hotel.   Our General Manager will be contacting you shortly to personally address your concerns.  We understand that we may not be the right fit for everyone, and we are genuinely sorry that you have come away with such an opinion.  Wishing you happier travels, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: My boyfriend recently stayed 3 nights here as a little summer getaway. We were more than happy with the awesome customer service! The beach service was wonderful! Room was so comfortable, amazing views! We have decided to make this an annual trip! Thanks La Casa Del Camino!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! We are thrilled to hear that you will be making La Casa del Camino an annual trip :)  We look forward to hosting you again next year!

Summary: This was a cozy European-style Hotel in a great location. The rooms are small but comfortable and clean.  The staff was wonderful!  Charlotte greeted us upon arrival and was friendly and ready to answer all of our questions. The restaurant, K'ya, was very good and the prices were lower than similar places nearby, and the buffet breakfast was very tasty.  The steps down to the beach were close by, and the hotel provides towels, chairs and umbrellas for guests to use.  It was a little noisy in the evenings due to the lively roof deck and a private party that was being held, so if you are looking for peace and quite this might not be the place for you.  We enjoyed the atmosphere and the location so much that we will definitely stay here again the next time we are in that area.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind comments! We are happy to know you enjoyed your stay at our hotel. Your compliments have been passed along to our staff and restaurant, and we look forward to the opportunity to host you again!

Summary: Fun, party like atmosphere. Great energy. Staff was very friendly and accommodating. The rooms are a little small. Hotel has a great roof deck for happy hour and a great restaurant for dinner. Walking distance to all shops and downtown restaurants. Beach is just steps from hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had driven by La Casa del Camino a few times, but never gave it a second glance ... until we were looking for a place to celebrate our first anniversary. Everything about La Casa del Camino = a fantastic weekend !!! The service was impeccable and the location exceeded our expectations. Their restaurant, K'ya, was beyond delicious ... I had the tilapia and hubby had the Chef's Special of crab encrusted sea bass.  We can't wait to return next year for our next anniversary !!!
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to post a review of your recent experience. Your compliments are very much appreciated and we are thrilled to know you will be returning for your anniversary again next year! Thanks again for your review :)

Summary Heading: Best little boutique hotel on the Laguna strip.
Summary: We picked this hotel for its location on the strip and for the value, but we really enjoyed the rooftop restaurant with views of the ocean and a great menu.  The place draws quite a crowd in the evenings so if you want to hang out and party you don't even need to leave.  They will take chairs and towels down to the beach for you and the beach access is just steps away.  The room comes with a parking pass so you wont have to find parking on the very popular Laguna strip - so you dont have to look for parking.  They have regular rooms and a couple of cottages so you can stay here with your family.  Some of the regular rooms have views but they are pretty small.  if you want more space I would recommend the cottage.  I think it is a great value and location and we will be back next
Manager Response: none

Summary: We just got back from Laguna and stayed at La Casa del Camino. Booked it as a last minute get away when we found out the "nicer" hotel up the block was $700/nite. Only 36 or so rooms and most are not very large, but thats not why youre there. Small boutique hotel seems like it dropped out of Tuscany onto the Laguna Beach. Great bar as soon as you walk in. Next to that is a fantastic restaurant K'Ya that is often packed. On weekend nights, this makes for a somewhat noisy hallway of youre on the 2nd floor, but just join in and have fun. The rooftop bar has spectacular view of the ocean and beach. Happy hour 3-5 seems to be the most busy, but a great scene. Great breakfast included in the mornings. Service is great, everyone is very friendly and helpful. Walk down the steps to the
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! Your comments and detailed observations are appreciated :) We are happy to know you enjoyed your stay and we look forward to hosting you again soon! Warm Regards, Charlotte

Summary: This is an amazing Boutique Hotel with great customer service and many extras. There is a $12 resort which includes parking, breakfast, wifi and use of a local gym.   There is a 5 minute walk to downtown, and many shopping spots. We have stayed here many times and we will be back!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We recently had our wedding here and I have nothing but good things to say about the place itself and the staff.  We had been to the roof deck and K'Ya a number of times, but had never stayed there until the event itself.  Location of the hotel is great.  Easy walk down into town, plus plenty of shopping/eating options right outside the front door.  Beach access is also right out the back door.  Rooms are a little on the small side, but this is an older hotel.  If you're expecting something shiny and modern like the W, this is the not the place for you.  If you're looking for something with some charm and some uniqueness, you're in the right place.  We actually blocked off the entire hotel (36 rooms) for our quests, which was great to have everyone is one location.  Roofdeck is
Manager Response: Dear Greg K,  It was truly a pleasure to host you and your beautiful bride, along with your entire wedding group! Thank you for choosing La Casa del Camino for your special weekend. Your comments and compliments are very much appreciated, and we have passed your kind words along to all departments who contributed to your wedding party.  We hope to have the opportunity to host you again .. perhaps for your anniversary! ;)  Sincerely, La Casa del Camino staff and management

Summary Heading: Better customer service then a five star!
Summary: A last minute amazing deal brought us here!  The extras are a nice touch and although there is a $12 resort fee it comes with more than a five star; gourmet breakfast, free gym use, free wifi, free parking, beach chairs!  We were so impressed by the customer service and one on one attention.  One note ask for a tray and take breakfast to the rooftop, it has stunning views and don't miss it's happy hour!  We have stayed at many 5 stars and this place beat them out!  We will be back! It is a little walk to downtown but walk the beach it's faster and romantic!
Manager Response: none

Summary: La Casa del Camino is in a great spot, right on Laguna Beach. Well, not right on - there are Houses between the Hotel and the beach - but, you're a 2 min walk from the beach, so it's very very close. Situated on the main drag through Laguna Beach (which makes it sound busier and noisier than it is) it's perfect for the beach as said, but also all the local Restaurants Bars & Shops. The Hotel's common parts are attractive, and the Bar/Restaurant seemed to attract locals - which is always a good sign. Parking is just across the road in a Car Park which the Hotel gives you a voucher for. The Staff were friendly and helpful. Only downside was the Room. It was VERY dark, very pokey, had a TV from the jurassic period that had an abominibal picture. The Shower was spacious and very
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post a review of your stay last year. Your compliments to our friendly staff and convenient location are very much appreciated!   We are a little disheartened to hear that you didn't enjoy our newly renovated guest room style.. we were going for an old-world Spanish/Moroccan interior, and we typically get good feedback on our renovation. I'm unsure what television you had in your room, as we had new flat screen HDTV's installed in all guest rooms in March of 2012.  La Casa del Camino is a historic hotel, built in 1929. We have not changed the hotel's original floor plan too dramatically, and the guest rooms are typical of a historic hotel from that era. We take great pride in our unique and nostalgic architecture, and have striven to keep this hotel's great history alive.   We appreciate your feedback, and have noted your suggestions. Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: La Casa is  a unique  property.  The hotel staff was warm, inviting and very friendly. The food was amazing; the Mediterranean dips, the caprese appetizer and the Mediterranean flatbread,huevos ranchero... All great.  The rooftop bar, for sunset and breakfast  is as advertised and bartender Case was awesome. The lobby bar was hip and happening.  Jaime took care of us down on the nerar private little beach just steps from the hotel.  Overall, near perfect.   The only blemishes: I booked an oceanfront room but was non was available; Norma adjusted the rate and sent a bottle of wine to the room.  The second blemish is the spa tub didn't work in our room.   Other than that, we'll be back next year.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post your review! We are so happy you enjoyed your stay, and your compliments have been passed along to the staff. I regret to hear that we were not able to assign the surf suite you had requested. Please know the jets in the tub have since been repaired, and function normally. Thank  you for your feedback. We hope to have the opportunity to host you again! Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel for one night. We wished we stayed another night because of how lovely our stay was! The room served its' purpose which was to sleep! The service overall was great! They definitely know what they are doing. All staff were friendly and helpful. We also had dinner at the restaurant on the first floor. Wow! Was that delicious! The staff there were truly wonderful! Reservations are recommended there! We will be coming back and hopefully for more than one night!
Manager Response: none

Summary: The property is located in a great spot in Laguna very close to the ocean. The attention to detail from a service perspective was refreshing.  I was up early one morning and needed a cup of coffee.  The front service manager found one for me before the restaurant opened which was nice.  Also, I left a few things behind after my stay and received a call from the guest services manager asking where to send them. I appreciate the extra effort made by the staff.  Overall, I had a very pleasant experience.
Manager Response: Thank you for posting a review of your recent stay! I'm thrilled to hear you appreciated the service from our staff, and we look forward to the opportunity to host you again. Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: This is a great property.  Thoroughly enjoyed it.  The have access to a nice gym just down the street.  The rooftop is excellent for lunch or drinks.  The rooms are small but work just fine.  Fantastic free breakfast downstairs.  Great location for walking anywhere you'd like in laguna beach and you can hear the ocean waves from your room.  fantastic.. very nice staff.. great price!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Recently Updated Boutique Hotel in Great Location
Summary: First of all, it would be difficult to beat the location of this hotel. It is on the ocean-side of Pacific Coast Highway and within walking distance of downtown Laguna. It also has a wonderful roof-top bar that is available for use by guests of the hotel at pretty much any hour. The rooms in the hotel have recently been updated, which is an added bonus. The rooms are small but nice. The restaurant located in the hotel has great food as well.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Twice started to write a review, but got carried away.  Short story is that we decided to go up to Laguna Beach for our 31st Anniversary ... only an hour North of our home in Olivenhain/San Diego.  Hadn't been up here overnight for 15 years.  Actually drove up one afternoon to see what was new, and picked this place out visually.  Location great.  Close to town.  A total hotspot for the locals.  Prices reasonable.  Rooms are a bit eclectic, but comfortable and kind of retro-cool (Ie:  window A/C when needed).  Rooftop bar is fantastic.  Downstairs restaurant is popular and there's another popular bar down in the lobby.  Great place to go to the roof around 4, and only have to get back to your room 1 floor away!!  Anyway, fun for us.  From my view, unless you want to spend the
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post your review! We are glad to hear you had a great time during your stay with us.. Your tips and comments are greatly appreciated, and we hope to host you again soon. Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: First off the staff was great. A very attractive women took care of us(Charlotte) and was very helpful at the front desk. We got the King deluxe room I think it's called and it was very charming. The room is small compared to other hotel standards but very enjoyable and the bathroom had a nice updated modern design. The roof top lounge was awesome with a great view. They have a free breakfast buffet that you can take to the roof top patio and eat while enjoying the view. Due to it's location to the shops/stores/restaurants and literally steps from the ocean this a nice Laguna hotel to stay at.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Boutique Property, Great Food and Great Atmosphere
Summary: La Casa is a gem in Southern Cal.  Less than 40 rooms, everything is just a minute away from your room.  The Rooftop Lounge is awesome and the food at K'ya is amazing.  The Rooftop bartenders are a blast.  The hotel staff always has my room ready.  I always stay in a Surf Suite which is roomy and comfortable.  Young, hip, and fun property.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I looked at a three hotels while I was planning this trip.  It was a surprise trip for my friend - I had some questions and clues for him, he had no idea, where or what I had planned. Historic or modern, inland or something near the beach,  were just some clues for him to go with.  Did a little pre-weekend trip to Laguna to check them all out.  La Casa won hands down because of many reasons, hotel reception, location and overall ambiance.  They showed me my actual room, which was perfect cause we weren't planning on spending a bunch of time in it. Rooftop bar was great to spend early evenings before hitting the town for the evening. Breakfast was included in the great room price, hotel staff during the stay were very hospitable and so helpful.  Veronica who worked in the
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! We are so happy to know that your weekend get away went off without a hitch :) It was our pleasure to show you around our hotel and guest rooms, and we thank you for choosing to stay with us.  Thanks again for your recommendation!  Charlotte Guest Services

Summary Heading: Perfect Location with Friendly staff & Incredible Rooftop Bar
Summary: We booked this spot last minute for a trip we had to Laguna area.  Based on the reviews of the hotel and restaurant we decided to stay here.  The rooms have been upgraded and although not huge they were big enough for what we needed.  Bathroom was also very nicely upgraded.  Rooftop bar / restaurant has incredible panoramic views with very tasty foods.    Parking was included as well as access to a gym right around the corner from the hotel.  In the morning we were able to go for a nice walk down the beach only a few steps away from the hotel.  There are plenty of great restaurants and shopping all within walking distance from the hotel.  The staff was very nice and friendly.  This is not the Ritz Carlton but we would def return to the La Casa del Camino
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel has terrible customer service. The receptionist seemed bored out of her mind and was very unpleasant. The accommodations do not match the images on the website. Asked for early check in and despite being assured I would be contacted regardless the outcome I was not. The room was not ready when I was finally given the key. The bed was VERY uncomfortable. The walls are very thin. Worst hotel stay I have ever had. Hotel looks very lovely on the outside and has a great location. There was potential for this to be an awesome experience. Spend your money elsewhere.
Manager Response: Dear Pelon19, I am so sorry to read this review of your recent stay. I am the person who checked you in, and I apologize if it may have seemed as if I were bored... I was in fact very busy on the afternoon of your check-in. Still, no excuse for not being more enthusiastic, and you have my sincere apology. I recognize you had requested an early check-in of 10am, which was not guaranteed. Check-out time for the guests staying the previous night is 11:30am, and we had a full house the night before your arrival. After check-out time, the room must be cleaned and prepared for the next guest's arrival, which can sometimes take a few hours for the housekeepers to get around to all the rooms. Our guaranteed check-in time is 3:00pm, and a request for earlier check-in is based on the availability of a clean room. Looking back on your reservation, you were granted an early check-in at 1:53pm, after I had verified that the room was clean and ready. It is unfortunate that an earlier check-in was not available, and I am very sorry that this has caused so much dissatisfaction for you. Thank you for your feedback, and I sincerely wish you happy future travels. Warm Regards, Charlotte Gulley Guest Service Manager La Casa del Camino

Summary Heading: Great Location, K'ya and Rooftop Lounge all in One Place
Summary: We (my daughter and I) spent three days here for her Spring break.  The elevator was not available when we arrived, so had to carry bags up stairs which was a bit unnerving and the room was very small but did have a surprise balcony and partial ocean view.  That said everything else was  great.  The staff was accommodating and very nice and the beds and pillows were very comfortable.  The rooftop lounge was the bonus find.  180 degree plus ocean view and yummy cocktails (mojitos!!!) and very good service.  K'ya was the in-house restaurant and  I can't recommend it enough.  The food was small plates style but everything we ordered was surprisingly very good. (Our waitress made excellent recommendations.) The best part was that the prices are very fair as well.   If you aren't
Manager Response: Thank you for posting a review of your recent stay! My apologies that our elevator was out of commission at the time of your arrival... we typically try to assist every guest with their luggage, and I'm so sorry if we failed to ask you if you would like assistance. We are happy to hear you enjoyed your room; although cozy, 301 is our only room with a balcony! We're also glad you were able to enjoy the Rooftop Lounge and K'ya Bistro... your compliments have been passed along to the restaurants. We appreciate your feedback and comments, and hope to host you again, should you return to Laguna Beach! Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: A sweet experience with lots of charm.  Cozy lobby with a fireplace and bar.  Very small rooms decorated in a Morrocan-Spanish style.  Super cool tiled shower.  Rooftop deck for watching the sunset (blankets are provided when chilly).  Staff is very attentive.  No hair dryer?  Give a call and one appears within minutes.  Free parking in a lot across the street.  The restaurant within, k'ya Bistro, is outstanding!  You need to try it.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Don't stay here for the room experience...it's about the bars/restaurant..
Summary: ......unless you upgrade to one of their beach themed rooms.  Also overall the room features were nice, the small size doesn't bode well to spending much day time in your room.  Also - stay far away from the stairs, as the lobby bar noise can be loud.  A great locale for a old-time California hotel experiencs.......3/4 mile walk to downtown past some nice shops......outstanding roof bar......lobby bar can get exciting.  Great staff........provided towels/chairs/umbrella for the beach - a short 50yd walk - felt very private.  Not the best place for the kids - smaller rooms and no pool.
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to post a review of your recent stay. It is true, our Deluxe Queen rooms can be quite cozy, however they do have some very nice features and have recently been fully renovated - new bathrooms, furniture, carpet, drapes - the works!  For future reference, I would suggest a Deluxe King room, if you're looking for something a little larger, in the same Spanish decor.. you must contact us directly for a Deluxe King, as we only have 4 on our property! Thank you for recommending our Casa Surf Suites as well - they tend to be quite popular for their more generous size, and unique surf inspired decor. Thanks again for your compliments and candid comments. We hope to host you again, should you return to Laguna Beach! Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary Heading: Good Value for this middle-aged couple
Summary: We were in Laguna beach for a four-day weekend getaway to see our daughter & son-in-law, and this Spanish-villa themed boutique hotel was, for the most part, a great find and a very nice part of our getaway. First of all, I can't say enough good things about the service here. Everyone we met and dealt with from the people at the front desk, to the maids in the hallway, to the wonderful young woman at the breakfast nook was as pleasant and accommodating as we had ever found, anywhere. Honestly. The relatively small size of our tiny little room (308) made us and our two suitcases along with the rooms portable air conditioner on the floor a little too cramped for our liking, and didn't leave us any room to do something as simple as just sit and read for awhile (we resorted to lying
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your descriptive and candid review! Your comments and compliments have been passed on to the appropriate departments, and we are all thrilled to know you enjoyed your stay :) We look forward to hosting you all again! Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: The location is perfect. The view from our room was great. The rooftop lounge was really cool and the food was delicious. The staff was very friendly. They took awhile to respond to a request but they were still friendly. The rooms are very small but we didn't mind. They were the perfect size for us. And what you would expect for a small hotel in Laguna. The room was very cozy and we loved the decor. Overall, we were very happy with or stay and would definitely stay again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Don't get a room near lobby.
Summary: Beautiful hotel in a great location but our partial view room overlooked the dumpsters and the lounge singer sounded like he was in our room.  Breakfast buffet was great. Rooftop nice but took forever to have someone wait on us.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post a review of your recent stay. We are happy to hear your compliments regarding our beautiful hotel and breakfast buffet :) Our hotel is quite small, with only 36 total guest rooms, and I apologize that you may not have had the best of the partial ocean view rooms. I would recommend the Casa Surf Suite's with a full ocean view, or a Deluxe room with a courtyard view, should you return in the future. Please book with us directly for the best room choice. For future note, the live music played in the lobby on weekends is typically over by 10pm. I apologize if it seemed too loud during your stay. We appreciate your feedback and wish you happy travels!
