Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services La Casa del Camino

Summary Heading: Stop shopping around and stay here
Summary: It's a little bit pricier but still reasonable. Consider the location, literally steps away from a flight of stairs down to the sand of the beach.   The parking situation isn't too bad. Pull up to the "unloading parking" on the side of the hotel and call the front desk to send out an attendant to take the luggage. They give you a parking pass to hang on your rear view mirror and you park in their designated parking lot across the street.  We checked in Friday night at around 10pm, The lobby was pretty live, Middle-aged crowd (beach locals) was flowing out of the Bistro off to the right, bar off to the left was pretty calm but group of guys were watching the game on the flat screen and some random guy was playing the piano to a pair of ladies.  We checked in and walked up to one
Manager Response: Thank you for your great review! We are happy to hear you enjoyed your stay, and we look forward to hosting you again, and hopefully you will make it up to our ever-popular Rooftop Lounge. Your recommendation is greatly appreciated! Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services La Casa del Camino

Summary: I was very impressed with the location walking distance from the beach as you exit the hotel. The staff takes chairs and a umbrella for you down the steps to the beautiful beach down below. You get the beach towel from the front desk. So convenient. We as a family of four ( kids 6 and 9 yrs.) booked a King size non view special discount hotel website. My lucky day. All the surf suites were taken that were King size bed with sofa bed. The staff was so accommodating to want to get us a roll a way bed if needed and gave us a room that fit our needs that was roomy. I was concern past reviews that the rooms would be small. The room was fine fit our needs was roomy  with a closet and a armoire to hang clothes. The breakfast was great! Oatmel, Hot cakes, french toast,Fruit, scrambled
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Nice Little Hotel in Pricey Laguna Beach
Summary: I stayed here for a weekend to attend my buddy's wedding.  It was one of the hotels listed as "nice places to stay" courtesy of the bride and groom.  And it was.  It wasn't the most money and it wasn't the cheapest so I didn't really have a problem with the price.  The rooms were quaint (small) but we were hardly in the room.  The attraction of this hotel is the rooftop bar and the wonderfully enthusiastically attractive clientele.  We had fun haning out up there both before and after the wedding (Our server Noelle was great).  If you're looking for a good hangover cure, order the breakfast burrito.  It's great!  There's also a Jack in the Box 2 minutes from the hotel and I found myself there late Friday and Saturday night.    The one caveat I have is that there's NO parking
Manager Response: Thank you for posting your review! We are happy you enjoyed your stay at our little hotel. So sorry to hear about the parking ticket :(  We've tried to get the time limit in the loading zone increased to even 10 minutes, but unfortunately, the city won't agree with us. We hope you can find another reason to visit Laguna Beach, and that we may have the opportunity to host you again! Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services La Casa del Camino

Summary: Great place, beautiful views but the staff really made this a five star stay. Friendly and helpful at every point. Everyone seemed very happy to work there and made us feel at home and comfortable.   The roof top deck is the most amazing place to see sunset from and we saw many dolphins, seals and even a wale one afternoon.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Loved this place! We didn't dine at the onsite restaurant the first night because we assumed it would be too expensive, turns out the prices are reasonable for an excellent meal and experience.  The staff is friendly and the lobby is a great place to socialize and have a glass of wine with friends.  The rooms are a bit small and some nights the bar above creates some noise if you wanted to get to bed early but the social scene is fun and energetic and you should at leat go check out the view from the top/outside bar area. Highly recommend!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! We're thrilled to know you enjoyed your recent stay, and appreciate your compliments regarding our friendly staff and energetic ambiance. We hope to host you again! Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: The hotel is located at a good spot. The interior and restaurant is cozy.  The booked no-smoking room itself was very small and felt like a strong used smoking room caused by the chosen color of the walls and curtain. The bed guaranteed a good sleep. For the room size the room was a bit pricy. Overall still satisfied.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Spectacular View, slightly noisy for the 30+ crowd
Summary: This hotel is a beautiful property with a spectacular rooftop bar and a view that is a must see.  Outdoor heaters and blankets are plentiful on chilly evenings, as rare as they are in Laguna Beach.  The downstairs bar has a lot of character and is well stocked.  Very cool crowd.  The room we received when we were "taken care of" was the smallest room I've seen stateside, most especially at that price point.  The sound of the downstairs bar carried through the halls and the scrape of the chairs from the rooftop bar on our ceiling was incessant.  It took a while for it to quiet down in order to get some sleep.   To recap, super cool place, hip crowd, just noisy if you're trying to get to sleep before midnight.
Manager Response: Thank you for posting a review of your recent stay! We are thrilled to know you enjoyed our hotel, the Rooftop Lounge and the energetic crowd we tend to attract. Most of our guest rooms are indeed on the "cozy" side, but are well designed and comfortable. Next time, you may consider one of our larger Casa Surf Suites.  Thank you again for your candid comments.  Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary Heading: Super place to stay in Laaguna Beach, Calif.
Summary: I wanted to share my recent experiences at La Casa del Camino in Laguna.  My children are building a home there and I wanted to find a nice and convenient hotel to stay at while they were remodeling.  I stayed there alone and felt very safe.  It is right at the beach and walking distance to many great restaurants. However it actually has two of my favorite spots in Laguna, its rooftop bar and its main restaurant. The room was super with a newly remodeled bathroom.  The price was super.  What really was great is that the price included a full breakfast for two people and use of a local health club, which is amazing.  I know because I once bought a day pass at a local health club. Not cheap!! That this was included made the great price even better.    But so many other features
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind review of your recent stay! We look forward to hosting you the next time you visit your children :)  Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: My sister and I have met here at Casa del Camino twice a year for the past 3 years - during late winter to celebrate our birthdays, and during the summer to attend POM and Sawdust Festival.  Laguna Beach is a perfect place for us because my sister lives in LA and I live in SD, so it's a half way point.  We have tried many different hotels in the past 12 years or so we have been meeting in this beachside paradise.  Casa del Camino is our favorite.  The standard rooms are very small but the designer suites are the coolest, and defintely the way to go.  We have stayed in both the Women's Billabong and last weekend we tried the Riviera.  Both are great.  This year when we arrived there was a complimentary bottle of wine and a birthday greeting waiting for us.  There is a super
Manager Response: Thank you for your returning business! We appreciate you taking the time to write a review of your many different stays, and are thrilled to hear that La Casa del Camino is your favorite in Laguna Beach. We look forward to hosting you and your sister again this summer! Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: This property has great old-fashioned character, built in the Mission revival style popular in 1920's SoCal.  It is literally just down the block from a staircase onto the beach, and has phenomenal views from its rooftop restaurant--that is, if you can tolerate feeling as crammed with other people like a Tokyo subway train.  The weekend vibe at La Casa del Camino is loud and festive, both upstairs and downstairs (where live music was jamming through to the late hours)--so, not a hotel to recommend for a relaxed and quiet stay, but for drinking and singing along... Our room was slightly claustrophobic (not a seaside view) and very dark, even turning on all the lights available--one shouldn't need flashlights to look through a suitcase at a hotel, but that is clearly the stylistic
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We appreciate your description of our Mission style property, and the festive, energetic atmosphere we tend to have on weekends. I apologize that some of our guest rooms can feel more dim than others; we are working on lighting solutions for these rooms. Your feedback is appreciated, and we hope you choose to stay with us again.  Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary Heading: I would most defiantly come back in a heartbeat!
Summary: This is one of the best hotels I've stayed at. Very different. Unlike your other big hotels. The staff is very nice and helpful. Our room was amazing with a great view. Everyone who worked here made us feel at home. Our dinner at K'ya was fantastic! Loved the music that they played in the lobby area. Loved the location! The complimentary breakfast was fantastic! Veronica, made us feel at home and went out of her way to help us bring the food to the rooftop one morning and helped us out with anything else that we needed and brought us extra hot coffee and muffins all the way to the rooftop. Very charming young lady and is defiantly a great asset to your hotel! She defiantly made our morning that much better! The front desk Juliana, helped us with anything that we needed super
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: A touch of romance with ocean views.
Summary: Excellent service,fun atmosphere,Gorgeous view.Also server's did a tremendous job on making us feel at home :) room 318 was fun,energetic,enlighting.It felt like we were in college again.Breakfast was fresh and delicious with a good variety to choose from.We will definitely go back.Very please.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great experience staying at La Casa Del Camino
Summary: Great atmosphere and location. The Rooftop lounge was awesome to watch the sunset every day. The restaurant k'ya downstairs had great food and service, the waiter was spot on recommending great dishes. Overall the staff was extremely helpful and I enjoyed my stay in one of their specialty surf rooms. Hotel is just steps away from the beach.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: The Rooftop Lounge has a great vibe...
Summary: Right off the bat, I have to say that we did not stay at the hotel, we just enjoyed a cocktail and watched the sun set over Catalina Island from The Rooftop Lounge.  It was such a great place to set the tone for a great evening, that I had to post a review.  After dinner at a nearby restaurant, our server suggested the Rooftop Lounge for a sunset drink.  We climbed the stairs at this older hotel and made our way to the lounge.  Immediately, we could sense this place had a great feel.  There were people of all ages and walks of life enjoying a cocktail in preparation for the sunset.  The view was outstanding!  We had a lovely hour watching the sun set over Catalina Island...just beautiful!  When the sun had finally rested, the people began to slowly leave.  It was a nice slice of
Manager Response: none

Summary: I cannot understand the positive reviews, the pictures of this hotel are far away from the reality, I had a room where I could barely open my luggage (I had to open it on the floor) and walk around it as no other space was left, the sink was in the bedroom, the bathroom was the smallest ever seen, breakfast was horrible, served in a small sad room underground offering a very low quality food and beverage selection.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This place is difficult to put into words.  It's old, which could be charming, but wasn't.  The walls are so thin you can hear EVERYTHING happening in other rooms/hallway, etc, as if the people were right next to you.  Our room, a king non-view room, was recommended by the reservations clerk because it was larger and some people think their queen rooms are too small.  It was big enough, especially since there was not much furniture in the room, but by "non-view" they mean "you can't see out the windows at all because they're completely obscured by shrubs".  The lack of natural light and dim lighting in the room made everything dark and somehow depressing.  The windows themselves were old and a real struggle to get closed and locked, and the hallway door to the street didn't
Manager Response: I'm sorry to hear of your dissatisfaction in the Deluxe King guest room which was recommended to you. These are indeed our largest guest rooms, and the majority of our frequent guests enjoy this room type very much, which is why it was recommended to you. There was obviously a disconnect on our part; I apologize that we misjudged what was important to you regarding what you needed most during your stay. You are quite accurate in your description of the view from this room; when we labeled this room type as a "non-view" room, we truly mean there is not a view from the windows in this room. I had our engineering supervisor check the street access door on the first floor, and we found that it does indeed close and lock as it is programmed to do. We do keep it propped open during the day for easy beach access for our guests, and at dusk we close and lock the door. We have occasionally found that a guest will prop it open, but we do our best to keep it closed during the night hours. Thank you for bringing this to our attention.  Your candid comments are appreciated, and we wish you happy travels! Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Service Manager

Summary: What a wonderful experience at this fantastic hotel!  From the moment I arrived I felt like I was in Europe.  Everything about our stay was excellent, and I cannot recommend this property enough.  Our partial-view room was stunning, with an absolutely gorgeous view of the ocean, the PCH, and the courtyard cafe.  The room was beautiful--quiet, peaceful and sexy. The breakfast was excellent, and dining on the roof with endless ocean views is the best way to go.  The Rooftop Lounge is happening, and it was a great place to spend a Saturday evening.  I would go back to this hotel in a heartbeat!  Yes please!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! We are thrilled to know you loved your stay in our charming property, and we look forward to welcoming you back soon!

Summary: We was traveling to CA on our happy Christmas hollidays as a familly with 2 kids and from Jan. 1 we decided to stay at La Casa del Camino's La Casita... . turned up like a ... difficult to even describe! You can judge yourself... the appartament was cold, old very well used soffas( even dirty) TV on the dining room's wal was kind of first flat screans TV ever produced and works only for 20 min then you have to svich off for 10 min to cool down and then you can use onother 20 min. the shower on the bathroom out of order, dirty corners and paper thin walls ... we was not able to put our kids to sleap because they was just sceard from the multiply noises outside... so the breaking point of all this was after i ask at   front desk if they have a swiming pool? The  lady was kind and
Manager Response: Dear Norway_13, I am so sorry to hear of your dissatisfaction with your stay in La Casita. In researching your stay, our records show we only charged you for the one night that you stayed. The only reason we were given for your early check-out was that your children wanted a swimming pool, and we unfortunately do not have a pool on our property. We sincerely apologize for the negative impression you were left with as you checked out after your first night.   We are reviewing your list of feedback with our housekeeping manager and maintenance engineer, and will have a resolution for these items within the week.  Thanks again for your feedback. I hope you enjoyed the rest of your stay in Laguna Beach. Sincerely, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: We just returned from a 1 night stay at La Casa del Camino for my birthday getaway. This hotel has character which was very much appreciated. The location is fabulous, right in the middle of town and next to the water. Parking is easy in a lot across the street. We had a non view room and although it was small, it was very comfortable. The decor was beautiful with carved wood furniture and romantic touches. We dined at the K'ya Bistro in the hotel which as usual was a great experience. The rooftop is an amazing bonus and in the morning we took our yummy complimentary hot breakfast there to enjoy the sweeping ocean views. The hotel staff was friendly and accommodating; We enjoyed our interactions with the front desk and Veronica, who was working in the breakfast room, went out of
Manager Response: none

Summary: I've been traveling to CA on business once a month for the last year.  About six months ago, I found La Casa del Camino on Priceline and read the reviews.  What surprised me was the number of review that focused on the Staff.  To my fortune, the reviews were spot-on.  I've had the honor and privilege to get to know the staff.  They make me feel like family and consistently go out of there way to make me feel at home.  Top shelf.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your kind words and loyalty to La Casa del Camino! We look forward to your next visit, and hope you have a very happy holiday season :) Warm Regards, The management and staff at La Casa del Camino

Summary: My husband and I had a series of travel mishaps. The entire staff helped us out at one point during our stay. Thank you Norma at the Front Desk ÔÅä your help was much appreciated. Also thank you to the house man and housekeeping. The rooms were clean and pleasant. The restaurant is my favorite‚Ä¶ Authentic Spanish food with a great wine selection. Five Stars *****
Manager Response: none

Summary: what a delightful find. The rooftop bar is a great place to watch the sunset and the happy hour prices are great.  The breakfasts enjoyed the patio garden were delicious.  We were there for four nights and there was a variation in the selections. We were concerned about the room size from the reviews,but our suite was large with a jacuzzi bath which unfortunately didn't  work. Our only complaint was the decor. We had expected a tastefully med design. Instead thought we were back in the sixties with surfer decor that we would have enjoyed as teenagers 40 years ago.
Manager Response: We are thrilled to hear that you enjoyed your stay at our charming little hotel! It sounds like you stayed in one our our 10 unique Surf Suites. I'd like to let you know that we have recently remodeled all 26 of our Deluxe guest rooms in a rich Spanish theme to coincide with the hotel's original architecture. I recommend you try out one of our Deluxe King or Deluxe Partial View Queen rooms during your next visit... you won't be disappointed! Looking to seeing you again! Charlotte Gulley Guest Service Manager

Summary: Spent a few nights in the Cottage.  Great for a family (fully-fitted kitchen, washing machine, dishwasher). Superb location;  excellent staff.  A real treat.  Would definitely choose this hotel on a future visit to Laguna Beach.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Good: yes, it has character-it's not just another motel. About 50 yards from great beach access. Comfortable beds and proper tub ( except in the suites, which strangely only have showers).Majority of staff friendly and keen to help. Bad: Mexican  theme means rooms are decorated in a sepia-type finish, and with dim lights, are dark, especially smaller rooms ( most of the rooms are small)..can be very noisy..recommend do not have rooms 105,106,107 at weekend because staff have to go past constantly to serve food in the courtyard...and would expect rooms on PCH side to be noisy. Restaurant- tried once, has complicated half-price offer on Tuesdays, food was OK but you can do better in LB. No pool, spa, etc.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post your review. We are happy to hear that you enjoyed the unique character of La Casa del Camino, and that you slept comfortably.   It's regrettable that our newly renovated Deluxe rooms were not pleasing to you. Our vision for the renovation of our Deluxe guest rooms was to maintain the Spanish style in which our hotel was originally built, in 1927, while updating the rooms with the modern amenities of a boutique hotel. I'd like to let you know that we have 10 additional guest rooms which were each uniquely designed by 10 different surf companies. These are our Casa Surf Suites, and based on your feedback, I think you would enjoy one of these rooms more than our Deluxe rooms. You can see pictures of our various guest rooms on our website.  To clarify our Tuesday Bonus Happy Hour - When you buy any cocktail, beer or wine, you receive half off any food item on the dinner menu. Tuesday Happy Hour is offered 5:30-close in K'ya Bistro.  Your candid comments are appreciated, and we hope to have the opportunity to host you again, perhaps in one of our Surf Suites :)  Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services La Casa del Camino

Summary: I had the chance to stay at Casa del Camino again and it was the best experience imaginable. This was my second visit. I arrived late and James greeted me warmly and assisted in getting the perfect room with an ocean view. Norma manages the place smoothly, and thanks to Belen, Veronica, and Meghan, the guests have a wonderful experience. The ambiance of this 1929 resort can't be found in today's structures. The rooftop deck is worth the trip alone! Not the fanciest place, but the best value for your money. Very dog friendly too. For relaxation and reflection, it's just steps from the beach. Efficiently located at the south end if town so the business traveler isn't caught up in the traffic. I found all that I needed within a short walking distance. Do your research, look around
Manager Response: none

Summary: If you are heading to Laguna, la casa del camino is the place to stay! Everything was awesome starting from booking (Amy rocks)! The whole staff is very friendly and they absolutely want you to enjoy your stay. La casa del Camino has very cozy rooms which10 are decorated by different surfing  companies, very unique, I stayed at the Quiksilver room. The restaurant downstairs, K'ya Bistro is one of the best in town and at the same time is very casual. The roof bar is very popular and the local crowd is always there. The beach is a one minute walk and you are close to everything! I don't even want to try other hotels when I¬¥m in the area, I already know how to get the best experience in Laguna Beach!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your comments! We are thrilled you enjoyed your stay at our hotel, and we look forward to hosting you again in the future. Your business is very much appreciated.  Kind Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services La Casa del Camino

Summary Heading: Great Service, Great Food, Great Bar
Summary: We loved this hotel.  The view from the hotel bar was amazing, and during the early evening it was a great vibe!  Short walk to other restaurants, bars and shopping! Our bed was comfortable and our room was clean, will definitely be back!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Best kept secret in Laguna. Staff is wonderful including Norma at the front desk. Hotel is well located at the south end of town, just 1 mile from downtown but in the middle of great galleries, restaurants,  bars, etc. Majestic views of the Pacific. Rooms all unique, some bigger and better than others. Ask questions about room. Surf Suites worth the extra $.  Mix with locals as they all converge on the rooftop bar to watch the incredible sunset.  Lobby restaurant is one of the best in Laguna. Lively, reasonably priced, excellent food all make this a destination spot. If you are looking for uniformity, blandness, quite lobby bars, road - worn business people, this place is not for you.  If you want to be close to the beach, in the middle of a lively local spot, call now. Value
Manager Response: Dear TPL1,  Thank you for your review! Your compliments have been passed on, and Norma is stoked on your shout-out to her exemplary customer service :) Your recommendations and description of our hotel are on point and much appreciated. We look forward to the opportunity to host you again soon!  Happy Travels, Charlotte, Guest Services  La Casa del Camino

Summary: Stayed in 12 hotels on my recent 3 week USA trip with my girlfriend. This was our favourite by far (including staying in 5 star and paying 400 a night).  Staff were great, very friendly and welcoming. The rooftop bar is awesome. Get there when happy hour is on though. We saw people waiting for tables from around 6pm. Great view to watch the sunset over the sea.  Rooms are great, very clean and have that boutique look (which I love).  Also noticed I think it was the manager downstairs at breakfast commenting to the staff on changing the cups that we being used at breakfast. I'm guessing that this attention to detail is what makes this place so good.  Will be staying here again when I'm down in Laguna. Just go there and see it for yourself. You won't be let down.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review of your recent stay. We are thrilled to hear that La Casa del Camino was your favorite hotel during your 3 week trip to the states! Your recommendations and suggestions are appreciated, and we look forward to hosting you again :)  Warm Regards, Charlotte Gulley Guest Services, La Casa del Camino

Summary: We stayed here last minute and loved it , great atmosphere and roof top bar over looking the pacific ocean wow, our room was very cozy I would go back for sure! The staff was very helpful also. Lacuna beach is always fun to visit and this place is at the heart of it all. You should stay here for sure.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great place, but choose your room carefully
Summary: Stayed here for 3 nights in September and overall enjoyed it greatly. We had two surf suites on the second floor with great views, which were far enough away from the bar/restaurant noise. The decoration was great, excellent attention to detail. I'd recommend doing the same. I can't imagine staying in a room overlooking the PCH is any fun. The rooms were warm and needed open windows at night.  The location near the beach is perfect. Parking is free in a nearby lot.   Two gripes: firstly, I echo the comments about the roof top terrace. We tried three times to use it and only succeeded once when it was late evening and getting cool and breezy. One time the entire terrace was booked for the whole night for a wedding and the next evening half the tables had been reserved by someone.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and feedback! We are happy to hear you enjoyed your stay and look forward to the possibility of hosting you next time you return to Laguna Beach. Warm Regards, Charlotte Guest Services, La Casa del Camino

Summary: A favorite spot in Laguna Beach for me for over 10 years, this hotel only keeps getting better. If you are fortunate enough to be greeted at the front desk by Norma, you can rest assured that your experience for the remainder of your stay will be top notch. A small and cozy boutique hotel that has some truly unique rooms fashioned by local designers a couple of years ago, a great restaurant with a most creative menu and a roof top bar that is spectacular and one of the most sought after spots for a sunset cocktail in the area. There are fancier and pricier hotels in the area, but why??
Manager Response: We would like to thank you for your business and loyalty to La Casa del Camino! It has been a true pleasure to host you over the years, and we are looking forward to many more of your visits! Thank you for posting your kind comments. Warm Regards, Chris, Norma, and the staff at La Casa del Camino

Summary Heading: I got more sleep in Vegas!
Summary: Before I start I would like to say that I say in hotels on a weekly basis so I know what to expect from a hotel when travelling. The location is great and right next to the beach - the price was good - the roof top bar and the restaurant are also excellent. The problem I had was on arrival the room was presented to us as European in size?! ‚Äì I‚Äôm British so I know what to expect and this was the smallest room I have ever stayed in and the bathroom was in proportion! ‚Äì to make things even worse they have installed large portable air conditioning units that take up most of the  available floor space + they make a real noise when running at night but they did reduce the noise from the hall and windows so I guess that‚Äôs a plus... This was not the worst point ‚Äì the room was located
Manager Response: Thank you for posting your review of our hotel. We are sorry to hear of your disappointment in the size of your guest room. La Casa del Camino is a historical Laguna Beach property, circa 1920. We have just completed an extensive room renovation this year, and have decided to stay true to our historic Spanish style in which the property was originally built. Some of our rooms are quite small (namely our Deluxe Non View Queen, and Partial Ocean View Queen rooms), however they are original to the building and provide a truly unique experience for the open-minded. We do have in-room air conditioning units that take up a little floor space, however we have arranged them in the room as well as possible, understanding that most guests prefer to have an air conditioned room when it's hot outside. We are sorry that you found this to be an inconvenience.   We have negotiated with the local waste management company to have them pick up the neighborhood trash later in the mornings in an effort to minimize noise for our hotel guests. Thank you for your recommendation to book rooms away from the hotel elevator and stairwell. We truly wish that we could honor this request for all guests, however, we are a boutique property with only 36 rooms; we are frequently fully booked.  Your feedback and comments are appreciated, and we are happy to know you were able to enjoy our Rooftop Lounge, K'ya Bistro, and our convenient location.  Warm Regards, Charlotte Gulley Guest Services, La Casa del Camino

Summary: My husband and I recently visited La Casa Del Camino on our first year wedding anniversary, we loved the whole experience. Hotel was very cute, and was located right on the beach. Front desk staff was very friendly, gave us some suggestions regarding watching the sunset at the Roof Top Lounge (arrive early to get a table about 5pm) and also night life (The White House). We totally weren't expecting such an amazing trip. We would totally recommend this place to all our family and friends. Keep up the great customer service=)  P.S. At the Roof Top Lounge order their Sangria/Margarita, we also had their hummus and pita bread, and salsa and chips...DELICIOUS!!   We can't wait to go back!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great Hotel - Great Perks - Excellent Location - Wonderful Staff
Summary: Casa del Camino oozes charm and atmosphere.  The rooms are perfect - so much better than anything you'd find in a chain hotel - simple, but enough to satisfy.  Who needs a coffee maker and a mini fridge inside the room?  If you do - you're spending WAY too much in your room.  The bed was very comfortable.  The bathroom was well appointed and the shower was wonderful.    When we first arrived in CA we found we had to pay for virtually everything.  Nothing - really nothing -came free.  And then we got to Laguna Beach and Casa del Camino ... a breath of fresh air.  We checked in and were told where to park our vehicle.  We asked how much per day for parking .... FREE.  We were told about the breakfast served each morning from 7:00 - 10:00.  We asked how much ... FREE.  We asked the
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post a review of your recent stay! We are thrilled to hear how much you enjoyed your stay; from all the free amenities to our friendly staff. Your compliments regarding our front desk, bar and restaurant staff have been passed along and are very much appreciated. We hope to have the opportunity to host you again, should your travels bring you back to Laguna Beach. Warm Regards, Charlotte Gulley Guest Services, La Casa del Camino

Summary: Norma at the front desk was amazing and so helpful and accomodating. All the available perks were awesome... The French toast eggs coffee fresh fruit breakfast with a rooftop ocean view, the beach chair service, the great menu at the Kya Bistro and the comfy beds. Great location and within walking distance to downtown shops and restaurants. Can't ask for much more.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I really wanted to like this place...the hotel is positioned as a wonderfully updated, hip and trendy luxurious hotel on PCH in downtown Laguna Beach. The rooms were pretty well updated, but incredibly small. Cannot count how many times I stubbed a toe trying to navigate the room, furniture and luggage. The place is very popular with the locals...so good for them, but not so good for the guests. Very noisy everywhere, hallways always crowded with people waiting for the restroom. The rooftop bar has a great view but we were never able to use it because it was always slammed with tables being reserved by locals at steep prices from what I understand. The room included a breakfast but it was a very limited buffet that was replenished very well and it was very
Manager Response: none

Summary: Was excited to return to LCdC and was SO very disappointed!  We had been here before the recent 'remodel' and it really takes away from the charm of this beautiful hotel.  Also, when arriving into our room I immediately noticed the smell of a cheap (sickly sweet) carpet cleaner product.  It didn't smell 'clean' at all it was like the product that was used was to cover up a dirty carpet.  Also up on the rooftop bar, there were tables marked 'reserved'  for anyone willing to pay $150.00 to reserve them???  I've never heard anything so ridiculous!  Shouldn't it be first come first served and if anything is reserved, SHOULDN'T it be for the PAYING guests of the hotel?? The bed was comfortable, but it was one of those will a bottom sheet coming constantly untucked because it was too
Manager Response: We are so sorry to hear of your disappointment in our recently renovated rooms. We replaced all our carpets and have them cleaned regularly, and are sad to hear of your assumption that we are trying to cover up dirty carpet with a heavy scent, as this is not the case. We have discussed your comments with our carpet cleaning company, and will be trying a different carpet shampoo next time.  Our Rooftop Lounge is first come, first serve.  Tables with a reserved sign on them are actually reserved by guests who paid the reservation fee of $150. We typically only have 2-4 paid table reservations on any given night, leaving the majority of tables open to everyone. The Rooftop is a very popular place for both locals and visitors alike, and is especially crowded during holiday weekends. We apologize that this was an inconvenience during your stay.   Thank you for your candid comments, Charlotte Gulley Guest Service

Summary: We booked this on the net the night before arrival on the recommendation of a guide book. Hugely disappointing. The very small room looked  onto a wall and the mustard deco was SO depressing.  We had a quick drink on the roof terrace and tried to book a table for the evening. Apparently you CAN book a table but only if you pay and do it well in advance. It's mobbed by locals. You're staying in the hotel? Tough! Same for the restaurant. We hadn't thought to book but a nice waitress found us a table on the balcony. Noisy as it was on the street it was probably a better deal than the very noisy restaurant. Good food though and very reasonably priced. Breakfast was okay but for those of us who are ecologically sensitive the plastic plates, cutlery etc. were a disappointment.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are sorry to hear of your displeasure in the interior design of our Deluxe guest rooms. We are a historic property in Laguna Beach, originally built in the 1920's. We recently completed the renovation of all our hotel rooms and have chosen to maintain the Spanish themed decor and color scheme to remain consistent with our historical heritage. Our Rooftop Lounge is indeed very popular with locals and travelers alike. We keep the Rooftop Lounge as "first come, first serve" in order to allow everyone, including our spontaneous guests, to enjoy the view. Our restaurant, K'ya Bistro, is also one of the city's most popular dining spots, attracting a very energetic crowd. Reservations are definitely recommended, as our food and great prices can't be beat.  Your feedback regarding our included breakfast buffet are appreciated, and modifications to our presentation are under discussion. We are also devising a new system to favor our valued hotel guests who would like Rooftop Lounge reservations.  Thanks again for your candid comments. We wish you happy travels! Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: I am sorry to say that overall, our stay at the La Casa del Camino was a disappointment.  I knew this was an "historic" hotel, and so was not expecting the larger, modern rooms of many present-day hotels.  I knew the rooms would be smaller, and although they were pleasantly updated (comfortable beds, attractive comforter, new carpets, new tile and shower in bath, nice-size TV mounted high on wall so you could see it easily from bed), they were dark and just too darned small and narrow to be comfortable.  These are definitely not rooms for families, but only for singles or couples who are comfortable sharing a bed in cramped quarters.  It was hot, and the free-standing air conditioner unit barely did the job.  My son and I, staying in separate rooms, both had to have our units
Manager Response: I'm so sorry to hear of your disappointment in your recent stay at our hotel. It is true that our Deluxe rooms are quite "cozy" and you were correct to point out that these particular rooms are not for families, but rather for singles or couples who will be sharing a bed (king or queen size beds are the norm in our Deluxe rooms).  Regarding our Rooftop Lounge, yes, it tends to be extremely busy during the late afternoon and sunset hours, most especially during the summer beach season. Our Rooftop is open on a first come first serve basis, and is not exclusive to only hotel guests. Table reservations can be made in advance for a fee, as is true for most trendy or prominent lounges and bars. We apologize that this was an inconvenience during your stay.  Your candid comments are appreciated and your feedback will be utilized as we continue to strive for total guest satisfaction.   Warm Regards, Charlotte Guest Services

Summary Heading: Great Hotel with a perfect location!
Summary: My wife and I recently stayed here for 4 nights.  We couldnt have enjoyed it more.  The room was perfect with a nice view of the ocean (even from the bathroom!), the staff was VERY polite and helpful, the food at the restaurant was great, the rooftop bar was out of this world, the free FULL breakfast every morning was more that we had hoped for, the location was the perfect walking distance to downtown Laguna, the hotel had a ton of character...not a bad thing to say about it.  This was by far one of the best trips we have ever had and a large part of it has to do with this Hotel.  We even left one of our pillows there and they offered to mail it back FREE of charge!   Amazing place, highly recommend it and definitely recommend spending a few extra $$ on getting one of their
Manager Response: Thank you for posting your review of our hotel. We are happy to know you and your wife enjoyed our unique little gem as much as we do :) I'm glad you have received your forgotten pillow... I know I can't sleep without mine. It was our pleasure to send it back to you.  We hope to host you again next time you visit beautiful Laguna Beach!  Warm Regards, Charlotte Guest Services

Summary: First things first...you have to take some of these other reviews with a grain of salt.  If you want a shiny new hotel then stay somewhere else.  This is a hotel built in the 20's, (as it says right on the website).  It has character, charm and a classic style.  This was my first stay at this hotel and I have to tell you, I was impressed.  First off the star of the hotel is The Rooftop and it was awesome.  The view was amazing and it appears to be the place to be seen in Laguna.  The rooms were fantastic, (we stayed in the Billabong suite) but the service was what really stood out at this hotel.  Everyone from the front desk, the rooftop servers, the maids...were pleasant and helpful.  Last but not least, the food at K'ya was exceptional.  They do small tapas style dishes and I
Manager Response: Your comments and commendations are very much appreciated. We are so happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay in our Billabong Surf Suite. We have many other uniquely designed rooms and hope you might have the opportunity to check them all out! Your compliments to the hotel, restaurant and Rooftop staff have been passed along... Thank you for your enthusiasm!  Warm Regards, Charlotte Guest Services

Summary Heading: Some nice things...and some basic things VERY wrong.
Summary: This is a hard one to write.  We had a nice time in Laguna and the hotel didn't take away from that.  But compared to other places I've stayed recently...I was hugely underwhelmed with this place.  First...we stayed in a themed, beach view room that was really cute...the Billabong Room. The first impression was a great, big smile.    But the room wasn't clean.  Our first night (of two) I even ASKED the front desk to have housekeeping get the cobwebs off the light fixture in the bath and vacume the room--and they DIDN'T!!!  (The second time I mentioned it to the hotel manager...she didn't even say 'sorry.'  Just said she'd see it was handled before the next guest.)   Then....the room offers either an option of a wall AC unit, or open windows to hear the surf and get fresh air.
Manager Response: Thank you for writing your review of our hotel. I'm so sorry to hear of the frustration with your room upon your arrival (housekeeping service and sunlight from the bathroom window); these have been directly addressed and discussed with all responsible parties. Our guest's experiences and resulting feedback are very important to us and we sincerely appreciate your clear points and honest opinions. Your feedback is currently being utilized in our internal meetings as we strive to continually improve our service and guest experience.  We sincerely hope to have the opportunity to host you again, and to show you our true vision of this little gem in Laguna Beach.   Warm Regards, Charlotte Guest Services

Summary Heading: Aweful and disappointing hotel....please save your money and AVOID!!!!!!
Summary: The first room we got was dark and dingy with little light coming through. The walls were unsettling colour and did not feel homely. Windows were small, and the curtains were dirty. The floor boards smelt vile (echoing similar comments by other people) We requested a room changed, and it was no different to the first one. The area where the bed was located was barely big enough to walk around in both rooms.  The price of this hotel was similar to a  4* elsewhere, even after discount. However in our opinion this does not come up to standard advertised.  The only thing the hotel has going for it is, the bar on the terrace.  My suggestion would be to stay elsewhere, but come visit the bar.
Manager Response: We are very sorry to hear of your disappointment with your room. La Casa del Camino is a historic property and we offer many different room types, however, the larger rooms with a view are typically booked earliest. You may be correct in stating that our prices are similar to a 4 star property elsewhere (in another city), but I'm sure you found that all prices in Laguna Beach are very different from hotels located in other cities, as Laguna Beach is very unique. (Typical 3 star hotels in Laguna Beach range from $400-$600 per night in the summer!)  We are happy to hear you were able to appreciate the beautiful view from our Rooftop Lounge. Thank you for your candid comments. We wish you happy travels. Warm Regards, Charlotte Guest Services

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, but a bit dated
Summary: We stayed here one night when traveling between LA and San Diego.  The hotel is in a great spot and has great access to downtown Laguna and the beaches.  The interior of the hotel itself is very dated.  The lobby and bar area seem updated, but the corridor to the rooms and the rooms themselves have what appear to be old carpeting and very dated and worn fixtures.  The hotel could feel better about charging the prices they do, or more if they gave the rooms and corridor a little face lift.  Another thing that was not so great about the hotel was the roof deck bar.  There was a private party there when we arrived.  We went out for some dinner and drinks and arrived back at the hotel around 9:30, we figured we would grab drinks at the roof deck then.  The bartenders up there was
Manager Response: none

Summary: We were taken in by the heavily discounted price of this property, and again learned the hard way that "you get what you pay for."  Our room was terrible - small, noisy, poorly lit, and the bathroom was a joke - so small it was claustrophobic.  Although billed as "a smoke-free property", the smell of someone smoking marijuana wafted through the air ducts to our room 2-3 times over the course of our one-night stay.   We had originally booked for two nights, but had had enough after night #1, and asked for a refund for night #2, to which they quickly agreed.  I dinstinctly got the impression that the complaints I aired to the hotel staff had been heard many times before, which is quite telling.  Lastly, the decor in the rooms, which they proudly told us had been renovated over the
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post your review of La Casa del Camino. We are very sorry to hear of your dissatisfaction, and would like to let you know that we have a very wide variety of room sizes and styles to suit the various tastes of most guests and travelers. It sounds like you may have received a deeply discounted room rate on one of our smaller (more original) room sizes in our historic building. Please know we also offer much larger rooms, more contemporary in design, but as with most hotels, the more premium rooms are priced accordingly.   We are most definitely a non-smoking property, and apologize profusely for the possibility of another guest disrespecting our policy. We are glad you brought your comments and concerns to us after staying one night. Our number one priority is the comfort and satisfaction of every guest; A refund for your second night was given so freely because we truly just want you to be happy with your visit to Laguna Beach. We realize that our historic and energetic boutique hotel may not be for everyone, and we thank you for your feedback.  Sincerely, Charlotte  Guest Service Manager

Summary Heading: Outstanding Service; Fun Energetic Hotel; Great Location; No "Extra" Charges
Summary: We were redoing our house in Hermosa Beach, so we decided to have a "staycation" in Laguna, which is about an hour south.  I searched online to find a place, and many of them looked the same... so price was the deciding factor.  This hotel does not charge a resort fee, and it doesn't charge for parking... so it was the winner.  We arrived and noticed that the location was great.  It is on the west side of PCH, which means that it is right by the beach.  All you have to do is take the steps down to the beach.  We were greeted by Holli (I may be misspelling her name, but I don't think it had the "e.")  She was terrific and really made our stay.  She got us wine glasses and a wine opener when she noticed our bottle of wine.  She did the same with glasses when she saw us enter with
Manager Response: none

Summary: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights! We booked through hotels.com and got placed in ther handicap room. Which was fine. The bed was amazing. But... They have other rooms that were a lot nicer. You can't  beat the location and the restaurant downstairs! Also... Their breakfast ~ Amazing!!!! Best part is its FREE. Also they don't charge for  parking which is another plus! Overall we loved the hotel just wish we would of had a different room!
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed in a few years back for about a month whilst working in the area. Service was fantastic, clean rooms, great food and great ambiance on the rooftop. Always a place I would go back and see when I'm back in Laguna.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My husband & I dropped off our 3rd (& last) daughter at OSU and headed to the airport for  a much needed "empty nest" celebration!  The atmosphere is amazing! The breakfast was always enjoyable and the roof top lounge is awesome!!  Only downside...we got a parking ticket upon arrival, do not leave your car in the 3 min loading zone, you will get a $95 ticket! (the desk should alert its patrons to that fact).
Manager Response: none

Summary: We just got back from a week of busy family functions in Orange County and coming back to relax in Laguna Beach was ideal.  The location was absolutely perfect for us.  The beach was just down the street.  While the room we had was rather on the small side it did have a bed and a bath and, really, that's all we actually needed.  I was surprized by the fact that there was a crowded bar with music directly below us and the room was still quiet!  (I had lived in a 100 year old building above a bar for 7 years and the noise was always deafening.)  The roof top restaurant was wonderful and the prices were very fair (can't even begin to describe the incredible view).  The staff were friendly and helpful.  I have been telling everyone I know to check it out.  I'd even send my mother
Manager Response: none

Summary: You can put lipstick on a pig, but that doesn‚Äôt change the fact that it is still a pig.  You can slap a coat of paint on a 2-star flop-house, but that doesn‚Äôt make it the Victoria Jungfrau.  It‚Äôs still just a dive with a paint job.  This is the case with La Casa del Camino.  Had it not been for the dreadful experience at the Capri Laguna, I would not have even known about this hotel.  It was nearly midnight when I packed up and left that slum down the street, so I had no desire to do a thorough search for a quality hotel.  I simply stopped at the nearest one.  La Casa del Camino was just 1 block down the street so I checked in.  They wanted $204 including tax for the night.  My first impression was that this was a bit high, but I was dog tired, so I agreed.  The day had begun @
Manager Response: Dear Ravenshaw,  We are sorry to hear of your frustrations regarding the interior design and new decor of our unique historic hotel. We have put a lot of thought and consideration into our renovations, and while we have received many great reviews and compliments regarding our style and ambiance, we realize La Casa del Camino may not be suitable to everyone's taste.   Regarding your comment about a film on the curtains, these are all brand new velvet drapes. The only texture we have found is the actual texture of the fabric.   Your comments regarding our deluxe continental breakfast, wireless Internet, and room design have been noted, and your feedback is appreciated.   Regards, Charlotte

Summary: I chose this place based on the reviews and it did not disappoint. If you're looking for a ritzy hotel then this isn't for you. But if you're looking for a cozy, beautiful place with a lot of character, this is for you. The room was small but it was clean and I really liked the way it was decorated. The staff is very nice and accommodating. It's only a couple of steps to the beach which was cool. The rooftop lounge is a big plus too. I'll definitely be back to visit. Thanks for a great stay!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Just got back from a long weekend and the word we keep using to describe our stay at La Casa is....FUN. We had a blast staying at this unique hotel in Laguna beach. The location, view, our surf themed room, rooftop bar, excellent restaurant and great staff will bring us back again. Breakfast (delicious) up on the rooftop, with fantastic views of the ocean and great Bloody Mary's started each day. We would return to the rooftop each nite before we headed out for excellent Mohitos. The food at both the bar upstairs (appetizers) and for dinner at K'ya (small plates) is excellent. K'ya - diverse menu of tapas style food - really stellar! Our room - Billabong - was cool and quirky- surfboard on wall, unique art and bathroom, comfy bed. Friendly, SoCal beach vibe throughout hotel,
Manager Response: none

Summary: La Casa isn't your big box kind of Hotel.  It is intimate and odd offering most amenities but some only at the asking.  Celebrating 80 + years it has been updated as best as the structure permits.  The rooms aren't large but rather "continental" and antique furnished in the rustic SoCal nature. Staff is friendly and helpful meeting all requests with a smile.  Short walk down the steps to a picturesque beach.  Town center is a 10 minute walk.  The attached K'ya is an eclectic jewel for dining and the bar is vibrant with locals and guests alike.  The rooftop dining area offers great vistas.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My husband and I stayed here for our anniversary and loved it. There was a little bit of confusion about what type of room we paid for because they had been renovating rooms and their website wasn't matching what we booked. However, we were taken care of by their employees and put in the proper room. Once there, it was great! The bed was incredibly comfortable, the bathroom is nice, etc.  There are some things you should know about this place: 1. The parking is across the street (not a big deal at all and we only had trouble finding a spot once, but parked for free in the nearby residential area). 2. The front of the hotel is a very popular restaurant and the rooftop is a popular bar. It seems noisy at first, but it was really quiet around 10pm or so.  3. It's not your typical
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Lovely old world charm, but some unpleasant quirks.
Summary: You can't beat the location, view, or vintage hotel charm of La Casa del Camino. However, our room was incredibly tiny, and very uncomfortable. Our bed was small and rickety. The bathroom was small with no tub. For a hotel on the beach, not having a removable shower head made it impossible to wash the sand out of our shower! We had a room facing the main road, so I'm assuming that the ocean-side of the hotel is probably much nicer. Also, the hotel staff seems much more concerned with running the rooftop bar than they are about their hotel. We got stopped constantly and warned about the "long wait at the bar" when we were simply just trying to go back to our room. The rooftop bar has a stunning view, but as would be expected, is always crowded. The location was the best part of
Manager Response: Dear Chelsea P,  Your review is very much appreciated. We are happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay, and that you were able to take full advantage of our great location. I love that you took your dessert down to the beach at night to listen to the full power of the crashing waves ~ that's one of my personal favorite things to do as well! Your suggestions have been noted for internal review. We thank you for your candid comments and look forward to hosting you again, next time you visit Laguna Beach (in one of our surf suites!)  Warmest Regards, Charlotte Gulley Guest Services

Summary: A really unique property, with the unique atmosphere (and quirkyness) of a heritage hotel.  The surf-themed rooms are really neat.  Bedding and pillows were great.  All facilities worked fine (air-con, shower, good water pressure).  Found it to be very quiet and had a good sleep both nights (and I am a poor sleeper).  Location is super -- can walk everywhere -- don't need the car at all.  Roof top bar is a must -- go for happy hour.  The restaurant off the lobby is also excellent.  Staff was very friendly and helpful and made our visit special.  This place has atmosphere and charm which makes it special.  It is not your "Holiday Inn at the airport" type place, which means there are compromises (parking is not adjacent to the building, it is an old building so it doesn't have
Manager Response: none

Summary: My husband and I stayed here for my birthday weekend.  We loved our renovated room.  The bed was very comfortable and the shower was great. Free parking is an added bonus. The rooftop can't be beat for the view and for the mojitos.  We had wonderful service and everyone was very friendly.  We ate lunch on the rooftop and loved it.  We enjoyed our dinner at K'ya, but thought it was terribly loud.  We would definitely return and request the same room. (Queen partial view) We were not disappointed at all!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Mixed bag, but a good stay overall
Summary: I made my decision to stay at this place based on the location (close to downtown Laguna (10-15 minutes walk) and the rooftop bar.  It definitely has an old-world feel.  If you are only used to new American hotels, you might be disappointed (as I have seen from a few reviewers).  It is older, smaller, more quaint and without many of the amenities many want.  But, it had character and felt very European.  Our room was smaller than you might expect, but I usually just use my room for sleeping, I don't need a lounge.  There was plenty of space for sleeping, getting dressed and a little drinking before I headed out.  (A bit of an oddity - no public ice machine, but the staff was super quick bringing ice up - maybe 5 minutes max.)  I liked the window in the bathroom/shower that
Manager Response: Thank you for your detailed review! We are glad to hear that you enjoyed the boutique European ambiance that we strive to create for our guests. Your candid compliments and your suggestions are very much appreciated, and have been passed on to the appropriate staff and departments of the hotel. We appreciate your business and hope to have the opportunity to host you again!  Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: My daughter and I recently spent a long weekend at this hotel and it was beyond lovely. Our first night we spent in one of the newly renovated rooms in the old part of the building. It was a charming room however it was recently painted( I'm assuming in the past couple of days) because we both had a reaction to the smell of the paint. The next morning I informed the desk about this situation they showed us other rooms that were available and graciously upgraded us to one of the suites--We had the Roxy suite it was adorable and comfortable (if you can book a suite they are worth the money). The hotel location is great you are right on the ocean and have access to the beach from the hotel as well as close to restaurants and shops. Will definitely return next time we are in town.
Manager Response: none

Summary: LagunaBeach was a perfect weekend Winter getaway, and this hotel added to the charm of the whole place.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Sweet little spot with lots of character
Summary: So, upon booking this hotel I was a bit nervous. Some of the reviews were sketchy to say the least... load noise, rude service blah blah blah. Our stay at La Casa del Camino was nothing less than perfect. We were in town for a long weekend and found its location to be fantastic. Restaurants, shops and beach were minutes away by walking while the service and staff were totally accommodating.   The atmosphere of the hotel was a great mixture of historic and contemporary. The bar downstairs was super inviting with a nice fire and live music for chilling in the evening and the rooftop bar was perfect for bloody mary's mid day in the sunshine!  As for our room, we booked one of the surf suites which were a bit pricey but I got a deal from an online hotel site for 30% off the booking
Manager Response: Dear Amelia E, Thank you so much for your kind comments. I am thrilled to hear that you enjoyed your stay so much! We appreciate your recommendation on booking the beautiful Surf Suites - they are definitely worth the upgrade.  We look forward to seeing you again next  year! Charlotte, and the staff at La Casa del Camino

Summary: My wife and baby and I stay here just about every trip we can make through Orange County.  We have had a great experience every stay. The staff is friendly, personal, and always go out of their way to make sure you have everything you need. Lots of great perks... discounts at local restaurants, free water/towels/chairs for the beach, free yummy breakfasts, room upgrades, etc.  The atmosphere is private and quiet, despite it being a local hotspot in the rooftop deck and restaurant.  The best view in town from the rooftop deck/restaurant, and the menu and food is amazing and affordable.  Just steps from a private beach, and walking distance to all the downtown shops.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are happy to hear that La Casa del Camino is your favorite getaway! We sincerely appreciate your repeated business, and look forward to seeing you and your family again soon! Kind Regards, Guest Services, La Casa del Camino

Summary: Laguna Beach is maybe the most European style Beach city in California, other than Carmel, and this is a cool place to stay if you enjoy European sensibilities over chain hotel sterility. It's small, but not too small, and it's a great blend of old-school quirkiness and modern upgrades. Located just above a famous yet obscure OC surf spot, with a beautiful beach half a block away. Walking distance to downtown, and lots of restaurants and galleries. Great restaurant/bar areas inside. Really reasonable rates for an ultra hip pad in Laguna... And I know cause I used to live in Laguna Canyon while working in the surf industry. This is where the non-tourists go, because it's the coolest place in town. Yeah, you have to drop your bags off before parking (across the street), but that's
Manager Response: Dear Miksurf, Thank you for taking the time to post your pointers and opinion. We are happy to know that you love our charming European-styling and quirkiness, great location and reasonable rates! Your recommendations are greatly appreciated, and we look forward to seeing you again soon! Warm Regards, La Casa del Camino

Summary: My partner and I love Laguna Beach and La Casa del Camino Hotel. Wow what a great time we had for my partner and I 20th anniversary. Katy gave us a wonderful suite with an ocean view and a complimentary bottle of champagne. (Actually Norma Chose the room for us 322 her favorite) As always Norma and Katy treated us well. We also had cocktails at the Roof Top Lounge which was fantastic. Great views wonderful bartenders and servers. We had dinner down stairs at K' ya Bistro for the first time and it was one of the best meals we have had in Laguna. We ended the night in front of the huge lobby fire place talking to new friends and having a glass of wine.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My fiance and I are planning our wedding in Laguna next year and were looking for a place to stay with our guests. We were excited about staying here because it looked so cool on their website. The "convenient" parking was our first bad experience. It is across Pacific Coast Highway, so we had to drag our bags across the busy street. Not only that, but the parking is a joke. The lot is so tiny and the spaces are so crammed I had to get out and direct my fiance into the spot every time.  We checked in and asked to speak to the woman who coordinates room blocks and weddings but she was not there. We were told our room was in the basement and to take the stairs down to get to our room. The halls smelled old and musty and the floors creak VERY loudly. When we got to our room, we
Manager Response: none

Summary: I booked this hotel after seeing an episode of Real Housewives of OC.  It was for a birthday weekend for my husband and thought it would be a great romantic get away, especially the rooftop bar.  Well, we never made it passed the lobby.  After checking in, we decided to check the room before lugging in our luggage.  Great thing that we did.  The room was small (our closet was bigger), the furniture was old, the carpet and window treatments were dated, and an old "grandma" smell wafted through the room.  There was a 15" LCD on a little dresser, a squeaky bed, and nightstands.  We did not even bother to check the bathroom.  We asked for an upgrade and was shown a larger room but everything else was the same including the grandma smell. We ended up staying at the Best Western
Manager Response: I am sorry to hear that you were unhappy with the standard room originally booked. La Casa del Camino offers a wide variety of guest rooms; the favorites being the 10 recently renovated Surf Suites. I would like to note that we are currently undergoing a renovation of our smaller standard guest rooms with completion estimated by the end of the year. Having been built in 1929, some of our standard guest rooms are indeed quite "cozy," but are very clean and comfortable, offering a more authentic historic hotel experience.   We look forward to hosting you in one of our Surf Suites... I'm confident you would find these rooms to be exactly what you had in mind. Thanks again for your candid comments!

Summary Heading: Great location, but rooms leave something to be desired
Summary: I was very excited to stay at this hotel.  We stumbled upon it in February when we went to dinner at K'ya (the restaurant in the lobby).  It is such a cute hotel.  THe lobby has a "spanish cozy" feel to it and we loved the food at K'ya.  So when we got the chance to come back, we jumped on it.  I was expecting the small rooms, but when we walked into our room, it felt like a step back in time.  The bed was hard and the sheets were incredibely uncomfortable.  I had heard there were rennovated rooms and had asked for one, but there wasn't one available.  I think it would have been a very different experience if we had been able to get a rennovated room.  That being said, you can't beat the location, restaurant, and rooftop bar.  It was great for one one night in Laguna, but I
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. We are glad to hear that you enjoy our hotel and restaurants, and hope you choose to return so you may check out our Casa Surf Suites or another of our many great room options. It is true that some of our economy rooms are "a step back in time," and we are currently undergoing a renovation of our economy rooms on the first floor (below the lobby level). We are always striving for improvement in all areas of the hotel and I would like to encourage you to call us if you have any questions regarding updates in room types, or upgraded room availabilities.  Your comments are very much appreciated!

Summary: Had amazing experience, from start to finish.  The decor is contemporary spanish moroccan style, but its their guest services that make this place stand out.  I've stayed at other boutique hotels in Laguna, this by far was best experience. Planned on staying in standard queen bed w/partial bathroom view, but was upgrade to king bed w/full ocean view! It wasn't their newer rooms, but bathroom was big, room was comfortable. TV bit dated, but if not spending time in room who cares.  Rooftop lounge and 24 hour access is a bonus. Great food & drinks up there. Also, took hotel provided breakfast (another delicious meal there) up to Rooftop in the morning - beautiful.  Had dinner nearby and great bar located on same block.    Upon returning to hotel after night out on the town, we were
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Nice hotel in the middle of Laguna Beach
Summary: I read the reviews before booking this hotel, so I was prepared for the noise and small rooms. I stayed here last week and upon checking in I was not going to rate this higher than a 3. The location is perfect, but with that comes a lot of road noise, which seems typical for this area. We checked  in about 1 hour earlier (2 pm). We were given a room located on PH, above the restaurant. There was a heavy clorox smell in the small room so we open the windows and went out. When we came back we had a shock, the room was now smelling like cigarette smoke. Turns out the people in the restaurant downstairs smoke on the sidewalk, so guess where the smoke will go. Anyway, I went to ask at the reception and the girl was super-nice and moved us on the same floor to a more quiet room. So I
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind review. I am so happy to hear that you really enjoyed your stay, despite your initial disappointment at check-in. We are always happy to accommodate our guest's requests, and we thank you for giving us the opportunity to make your stay great.  With warm regards and the hope to see you again soon, Charlotte, Guest Service Casa Resorts Inc.

Summary: We had 3 nights here. I agree with the others the rooms are small, but you only sleep there. The shower was large plenty of hot water and toiletries. Loved the rooftop bar happy hour 3pm till 5pm. We loved the appertisers. We dined in  the restauraunt one night the meal was gorgous. Great location for the beach and the chairs,umbrellas and towels were a bonus. They did a very good breakfast and the staff were very friendly. I would love to stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind review! We are happy to hear you were able to take advantage of our Rooftop Lounge and that you enjoyed your dinner at K'ya Bistro.  We hope to host you again soon!  Warm Regards,  Charlotte, Guest Services Casa Resorts Inc.

Summary: I stayed here three days ago and I still can't decide if I enjoyed my stay.  The location is perfect, but with that comes a lot of road noise, which seems typical for this area.  The staff is great, the bar is yuppie heaven with lots of eye candy.  I checked in to an older room and it was horrible.  I felt like this is where a priest might live:  very small, no desk, extremely hard bed, old and drab furniture.  I asked if they had a room with a better bed and they upgraded me to a renovated room.  What a difference!  Much larger, contemporary furnishings and fixtures, great shower and a very comfy bed.  Make sure you get a renovated room!  But still, the road noise was excessive for most of my stay.  I suppose if I could get a renovated room away from the road then I would stay
Manager Response: I would like to thank you for taking the time to post your thoughts about your recent stay. You are correct in pointing out that some road noise would be typical for Laguna Beach; 27 out of 28 hotels in the city are located on Pacific Coast Highway. A majority of our guest rooms are not facing the highway, and road noise is not typically a problem for guests who book a room with an ocean view. We have been working on upgrading the beds and bathrooms in our standard non-view rooms, and I am glad we had the opportunity and availability to upgrade you to one of our popular Surf Suites.  I hope we have the opportunity to host you again, next time you return to Laguna Beach.   Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services Casa Resorts Inc.

Summary: My wife and I stayed at La Casa del Camino on a recent trip to Pasadena for a friend's wedding.  We absolutely loved the style and decor in the Billabong suite and highly recommend it.  The views from the Rooftop Bar are breathtaking and the food was the perfect compliment.  The hotel is very centrally located in Laguna Beach and within walking distance to all the best restaurants and shops.  Wish we would have had more time there.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here on the last night of a long weekend in Southern California.  Pros - location is great for the beach, probably 100ft away down some steps.  The rooftop bar is a very cool place to hang out, however can get pricey outside of happy hour.  The lobby and bistro/bar are also nice, staff are helpful and friendly..  However, our main con was the inability to get even a few hours straight sleep.  We had a bottom end room, small but clean-ish with no view.  The bed was unbearably hard with protruding springs that poked with every movement, the most uncomfortable I have ever been on and no better than sleeping in a field on a sheet.  The window a/c unit sounded like someone starting up a hot-rod every time it cycled to cool, waking us up until I came far enough out of a half
Manager Response: I am so sorry to hear about your sleepless night. We have looked into your comments about the room you stayed in and I am happy to inform you we have since replaced the air conditioning unit and we have ordered a new mattress for that room. Regarding the elevator alarm, it does not go off simply when someone uses it at night. The alarm only sounds when someone pushes the alarm button. It is upsetting that someone would activate any alarm without cause during the night, and we are sorry that happened during your stay.  I would like to invite you to contact me directly with any questions or concerns regarding your recent stay.   Sincerely, Charlotte, Guest Services guestservice@casaresortsinc.com

Summary: We stayed here for our Anniversary and it was the perfect night away. Everyone of the hotel staff were very friendly, helpful and welcoming.  My husband planned our stay as a surprise for me, and the whole staff helped him coordinate the stay. We came to our room to find a complimentary bottle of wine, they chilled our champagne and set it up with toasting glasses... the room was clean and cozy. We especially loved the rooftop sunset view. I told my husband this is where we will stay everytime we need a quick, local night away. Love, love, love the location, decor and staff makes it all special!!
Manager Response: Dear cheri o,  It was our pleasure to host you during your special weekend. We love to help out with the little extras, and we're happy to hear you enjoyed  your stay.   Looking forward to hosting your next great get-away! The staff at La Casa del Camino

Summary: My wife and I just stayed at La Casa del Camino in Laguna Beach and had a wonderful experience.  The hotel has been beautifully restored at its great location on S. Coast Highway at Cress Beach.  All the rooms have been decorated with different themes and our room had a wonderful ocean view.  The staff here are very friendly and accommodating, looking out for our every need.  Even more impressive is the dining options at La Casa del Camino.  Do not miss a chance to have breakfast or lunch at the Rooftop Lounge, which has an panoramic view of the Laguna coast.  The food and drinks are fantastic.  You will also want to dine at their K'ya Bistro which boasts great food, great drinks, terrific staff and a great value with tapas style dinning.  Be sure to make reservations for dinner
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Fantastic hotel in a brilliant location!
Summary: This hotel was absolutely fantastic. We have just got back yesterday after staying here for the last 4 days of our 2 week holiday in Los Angeles. The hotel is right behind a lovely, quiet beach only a 10 minute walk into the gorgeous centre of Laguna Beach, with plenty of shops, bars and restaurants along the way. The area is super safe and we felt completely comfortable both thru the day and at night.   FREE Parking is provided across the road from the hotel where they'll give you a ticket to place on the dash.  The room was small but super clean and very cosy. It was a nice change actually from the other hotels in L.A. and Vegas where they are a little more generic. This felt more homely.  The restaurant downstairs is also great and we ate here two of the nights as it was so
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed at La Casa Del Camino for one night on my road trip to San Diego, and I have to say that I was pretty impressed for such a boutique hotel. When I made my hotel reservations I decided to splurge a little by staying at a hotel that was right on the Pacific Coast Highway and just steps away from the beach. This hotel had both requirements fulfilled plus free parking, high-speed Internet, great service, and a cozy room.  The hotel is located on the corner of the highway, which, at this point, is a two lane road through the small city of Laguna Beach, and a cul-de-sac. The cul-de-sac is very short, and ends up at the top of the stairs to Crest Beach, which is a quiet and not-as-busy area. I recommend laying out close to noon for great sun and fresh air. The hotel is also
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! Your compliments regarding our complimentary breakfast have been passed on to the kitchen staff; they really appreciate your kind words. We are pleased that you enjoyed your stay, and we look forward to hosting you again soon.  Warm Regards, The staff at La Casa del Camino

Summary: We stayed at La Casa del Camino for 6 nights and had a really great stay. Let's start with the advantages: an incredible staff! We received the best service and their staff is by far the friendliest in the area. Their beach service is incredible!! Chairs, towels, umbrella... all at our convenience. We have never seen beach service like this! Another advantage is the location...only steps to a great beach. The continental breakfast is very good, hot and a nice variety. The roof top restaurant is awesome as well, perfect view! Now, the downsides...yes the rooms are smaller than normal, but we didn't mind. A bathtub would have been nice. Laguna Beach is noisy! We enjoyed sleeping with the windows open but the sirens, cars and people on the street made it difficult at times. Other
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Can't wait to go back next year
Summary: Our stay here was perfect.  The rooms are small, but you have to remember this a old hotel with alot of character.  The rooftop lounge and bar is perfect for a drink and a bite to eat, the view can't be beat.  The location is great.  The stairs to the beach are right behind the hotel and the free shuttle to town is two blocks down.  The food in the restaurant is great, but you should make reservations.  The entertainment in the lobby is nice. I can't wait to go back. I have noticed the changes the owner has made between this year and last year.
