The manager was on site making sure things were taken care of and the desk staff was very nice and accommodating.  I notice this year they added a complimentary breakfast for hotel guest.
Manager Response: Dear Mary W,  Thank you for your review! It was a pleasure to host you and we are happy to hear you continue to enjoy staying with us. We look forward to seeing you again next year!  Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary Heading: Basic rooms but good location and friendly
Summary: Rooms are 'old' quite small and basic but do have all you need. We were on the road side so car & people noise is present but not too bad.  In the area for a wedding we welcomed the location. The hotel car-park is across the road, always busy and with limited manoeuvring room not ideal but is included in rate. There is a 'free' trolley bus to town, which at peak times is busy but provides ideal transport for Pageant of the Stars and access to shops etc.  There is beach access a few steps away, roof top bar with district views and on-site restaurant - all get busy, particularly at the weekend and the crowd does impact your stay - some will like it, some won't.  Free beach towels and equipment are welcome additions and the staff are always helpful. The included breakfast in the
Manager Response: Dear brick_one,  Thank you for taking the time to post your review of our hotel. From your comments, it sounds like  you booked one of our most basic room types, which are indeed a little on the "cozy side" and facing the road. While these rooms are well-equipped with everything you will need during your stay in Laguna Beach, we encourage you to check out the many other styles and types of rooms we offer, many of which are much larger and offer beautiful views of the Pacific Ocean. I especially recommend our Surf Suites, which are each decorated by popular surf and designer brands - truly unique to our hotel!  Summer in Laguna Beach is definitely extremely busy, as we have the Pageant of the Masters, the various Arts Festivals, and of course some of the most beautiful beaches Southern California has to offer. That being said, parking in our small community is very limited, and we are glad you were able to take advantage of the Free Laguna Beach Trolley service to get everywhere you needed to go.  We pride ourselves on being the best value for your dollar in this sometimes very pricey city. Our complimentary amenities include, but are not limited to: Free Parking, Free WiFi, Full Breakfast Buffet for 2 each morning, Free business center services, Free access to the local fitness center (The Art of Fitness),  Use of our beach towels, chairs & umbrellas (and we do all the set-up/clean-up for you!)  We are glad you enjoyed your stay at our hotel, as it was our pleasure to host  you!  Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: A co-worker recommended this hotel and I was very impressed!  Great location, only 10 minutes from the office in Aliso Viejo.  The hotel is very close to the beach and the shops.  The rooftop lounge has an amazing view.  I reserved a room without a view, but I ended up with a nice ocean view!    The sound of the waves was very soothing.  The room is small, but it had everything that I needed. If I go back to Laguna Beach I will definitely stay here again!
Manager Response: none

Summary: My wife and I just returned after a long weekend at this wonderful inn.  While our room was small, it was fine for our needs.  The inn has a lot of great amenities.  The breakfast is bountiful and delicious.  The restaurant is very good, and the rooftop is the best place in town for cocktails at sunset.  The free parking was very close and a nice perk.  The inn is located withing walking distance of many shops and restaurants, and it is located right on the beach.  My wife and I spengt time on the beach behind the hotel, which was very nice.  Chairs, towels and an umbrella were provided.  The staff had a very welcoming attitude and made us feel at home.  I strongly recommend this place, which definitely provides a lot of amenities for the price!
Manager Response: Dear SoonerSteve,  Thank you for your nice comments; we are so happy you enjoyed your weekend with us! We are always striving to remain the best value for the price in Laguna Beach, and we are glad you were able to take advantage of all our great amenities, such as our breakfast buffet, beach service, free parking, and our Rooftop Lounge and K'ya Bistro.  Your feedback is greatly appreciated, and we look forward to hosting you and your wife again.   Warm Regards, Charlotte, Guest Services

Summary: We paid next to nothing for a room here ($110), after hunting down the best deal and using online coupons.  The good stuff- 15 yards from the water, rooftop view of the ocean and town, fridge included in room (was not in the room upon arrival but we called down and they brought one up!) and big shower, town hotspot Kya downstairs, rooftop lounge upstairs, walking distance from shops and dining/takeout/fastfood, hotel offers chairs and umbrella set up for you down at the beach, one free parking space, AMAZING breakfast... fresh eggs, pancakes, sausage, juice bar, coffee, etc- different each day. Not so good stuff-  Ittyyyy bitty room.. my husband is 6'3 and could reach his arms from one side of the room to the other and touch both walls, queen size uncomfy bed, no counter space
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Awesome hotel, great service, cool vibe
Summary: My wife and I loved this hotel.  We celebrated our 9th anniversary and had a blast.  The staff was so friendly and helpful.  We upgraded to one of the surf themed rooms and it was so spacious.  The roof top bar is really cool with great views, but always crowded.  Our room was by the stairs, but we didn't have any noise from it.  It's about a 10-15 minute walk (.8 miles) to downtown, but it makes for a nice stroll with tons of shops along the way.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! We really enjoyed hosting you and your wife for your anniversary, and look forward to the opportunity to have you as guests of our hotel again. So glad to hear you had a great time in Laguna Beach!  Warm Regards, The Staff at La Casa del Camino

Summary: My boyfriend had taken me here for my birthday and we had a great time! It is a 20 second walk to the beach which is one of the least crowded beaches in California I have ever been to. The hotel has a free parking lot which helps the frustration from trying to find your own parking or having to pay for it. The staff was warm and friendly and let us borrow all the beach towels we needed! Hoping to visit again some day :)
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: First Bad Experience at this Hotel - but it was unacceptable
Summary: I have stayed at the Casa Del Camino hotel many times and have had great experiences.  However, my last experience was unacceptable.  I was staying 3 nights.  On my second night ‚Äì my key didn‚Äôt work.   The person at the front desk said my room had been changed (They needed a room with space for an extra bed).  When I went back to my room to move my belongings ‚Äì nothing was in my room!  Someone had come into my room and moved my stuff, including my unpacked toiletries to another room.    This is wrong.  I have never had this experience before.  I wasn‚Äôt sure what, if anything was missing.    I asked to speak with the manager but nobody was available.  They said the manager would call me.  I never heard from them.   I‚Äôm planning on heading back to the area in 2 weeks.  I have
Manager Response: Dear xbfisher,  We have always appreciated your business and your loyalty to our hotel, and we sincerely apologize for this unfortunate misunderstanding.  It was our understanding that, when you checked in to your Surf Suite, you had inquired about moving to a more economical room with a lower rate. We did not have another room available on your first night, but offered to allow you to change rooms the next morning, and you had accepted our offer. Since we had you scheduled to change rooms on your second day (per your request), we had sold the room you were in to another family, and they were scheduled to check in at our check-in time of 3:00pm.  After repeated and  unsuccessful attempts to reach you by phone (and since we had not seen you yet that day), we had a supervisor and a housekeeper assist in transferring your belongings to the room you requested to move to. We sincerely thought that we were acting in your interest, as this was your request from the day before. Again, we are very sorry for this misunderstanding. This situation has been discussed with all front desk staff, and I assure you it will not happen again.  Sincerely,  Charlotte Guest Relations, Casa Resorts, Inc.

Summary Heading: A perfect way to spend our anniversary
Summary: My husband and I just spent our first anniversary at the hotel La Casa Del Camino in Laguna Beach, CA. We chose this hotel because of the beautiful location. The hotel is located only a short walking distance from the beach and our room overlooked the ocean. We were extremely pleased with the service, decor, cleanliness of our room, and dining options offered by the hotel. Our second night we ate dinner at the K'ya Bistro Bar, located on the first floor of the hotel. Not only was the food affordable, but it was among some the best restaurant food we have had. The best part about the affordable/smaller portion option is it gives the customers a chance to try many different things from the menu, instead of just choosing one item from the menu.   My husband and I were sad to end
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Vintage California Hotel makes you think you're in a Turner Classic movie ....
Summary: It's a vintage classic hotel, oozing turn-of-the-century ambiance and class.  But just like classic cars, there are some "days gone by" things you have to deal with, walk ups, slow elevators, short term parking for unloading, and parking is across the street 1/2 block.  That said, almost everything else is pure perfection.  The lobby is loaded with charm with a classic ‚ÄúHotel California‚Äù look, a HUGE inviting, homey fireplace; and a grand piano.  The lobby makes one think a Casablanca-type movie star in a tropical suit will walk in any time to fetch his "glam" girl.  The Rooftop Bar atop the hotel is the hippest place in town to be, filled with equal parts locals and guests -- it is right on the water at the breakers: View FANTASTIC!  Often you can see porpoises or whales
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! We are so happy that you enjoyed our "Hotel California" charm and ambiance. Also, our staff-members really appreciate your shout-outs. We hope to have the opportunity to host you again soon!  Warm Regards,  the staff at La Casa del Camino

Summary Heading: Front desk (Norma Duran) treated us excellent (5 out of 5)!
Summary: Great place to get away: relax! rooftop bar great (but open seating, so some battling for tables between mean old people), excellent beach access and hotel offers beach chairs. It is an older hotel = smaller rooms, but well worth trade to be on the beach and walking distance to endless good food!
Manager Response: Thank you for your nice review! We are so happy you were able to take advantage of our Rooftop Lounge - it is truly a gem in Laguna Beach. We understand some of our rooms can be a little "cozy," but we feel it adds to the Old-World charm of our historic hotel. I would like to let you know that we have several suites and larger guest rooms available if you prefer more space to move around in, just inquire with the front desk on your next visit. We hope to have the opportunity to host you again soon!  Sincerely,  Charlotte Guest Relations, Casa Resorts Inc.

Summary Heading: Pros and cons: Quirky hotel with great beach location and 2 fun bars
Summary: We stayed at this hotel for two nights with friends in March celebrating my friend's birthday....Here are some pros and cons for you:  Pros:  - Great location - a few steps away from the beach!  - large, clean room (we upgraded to a deluxe king - but non-view). The weather was spectacular, and we were not in the room very much and felt we did not really need a 'view.' - Great, friendly, happy and accommodating staff. Very nice people here!  - comfortable bed - good sized bathroom and shower  - very good continental breakfast in the a.m. in the lobby - beach chairs and towels offered for free at the front desk. And a nice bellman to carry them down to the beach for you. - Very cool rooftop deck and bar - it's a fun hotel with a lot going on....BUT Consider yourself warned - get
Manager Response: Thank you for your review... we are happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay in our "Quirky and fun" hotel! Regarding your notes about the guest rooms located in the hallway, adjacent to the Lobby, near the restrooms - We just wanted to clarify that these are not actually guest rooms, but offices and storage rooms! We are all too aware of how busy our restrooms can get and have taken as many precautions as possible to minimize the impact of our popular restaurants on our hotel guests. Rest assured there will never be a guest scheduled to stay in one of the rooms adjacent to the restrooms. Again, thank you for your candid comments, and we look forward to the opportunity to host you again.

Summary Heading: A fun place to stay and collect memorable experiences!
Summary: We booked this boutique style hotel through on-line research and decided to give it a shot.  The sunset watching crowd  (to which we belong) raved about the roof top bar at the Casa Del Camino.  Well, the sunsets were great and the mix of people was a bonus.  Be there early if you want a seat or table.    But -If you don't want the high-style Laguna Beach crowd bar scene, just wall a half block to the Cress Street Beach.  Watch the sun go down from the top of the cliff or walk down the steps to the beach.  (From the hotel, you can walk to a number of small public beaches - some with really good tidal pools).   Whale watching is a definite possibility from each spot.  Bring good binoc's.  I saw southbound grey's and some porpoises.  The standard room we had was VERY small - and
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: total experience w/ lots of unexpected great surprises
Summary: Have stayed here several times previously and we are pleasantly surprised every time! Alhough Hotel la Casa del Camino sits in perfect part of Laguna Beach, we find it hard to go elsewhere. Rooftop deck provides great ocean view, sunsets, party, fresh air, outdoor bar and great food. But K'ya, the bistro and bar downstairs on Coast Hwy offers a completely different feel and alternative menu (including $3 and $5 small plates that make a total meal and the food is creative and DELICIOUS). Great happy hour deals too. Then there's the comfortable & relaxing lobby, decorated w/ style and warmed by a big fireplace in front of which new friendships seem to form between strangers every 5 minutes. we met people from all over the US and around the world who we still consider friends.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Nice hotel - a real gem in Laguna Beach
Summary: I wanted to take this opportunity to highlight the friendly and helpful staff.  Especially the front desk receptionist Norma.  The hotel has a really good vibe to it, nice combination of old world charm and modern amenities.  Started the day with a nice buffet style breakfast in the lobby area.  The rooftop bar is a good place to relax at the end of the day.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Outside, Lobby, roof top,restaurant and location are awesome(period). This place is well visited by the locals and travelers. As for the rooms? It appears that the interior decorator was on crack or needed some! I could say much about the color schemes, but that would take away from the tiny, non-welcoming , uncomfortable, and uncoordinated decor and laid out living spaces. Yet, having stayed here for 5 nights I must admit that the positives out weigh the negative rooms.  They could charge 3x the price if they simply hired professionals to face lift the rooms.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Beautiful Rooms and Wonderful Food at the Beach
Summary: I had the pleasure of staying at this boutique hotel in Laguna Beach three times over the months of November and December.  I absolutely fell in love with it and would not mind living in the suite I stayed in.  My experiences with the front desk staff was nothing more than first class.  The suite I stayed in was state of the art, with every electronic gizmo you could ask for in a hotel room, the art work and design were outstanding including the wine refrigerator, did I already say  I would like to live there.    The Happy Hour at both the Rooftop and Kya are outstanding!  The views from the Rooftop are stunning with wonderful staff that make you feel at home and offer blankets during breezy evening.  The Happy Hour at Kya has the most delicious food offering in town with a
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: A Wonderful bit of "Old School Laguna".
Summary: My family and I spent Thanksgiving and Christmas at the hotel. The hotel is very charming with the flavor of times past at  the beach. The location was wonderful, steps from the beach. The food in C'Ya resturant was delicious (Happy hour was an especially good value ).The staff was especially helpful even providing extra cooking items for me to cook Thanksgiving dinner.We also enjoyed the quiet view atop the hotel of a breathtaking California coastline.I could go on but I recomend you visit yourself.I can't wait for summer to come so I can book it again.  :)
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: On awesome hotel to rest your head!
Summary: I stayed in the Billabong Suite and it was...SWEET!  The design was great.  Wonderful shower.  Great rooftop restaurant with an incredible view.  My favorite thing?  THE STAFF!  I felt like I was home the second I arrived.  I so look forward to trying another suite on my next visit.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My husband and I have stayed at La Casa del Camino a couple of times and every time we go it just gets better. From the front desk to house keeping. Everyone is pleasant and very good at their jobs. The roof restaurant was so nice and K'ya bistro has such a great variety of foods.  The only thing missing was a Mexican beer which I prefer.  And if that's the worst thing that I can say I guess it was fabulous.  Thank you to the entire staff.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Wonderful location and value. Restaurant is tops, also.
Summary: W had a family wedding on the rooftop deck overlooking the Pacific. Everything went great in large part to the staff at the hotel. The event planner and Norma at the desk did everything to make it a great weekend. The retaurant is top quality, the rooms , although small, are spotless,  In the heart of Laguna B, a few steps from the beach, with restaurants and shopping all around. This is a great hotel value.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We have stayed here twice to celebrate family milestones with my extended (24 people) family.  You can watch directly to the beach from the hotel without worrying about the safety of small children.  The staff -- especially the owner -- are incredibly friendly and helpful, which was much appreciated by this insomniac.  We walked  to several local restaurants and the "downtown" area of Laguna, which is really one big tourist trap.  We enjoyed using the top patio for the view and wine drinking.  The owners let us bring in my father's homemade wine without any fuss.    We loved the location and the feeling of having a huge family home on a beautiful beach for a weekend.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We were driving back to Los Angeles from spending the holidays in San Diego and were saw the rooftop bar and thought it would be nice to have a glass of wine and watch the sunset.  We called the hotel and were offered a great rate on a newly renovated themed room with ocean views.  We decided to stay for the night on a whim.  The staff was so nice and friendly.  We had our dog and they even accept pets.  We had such a great time at the hotel that we have been back several times since.  We even brought in the New Year at La Casa Del Camino.  The rooms are all different themed and so cool. The restaurant has amazing food and it reasonably priced.  The views from the rooftop bar are priceless.  I recommend the sangria. I am in the hospitality industry and work at a luxury.  I think
Manager Response: none

Summary: Staff nice on phone / at desk not very welcoming. Free parking caddy corner behind a building. Lobby loud for late Wed night. Room not where/what asked for - very small & main window opened to highway & above outdoor bar - not quiet. Quaint room/bed w/ceiling fan provided nice comfy sleep. Could not totally close bathrm window. Old TV set as if in dr's office. Although we already paid for 2 nts, packed up & decided to check out 1 day early at their normal time & voiced dissatisfaction w/person I booked over phone. She did refund for the next night, but I was surprised that since we were planned to stay 2 nights that she offered no other room nor asked what I would like instead/in lieu. Disappointing all around. Will not go there nor will I recommend this hotel. Word of mouth
Manager Response: none

Summary: If you are planning on partying all night this is the place for you because the music in the lobby plays until 2 am and you can hear it in every room.  Also, the restrooms for the restaurant/bar are by the rooms so you have a line of drunks waiting outside your room to go to the bathroom and it smells like some did not want to wait any longer so just peed directly in the hallway.  There is no seperation for the rooms so bar patrons wonder through the hallways at all hours of the day.  I got 0 sleep the night I stayed here and will never return.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We have been to La Casa Del Camino on three occassions. We just love the hotel. We bring our  two Yorkies and they are so nice to all of us. The service is wonderful, people are friendly and we love our room that looks onto the ocean. The staff is ownderful. They will take your chairs to the beach and pick them up for you. We go for my birthday and this year the owner sent me flowers, chocolate and champagne to our room. You are right off the beach, wonderful restaurant, great rooftop bar and clean quaint hotel.  Norma and Ashley have been wonderful.  We cant wait to go back again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: If  you want quality service from the hotel staff, you will not find it here! Short mexican girl with glasses who claims to pose as the general manager is a joke!  Has no skill in customer service. Our group of 8 decided to leave when she told us not to park at the hotel parking area. This was a rude awakening when we had reservations and when we called the person who took the reservation told us to park there. Hmmm! Management smoking too much weed here? It's a gamble here! Good luck!

Summary Heading: Paying for location, not the room
Summary: We stayed at this hotel in June '10. We've been to many hotels in Laguna Beach and thought we'd give this one a try since we enjoy the restaurant K'ya in the hotel and the rooftop bar is a fun spot for a drink. Turns out, it was easy to stay here as we enjoyed the above and didn't have to leave the hotel, and the beach was just right below our room.  Everything very easy to do without driving or stress....however, the room was terrible. The bed was lousy, the mattress must have been 100 yrs old. The sink for the bathroom was in our room and the shower and toilet in the "bathroom". The television looked to be from the mid-'90's and was mounted up in a corner of our room like it would be in a hospital. Basically, if you do stay here it's not to enjoy the room. It's for other

Summary Heading: Noisy day and night, at least on weekends- stay away
Summary: I will start with the good, it has a hopping fun bar scene and lots of charm, yet, since one of the main things you do at a hotel is sleep, I cannot recommend this hotel.  It is the loudest place I have ever tried to sleep. When I complained, they said they only have a few quiet rooms, and they are all were taken. The one person bathrooms to one of the most popular bars are directly across the small hall from rooms 201 and 202. This means people are having conversations in the hall until it closes at 10.  (meaning they are hanging out until about 11) The roof top bar is accessed by walking thru all the hall ways and climbing the stairs. Meaning drunk people, and I have nothing against drunk people, are stomping thru your hallway.  Additionally, the charming hard wood floors are
Manager Response: none

Summary: Okay we stayed here for 5 nights, 3 in a regular queen sized room and 2 in the quiksilver suite. The regular room was great, a little small but still amazing for the price that we paid ($90 a night, you cant find a Days Inn for that price anywhere nowadays) and we did have our 11 mos old daughter with and she slept in our playpen but they did offer cribs. Again the only negative was it was a little small and it only had a shower, but overall it was very beautiful. We upgraded to the suite later cause they have 10 surf themed suites and it was only an extra $50 a night weekdays so it was totally worth it (the hubby loves surfing!). The suite was awesome, much more spacious and great views. Again, only had a shower but this one was huge! K'YA the in hotel bistro is freaking

Summary Heading: Great hotel, nice location, good dinner, still working out glitches in reservation system.
Summary: Overall, our stay was great.  We were there for a quick getaway, one night, December 30.  The hotel's location can not be beat, and the dinner was tasty.  We really enjoyed the piano music by the fireplace.  However, there were two points that could be improved:  I used the hotel website for the reservation, and the front desk had trouble locating it.  Luckily, I printed it, and that cleared it up.  Also, although the dinner was great, the breakfast was disappointing, because the food was cold.  Again, for the most part, the visit was great.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is one of the worst hotels I have ever stayed at.  Do not expect to sleep well because the rooms are incredibly noisy.   The owners like to have you reserve one room and then give you another one when you show up.  Also, the rate for the room you book and the rate for the room you get may change.  To be fair, the location is nice and the rooftop patio is really enjoyable.  Mostly, this hotel was simply over priced for what you get.  I'm a huge fan of boutique hotels, but skip this one!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: A fun, relaxing, and romantic place where fun loving people stay
Summary: My husband wanted to enjoy our last summer getaway somewhere which offered close walking distance to the beach,  great food and drinks with a view, and a comfortable, clean and friendly atmosphere.  His research brought us to La Casa Del Camino in Laguna Beach.  What a wonderful find!!!  We had driven by this place many times and wondered about it.  We were fortunate to have found a table to enjoy the great appetizers and drinks on The Rooftop (which is always busy) and to toast the sun dipping into the ocean.  We then ventured downstairs to k'ya for a very delicious dinner which was served by the very charming and helpful waitress Liz, Liz, Liz.  Our wonderful morning breakfast from k'ya restaurant was delivered to us on The Rooftop for a sparkling ocean view.  Later we walked
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at La Casa Del Camino for a week in September, nothing at all to complain about. It's in a great location on PCH, close enough to everything, and just a few yards from the beach. We were in the cheapest room, you pay more for the view which we didn't have, but it had all the ameneties we wanted (a/c, refrigerator, tv, cd/radio/alarm) and it and the bathroom were kept very clean. Excellent (and cheap) restaurant downstairs and live music in the lobby. Could get noisy in early evening but we didn't see this as a negative, it just added to the friendly atmosphere. Amazing rooftop terrace bar, great ocean views. Not much in the way of 'business' facilities, but the front desk tried to accomodate as much as possible. Would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My fianc√© (32) and I (30) stayed at La Casa del Camino for two nights as part of our three-week California tour and we can definitely recommend it. The location is great - it's very close to a beatiful beach and close to shops and restaurants in Laguna. The rooftop lounge has a breathtaking view and we loved the small-dish menu in the hotel's own restaurant. The food was also excellent. However, it was really loud there - if you mind noise, you need to dine somewhere else.They had live music on the piano both nights in the lobby and the atmosphere was really fun and exciting. We chose a room in the basement which didn't have a view but was very spacious and had really beautiful, antique-looking furniture. Nicer than my own furniture at home, actually :-) I couldn't think of a

Summary Heading: The La Casa Del Camino Hotel, Laguna Beach, Ca.
Summary: I stayed at this hotel 9/6/09 to attend a wedding there.  The employees  @ front deskk were unorganized, didn't know anything about the wedding .  The server in bar on top of bulding left with my cc card to "serve" at another part of the building.  Bartender said to "go find her". Thats what I want to do is go look for my server.   There's no ice machine , had to finad someone to get me ice.   The hotel & restaurant are seperate & don't communicate. Employees are very young & inexperienced with customer service issues.  Owner isn't interested either.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Stylish, Vintage, and Hip!  All around great hotel!
Summary: I arrived in Laguna on 08-28-09 for the Pageant of the Masters and was initially not intending to stay the night in Laguna.  We called Casa Del Camino and the guy at the front desk said they had  a king room available for $189.00 a night (that's cheap in Laguna).   We walked into the lobby and were greeted by the person we talked with on the phone.  He asked us if we wanted to see the room before we made our decision.  He gave us the key and directed us to the room.  The rooms are nothing fabulous, and this is an old hotel.  But that's one of the wonderful experiences of this 1927 structure. You do get the feeling of an old Hollywood retreat here!  After checking in, we went to the rooftop bar and had lunch and beers while sitting on the deck overlooking the ocean.  The staff
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Ocean view from basement quality loft
Summary: Rent this expensive loft on pacific coast highway if you don't need: silverware for the kitchen, functioning ceiling lights, a phone, quiet from the blaring music  in the business below you, a clean grill, a non-peeling deck and a responsive management. Never has so  much been paid for so little.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My husband and I stayed at the La Casa to celebrate his birthday and Father's Day.  I booked the Euro Suite for $200 a night.  The couch was tattered, the refrigerator door  had severe discoloring, no wash towels in room,  ceiling fan did not work, and no covering on electrical outlet. The ironing board and iron are stored under the bed.  How tacky is that?  Lobby was crowded and very noisey.  One of the windows in our room would not stay up so one of the hotel employees came and propped the window up with a rolled up blanket. Tacky!  On a previous review it was stated that the hotel had been upgraded.  I would hate to have seen it before the upgrade.  The only good thing about the hotel was the view and staff was friendly.  I would never stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great location, lovely lobby with cozy fireplace and piano player, clean, clean, clean room!  Nice matress, quality linens.  Very pleasant staff.  We were only there one night and hated to leave!!  So much charm and so affordable.  Our room was small but very comfortable and adequate.  T'was a bit noisy at night, because that side of the hotel abuts a street that leads directly to the beach, but staff is so accomodating that they'll bend over backwards to make you happy!  Appealing restaurant in-house (didn't try), and Internet access free in lobby.  You truly can't go wrong with this one.  A gem in the heart of  the glorious Laguna Beach!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Nice place but could do better
Summary: Stayed here with 2 small kids plus extended family & friends Breakfast good Dinner very good - they have special deals early in the evening Beware the piano playing entertainment - it was too loud  Alas our room had no info in it about what they offered eg beach towels, internet, food service times etc They do offer a childrens' menu plus crayons etc but we only discovered this on the third day.  Very annoying as we'd effectively been overcharged on the previous days plus the crayons kept the kids quiet.    Our room was nice and a reasonable size but the towel rails were in silly places eg not near the bath, over the loo etc

Summary Heading: Absolutely in love with this hotel!
Summary: I stayed at the La Casa Del Camino in Feb. for a nice weekend getaway and fell in love! My parents live in Laguna and suggested the hotel. I heard the rooms were on the small side but I though mine was perfect, it gave it a home-like elegance. The rooftop terrace is perfect for lunch, overlooking the endless ocean view.. which is BREATHTAKING! The rooms are clean and the service is impeccable with the niccest staff. I will definitely stay here when I come back to visit!

Summary: As OC locals, we wanted a get-away weekend, so we booked the Superior Queen Room at La Casa Del Camino, which was described as a "corner room which offers a great view of the rolling coastline, these rooms offer a little more room that the deluxe, but maintain their intimate appeal."    When we got there, we had to enter through the side entrance because there was an event that day. Our promised oceanview room turned out to be a very tiny room with a small window that views the side of an adjacent building... and this was supposed to be one of the most expensive and attractive rooms available.   When we spoke to the front desk, they claimed that not all superior rooms have oceanviews. We ended up insisting on a refund because we can get a better room at a motel than the

The majority of our guests find the hotel charming and quaint as you can see from our review.  I do hope that you will give us another opportunity...  Regards,  La Casa del Camino...

Summary: My wife and I were married on the rooftop on 07/07/07.  Our wedding/guest planner Jessica went out of her way to make sure everything was perfect.  The food was amazing!!  The staff was always helpful.  The room was beautiful.  We go back to the hotel every wedding anniversary and enjoy a drink on the rooftop then we enjoy dinner at K'ya.

Summary: Bungalow on Hwy 101 very loud. Fan didn't work Office was going to "research it" which meant it didn't get fixed.  Reported Xmas money in gift envelopes taken out of my carry-on in bath.Nothing was done..no apologies. Emailed manager of La Casa Del Camino and still no response.  Breakfast was wonderful in restaurant located 3 blks away.

Summary: We came across this place through trip advisor forum.  We could not have been more pleased with our experience here.  Unfortunately we were only here for one night but I must say this was one of the most nostalgic places we've ever stayed.  When walking through the front door you realize you've made the right choice.  We had lunch on the rooftop - awesome views!!  First time on the West Coast and I must say we were most impressed.  The rooms were not what I expected but very clean and I realize they are trying to keep with the theme of the place.  Lobby area with fireplace and cush sofas are a great place to enjoy a glass of wine.  Many locals come here for the sunset views so you know it's good when the locals come!!  The town of Laguna is so quaint and not what I expected at
Manager Response: momonthegoAthensGa,  Thank you for your great comments regarding La Casa del Camino!  The rooftop lounge is the most beautiful view of the Pacific Ocean and the Hills of Laguna Beach!  Our hotel was built in the early 1900's so we did try our best to keep the charm, while updating the amenities for 09!  Thank you for your business and we look forward to seeing you again soon!!!!  Regards,  La Casa del Camino!!!!

Summary: I was so impressed with the staff at this hotel!  The hotel itself is quaint and full of character.  The roof-top terrace is popular with locals and is quite the scene on the week-ends!  The food was outstanding especially the huge breakfasts.  Nickolas and Norma were wonderful and the room was spacious  and well appointed.  I loved the down comforters and the huge amount of pillows.  The housekeeping department  did a nice job of keeping the room looking fresh. I  would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to be in the center of things, and who likes a good standard of service. I will definitely be returning soon!!
Manager Response: deejay21,  Thank you for your compliments for La Casa del Camino!  We do pride ourselves on our service and I will make sure Nick and Norma hear your kind words...  Our Rooftop Lounge is one of the most popular attractions for Laguna and our food, service enhance the sunset view from the Pacific Ocean!  We look forward to seeing you again soon!  Regards,  La Casa del Camino...

Summary: The hotel was built in 1929 so the room was small AND that is the way rooms were in 1929. The hotel was also spotless, tastefully refurbished and totally charming. When built, it was an icon of Laguna Beach and has much of that same tone today. We understand that the new owner lives on the property so it is obvious he is very hands on. The manager had just joined the staff when we visited. He is from several generations of hotel and restaurant ownership in South Africa. His old world, professional touch is also apparent.    ALL of the staff were friendly, cheerful and seemed to genuinely care that we had a wonderful vacation. Jessica, at the front desk, helped us find sight-seeing attractions and great restaurants and went through their menus giving us suggestions. Others behind
Manager Response: MoviemakerLasVegas,  Thank you for your kind words for La Casa del Camino...  I will ensure all your great words get passed onto the team and assure you that we will only continue getting better!  Thank you for the business and we look forward to seeing you again soon!  Regards,  La Casa del Camino...

Summary: My husband,and I stayed at the La Casa Del Camino for a total of five days over labor day weekend.The website looked very nice,and we had a wedding to attend in the area. When we checked in the staff was very friendly,and helpful,but when we got to our room it was clean,but very old and small.The ironing board,and iron were under the bed!!  There was a wedding going on one night,and it sounded like elephants running upstairs,just awful!We paid alot of $$$$ to stay here,and I never would recommend it.plus the locals hanging out in the front of the hotel at night is very scary!! The only plus was the restuarant in the hotel!!Never again.
Manager Response: caeley,  I am sorry that you experienced what you did.  The hotel was built in the late 20's and we tried to keep the "historical" look and feel of the hotel.  Some of our rooms are smaller, however all of them are charming.  I do hope you will give us another opportunity to improve on your experiences...  Regards,  La Casa del Camino...

Summary: After trying to find a room at several other Laguna hotels we struck lucky with this one. We negotiated a great price on a king beach front room which was beautifully and tastefully appointed. The reception staff were outstanding. There's a great restaurant on the roof where we had lunch overlooking the beach. Free parking was across the road and beach towels/chairs were supplied. After returning from dinner in the town the restaurant in the hotel was full with lots of people around the bar. However, there was absolutley no noise in our room apart from the sound of the waves hitting the shore. Breakfast was not included in the price but we ate at a reasonable price in the hotel restaurant. I would definately stay here again.
Manager Response: Wilson080,  Thank you for your compliments about La Casa del Camino!  I assure you the team will be happy to hear of your experiences and look forward to seeing you back in Laguna soon!  Regards,  La Casa del Camino...

Summary Heading: A Beautiful Wedding on the Rooftop Deck
Summary: We had our wedding reception on the rooftop deck last week, and the view up there is absolutely amazing!! What better way to enjoy dinner to the sun setting over the ocean.   The rooftop deck seems like the happening night spot, and was always jam packed with plenty of trendy people.   It is a very charming hotel that is beautifully decorated, and there are always fresh flowers in the lobby. There are several couches so you can just people watch too.   We stayed at the hotel for the weekend in a deluxe room (#107). There wasn't an ocean view because we were on the ground floor, but the room did have hardwood floors, so our dog could stay with us. It was also convenient because it was right next to an exit door so we could take the dog out to do his thing!   The room itself was
Manager Response: noonie04,  Congratulations!  Thank you for your great review for La Casa del Camino!  We pride ourselves on the service and assure you that we will continue making this a great spot for locals and tourists alike...  We look forward to seeing you soon!  Regards,  La Casa del Camino...

Summary: Laguna's Casa del Camino Hotel has beautiful architecture, and a romantic roof top bar, and lobby.  These however, did NOT make up for the fact that several things in the room were either broken, or shabby.  The carpets smelled of mold, and were dirty and stained.  The toilet seat was broken.  The security lock on the door was stuck and would not work, leading to a embarrassing encounter of being walked in on while naked.   I left feeling that this cute hotel was MUCH less than charming.
Manager Response: none

Summary: After a LONG week of business in Anaheim, I stayed here over the weekend before heading to Oregon on more business.  The location is fantastic - can walk to just about whatever I needed or wanted to see or do...great beaches, diners, cafes, spa, bookstore, etc.  The room was very small, but adequate.  I left the windows open and could see and hear the ocean all day and night.  Perfect serenity...except for when the active crowd was going up and down the stairs and halls to the rooftop bar.  A young, good looking crowd always in the lobby and around the hotel.  Speaking of young, I don't think I saw anyone over 35 on staff.  But, they seemed very professional and willing to serve.  The room was adequate for me - traveling alone.  It would be tight quarters for two people, but

Summary: Against my better judgement , I booked a 3 night stay here instead of at the Inn at Laguna Beach. I stayed here about 10 years ago and remembered it as a quaint and quiet getaway. I wish I had shelled out the extra money for The Inn, because this place was awful. The lobby and restaurant are quite charming, but that doesn't make up for the tiny, shabby room we stayed in. The first problem was that our room was on the same floor as the lobby (on the "2nd" floor--DO NOT take a room on the 2nd floor if they offer it to you) I asked for a different room but nothing else was available. We heard every noise from the lobby and even heard kitchen noise from the restaurant.  At night when people want to go up to the rooftop deck, they congregate in the lobby. Combine that with people

Summary: Can you imagine your hotel staff walking in on you and your spouse without knocking during an uncompromising position in bed? Well, it happened to us during what should have been a day for romance called Valentine's Day. When we informed the management, they offered us the following:   1. A free bottle of champagne: I guess to help us celebrate a very embarrassing moment of our life. An obvious no thanks.   2. A free future stay at the hotel: After the feeling your privacy was just violated? I am guessing one incident is not enough in case we need more? Another no.   3. A complimentary meal for two which we graciously accepted.   Overall, I was very disappointed how this crisis was handled because the same manager/supervisor (named Ashley) who offered us the above-mentioned was
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed at this property for 4 days on a business trip to Orange County.  I wanted a change from the usual corporate hotel, and the hotel website touted this property as a "bed and breakfast." In my experience, it was more like a youth hostel.  I would strongly recommend against staying here.    The price does not include breakfast, or even coffee service.  The "Deluxe" room I occupied was clean, but sparse and very small.  It included a queen bed, and a side chair.  That's pretty much it.  No closet, no desk, no central air, no coffee maker, no tub (stand-up tile shower only).  This property seems to have a bit of an identity crisis between its roles as a hotel and a local restaurant/bar/catering spot.  It seems to depend more on the latter, to the detriment of hotel guests.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Had a fab time here in Launa with my wife and kids.  I love Laguna and this hotel just really makes the whole place that much special.  Give me your Hilton's etc - there fine but how man hotel's can you stay in that boost that Bogart stayed there as well.  The room's have a real feel of the 1920's in a good way and the sunset on the roof top just typifies Laguna and what else can you have as a drink non other than a Bombay Saffare and tonic.  Accomoany that with their perfect Shrimp coctail.  The perfect place to stay.

Summary Heading: A Beautiful Gem in laguna beach with Great Service
Summary: We arrived at La Casa del Camino around 2:30pm, check-in time is 3:00.  The staff was more than happy to accommodate us earlier than expected, and even brought our bags to our room for us.  The Front desk checked us in, after offering us a couple bottles of cold water, and explained the amentities of the hotel, including the rooftop Lounge with amazing views of Laguna.  The hotel also has k'ya Restaurant and bar, which offers breakfast, lunch, and dinner, very convenient for the busy traveler.   After checking in and enjoying the beautiful ambience in the lobby with the candles and fresh flowers everywhere you look, we took the elevator to the 3rd floor, where we settled into our beautiful full ocean view room.  After a long day of traveling, seeing a lush king sized bed caused

Summary: Casa del Camino is the Jurassic Park of Hotels.   That doesn't make it all bad, but you want to explore other options before booking it.  On the plus side is location: you can walk out your door and be on the beach in 3-4 minutes, and if you are a morning beach walker as I am, that is worth a great deal.    And my room had an ocean view: another great plus, and I could see waves breaking from my window.   I'll pay a bit for that.   But isn't it time they painted the rooms, added some furniture that did not look like flea market cast offs, rolled in a carpet that didn't look like it had spent a month in the rain, and put light bulbs in the lamps that you could read by?  And I found the staff a bit nonchalant.  Not unfriendly, just blase, and the weekend is a rather boisterous
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Come for drinks at rooftop bar; charming but small rooms
Summary: The hotel has a great location near the center of town and steps from the beach. And the rooftop bar is one of the best spots in the area to enjoy the sunset. The rooms though are a bit overpriced. We had a superior view queen room and paid $169 for a Tuesday night. The room was comfortable and had a partial ocean view, but it was quite small. If you dont mind the size of the rooms, it's a charming place. And the staff were all very friendly.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at the Casa del Camino and had the best room which was very nice,not much space for hanging clothes though.  The room was very clean and a good size.  There was no breakfast included (which it said there was) but a complementary cup of coffee!  It is definitely not worth the price that they charge.    The main downside were the reception staff who seemed young and not very knowledgeable about their hotel.    The other problem is that the hotel has a restaurant and bar which stays open till late which can be quite disruptive if you want to sleep!  The location is lovely however I would not want to stay here for a 2 week holiday!  The price in the restaurant & bar is quite a lot more than you pay elsewhere in town.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great location one block from beach with lots of restaurants and shops in walking distance. No pool. Built in 1927, it's like stepping into days gone by. Very clean room with very comfy, firm bed. Avoid the economy room unless you really want to save money and don't plan to be in the room except to sleep and change clothes. It's for one person and very, very small with one tiny window allowing little sunlight. The bigger rooms are better and have nice windows, hard-wood floors, and a style reminiscent of the 1930s and '40s.   It's cheaper than other hotels in area, but it's not for those who like modern-day hotels with lots of amenities and an up-to-date feel. Hint: Walk one block to Brooks Street to get to the beach, because it has far fewer stairs to the beach than does Cress
Manager Response: none

Summary: We really enjoy the ‚Äúhomey‚Äù feeling during our stay at this hotel.  Although the rooms are not large, it is cozy, clean and warm.  The view from our room (Deluxe Room) and the guest service from the front desk were great and we also enjoyed the history of this hotel. If you are looking for a 5 star fancy hotel, then this may not be a suitable hotel for you. Dining at the on-site restaurant (K‚Äôya) is a must, great food!!!  You might want to inquire about parking before arriving. The bar service at the roof top needs improvement.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel is dated in all aspects. The staff is very freindly and helpful however. The rooms are more than dated and small. We felt like Bela Lugosi would step out of the walls at any second.  They allow dogs which why we stayed there. A bit on the pricy side for room service. Two hamburgers cost $ 39.00 plus tip. We order two meat patties for the dogs and where chagred $ 20.00. The proof in the pudding is would we stay there again and the answer is no chance. There is access to the beach which down a flight of stairs at the end of the street. The beach is so so. Too far to walk to downtown Laguna unless you love walking a couple of miles.  Alot of hidden charges where tack on the bill. I don't know, some may enjoy the old place but it is old and tired and has seen better days.
Manager Response: none

Summary: If you love big hotels with lots of brass and mirrors and superficial glitz - don't go the to Casa del Camino. It is small and quirky and comfortable and interesting. The staff will know you by name and the bartender will know not only your name but your favourite drink as well! It is quiet (if your room isn't on the PCH side) and cosy and an ideal retreat and the restaurant is excellent.  We wouldn't stay anywhere else in Laguna Beach.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The Casa looks great on the web, it's a different story in person. This hotel is NOT ON THE WATER. There are houses between you and the ocean. I booked a "superior room" for the ocean view. To be candid the room was tiny, dated and did not have a clear view of the ocean. It had a clear view of a large tree and the guy pouring cement next door. You had a decent view if you stuck your head out the bathroom window. That aside, the staff is very nice and the breakfast was ok. Downstairs bar and staff were great, if you don't mind the cooks leering at you (and your date) from the kitchen. The rooftop bar is awesome! Wonderful place to watch the sunset, and sip a glass of wine. They have heaters and blankets. My advice ? Skip the overpriced dated hotel, find a real beachfront hotel -
Manager Response: none

Summary: I was really excited to stay at this hotel after hearing great things about the restaurant and roof-top deck.  The lobby was impressive, but the room didn't seem to fit with the rest of the hotel.  I thought it looked a little dated and on the shabby side considering the recent renovation (per the hotel's website).  I love old hotels, but I don't feel like this one is very well taken care of.  I thought this was going to be a "character" hotel with art-deco accents (built in the 30s)- instead it has wooden toilet seats and warn furniture.  Also, the hotel plays music on certain weekday nights, so make sure you are not in a room above the lobby or you will have music thumping through your walls.  That said, I would probably stay here again for the generous continental breakfasts
Manager Response: none

Summary: My husband and I booked the La Casa Del Camino for a friend's wedding in Dana Point.  We were both a bit surprised when we realized that there was no Air Conditioning in the room.  However, with the fans at the window and the ceiling fan, we actually were cold at night.  It was great to hear the ocean to lull you to sleep.  As others have stated the rooms are quite small, but if you are in Laguna Beach, chances are you aren't spending that much time in your room.  We did visit the Savoury's restaurant on the top deck.  The view was stunning, food was OK.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is a bit on the old side. The positives are the location which is literally a block from the ocean. Nice staff and unique design. Like other posters have said the rooms are small. I would guess maybe 300 square feet and that might be generous. Also if you are on the PCH side it is LOUD. Overall we thought it was a little overpriced. WE paid $131 on Hotwire and I dont think I would pay that again. Not a good place for kids, too small and not the right environment. If you like smaller, boutique type properties this might be to your liking. We personally found it to be bit outdated and a little cramped. Also there is a gay bar directly accross the street and is very active. I actually thought the Hotel catered to an alternative lifestyle crowd from all the overflow on

Summary: What a lovely hotel this was. The rooms were beautiful, the service was fabulous and the food was delicious. The beach is right there, along with great shops and restaurants, all in walking distance. I wouldn't stay anywhere else in Laguna Beach!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: You can do a lot better...
Summary: The personable staff and pretty lobby doesn't offset a dingy, crowded room stuffed with furniture, lit by two 40 watt bulbs, sporting a single tiny window filled with a fan.  It also seems that the bulk of travelers who seek dog-friendly hotels have poodle/rooster mixes. Very pricey, and you can only spend so much time on the very nice rooftop before descending into the claustrophobic dens below. Keep looking.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: A blissful wedding  in Europe without leaving California
Summary: From the minute we entered the door, from the hustle and bustle of PCH, we were treated as if we were the only guest in the hotel....like royalty.  Our every desire was catered to, and our every notion was improved upon.  Hence we recommend to the most detail oriented person.  Your desires will be improved upon, from your conception to their completion.  Obviously our stay, how wonderfully short it may have been, I would recommend to all, treat yourself to a taste of the French Riviera, right here in Southern California.  Dining at the Savory's restuarant is a must.  A great selection of wine and champagn.  If you love fish, please try the Catfish and the Seared Tuna Tataki.  The chefs at Savory's are wonderful and prepares tasteful and elegant meals.  Ask to stay at room 305,
Manager Response: none

Summary: Beach lovers, small-town lovers, lonely travelers...this is your home away from home in Southern California!  The owners love their hotel and their guests, and it shows.  I've stayed here two or three times now, and love the place.   Rooftop patio overlooks the ocean, staff is warm and friendly, free internet access via PC in the lobby or in your room, lush bedding.  Staircase to the beach in your backyard, free beach chairs for your use.  (note: it's not really a swimming beach at this spot, but those are nearby)  The rooms are small...so if you want a suite at a chain hotel...well, go to a chain hotel so there will be more room for those of us who like to live locally :)  A word on Laguna Beach as a town: awesome place!  Flower-filled city park overlooks the ocean...play
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hidden treasure in Laguna Beach is absolutely wonderful!  I hosted a meeting for key customers from across the US at the hotel.  Everything was outstanding - the service, the ambience and the location.  The manager, Chris Keller, paid attention to every detail and the meeting was a great success!  Everyone loved the hotel - some even postponed their trips home so they could stay longer!  We had a group dinner in the private dining room - "The Cress Room" and the meal was catered by Savoury's restaurant which is in the hotel.  The meal was fabulous and the setting was perfect.  The meeting was held in the "Catalina Room" and we had breakout sessions on the Rooftop Terrace.  The rooms are very unique, all very different and have a European charm.    I feel so lucky to have
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: FANTASTIC Hotel... thanks to reviewers for the great tip!
Summary: Had to travel to Laguna Beach for business last week and was sick & tired of the overpriced Marriott, Hyatt, etc. so looked on Trip Advisor for something different. La Casa Del Camino had it all-- charm, ambience, views, great service, comfy bed, and overall an experience unique to the scenic and artistic climate of Laguna Beach. Very affordable with freebies you don't get anywhere else in Southern Cal, such as free breakfast and parking. I'll never again stay anywhere but here when I travel to OC. Thanks to everyone for the great recommendation-- I wouldn't have found it without you!
Manager Response: none

Summary: As previously noted, the rooms are tiny. It reminded me of a Parisian hotel of the same class. But they're comfortable--nice pillowtop mattresses, and wonderful down comforters. Spotless bathrooms. And quite frankly, if you go to Laguna and spend much time in your hotel room, it would only be because the weather is bad. Mine was sensational and I couldn't get enough of the place. Laguna is truly a unique location in all of Southern California. Back to the Casa...I got a terrific rate given that the hotel was completely booked. I loved the roof deck. The beach is just down the cul de sac and stairs. I borrowed sand chairs to watch the sunset from there. Just an exquisite experience. Now, for one disappointment which was the very expensive and not nearly-good-enough-to-be-so food
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Had a wonderful stay at a very unique hotel.
Summary: We stayed at the hotel for four nights. Our party took up five rooms, all varying in size and location throughout the hotel. Our room was a little larger than others from our party. We overlooked the small courtyard that had a water feature. This helped drown out some of the highway noise that is troublesome in the front of the hotel. The staff went out of their way to accomodate our needs, getting us beach chairs and towels with a smile and dealing with a noisy neighbor with discretion. I would return to this hotel in a heartbeat. Great location, helpful staff and awesome value. Can't beat the view from the deck.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Felt as though I were back in Florance
Summary: We loved this hotel! It reminded me so of the hotel I stayed at in Florance, Italy! The rooms were small but very very clean and with wonderful little touches! The antique bed, the wonderful bedding, and the overall feel of the hotel definately would make us go back. The only suggestion I would make is to request a room on the 3rd floor facing the ocean as then you will be distanced enough from the street noise. The roof deck is lovely so make sure to have breakfast there!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great location- close to beach, very clean, friendly staff, convenient access to internet, snacks in the lobby. Our room (317) was small but it was an internet special. The bathroom was especially small as the sink was outside the bathroom. We had no ocean view (but did not expect one at the price) just courtyard with babble oF the fountain coming through the bathroom window. Great rooftop deck for sunset and surf watching.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I found this hotel through researching TripAdvisor.com! The staff were polite and very helpful with making reservations and throughout our stay. The hotel itself is immaculate in every way, we loved our room, which had recently been redecorated. Lying in our four poster king-size bed and looking out the window to the ocean was spectacular, as was the sound of the breaking waves. We enjoyed walking into town (not quite 1 mile), and the beach is just at the end of the road. If you want to dine in Savourys the restaurant on the propery, I suggest making a reservation in advance. We couldn't be seated, even though we were guests. We brought our dog with us ($35.00 extra one-off charge).  Continental breakfast is served in the lobby by the fireplace.
